description:
Great hole in the wall spot with a great selection of single malts and wide variety of all kinds of liquors

We stopped by mid week while waiting for our restaurant reservation and the owner, Chris, was very hospitable and friendly

Great ambiance and lovely service
author: Christina K.

description:
Bad staff that treats patrons like crap and abuse their powers. Bouncers are also extremely aggressive and will use excessive force. 

Do not recommend.
author: Hello E.

description:
Femmes beware, this place is a predatory creep zone. On my first visit a few months ago, my friends and I were hounded by a couple of drunk bros the whole time we were there--which is a bummer, but not necessarily reflective of the bar, so I was willing to give Encore another try. 

I was just there again over the weekend, and this time the KJ got defensive and aggro about his rape-y tip jar sign. I said (nicely! friendly! scout's honor) I could help him think of some funnier ideas for a sign, and he said his rape jokes are the only reason he gets tips so I should sit down and not tell him how to do his job.

WELP. That's a hard pass from me, folks. My advice is check out the Mint instead for a way chiller vibe.
author: E P.

description:
Dear Encore,
I'm writing you a breakup review. I just, I just can't with you anymore! 

We had a fabulous past! Oh, how I recall so many rambunctious, thrilling, and just plain FUN nights that ended in fun as hell singalongs at Encore. Man, those were the days.  However, after what my group of friends and I experienced this past weekend truly calls for my resignation as a patron.

It's no lie that the DJ plants members of his entourage to casually dance with regular patrons and to sporadically sing (usually VERY well) their hits. It has been no big deal in the past as they mind their own business and generally keep to themselves. 

Lately, the hired entourage of "extras" has gotten completely out of control! Two male members of the DJ entourage would NOT leave our table of five. One at a time they took turns harassing, interrupting, and annoying us. They didn't encourage us to sing, didn't buy us drinks, and added absolutely no value to our experience. In fact, one guy wouldn't stop touching me even after I asked him not to. He didn't get the message after numerous requests for him to stop. I even got up and sat on the other side of the table. Still, he didn't leave! He admitted that he was paid to be at the bar, wasn't drinking, and was completely aware at how inappropriate his behavior was. After fifteen minutes of us ignoring him, the jerk finally left. He was replaced by another hired "extra"! Again, harassment and annoyance ensued. He didn't even finish or beers and got the hell out of there. 

My group of friends have been longtime fans of Encore and it WAS one of my favorite places to take out-of-towners. NO MORE! 

Encore. Clean up your act. Hiring "extras" to harass loyal patrons is completely ridiculous.
author: Andrea H.

description: Great place to bring friends and family for a great night. Bartenders are friendly and tentative. Security greeted us with smiles and handshakes. Made us all feel welcomed but the best part of it all was the Karaoke Dj, Kj Miles.
author: Mista T.

description:
We had a truly awesome time at Encore Karaoke Lounge! Folks, want the inside scoop on going to a karaoke club? Common sense guides the way, and I am here to help you flesh out the details. Let's take a look at those deets. Good news: all their etiquette and helpful tips are on their website: www.encorekaraokesf.com 

First off, I just want to let you know that YOU are wanted at a karaoke bar or club. That's right you are wanted. Your skills, your charm, your own personal vibe, it's great! 

When you purchase drinks, you contribute in a very modest way to keeping that particular bar running. I drank delicious non-alcoholic beverages by the most lovely, most fab, most helpful Stacey and their charming colleague whose name I did not obtain. And while some do require a cover charge, entry to Encore is free!

The rule is one drink minimum, so have a drink while waiting for songs. Heck, buy another one after that or ask for water and tip the bartender a couple of bucks. It can be alcoholic, or not. I had a cherry lemonade non alcoholic beverage that was very yummy and refreshing, made me sound smooth like Luther Vandross and Selena at the same time! Someone called out "Beyoncé!" at one point which is very generous of them, I'm not sure how that occured since the song was by Thelma Houston, tee hee. Thanks sweeties!

Also, the KJ makes money with your tips. "Egads, you don't say!" you say. Oh I do say. The KJ weaves their magic to make you look and sound spectacular with the right song version, the right key, the right lighting, the right sound balance. A dollar or two is due! It's not too much to ask for the value of making you feel like you have channeled Usher or Whitney Houston or Green Day or Lena Horne for 3.5 minutes. Great KJ'S by the way. We met marvelous Matty who was darned nice and a great facilitator for keeping this feeling like we were part of a show. I didn't get a chance to introduce myself to the evening Saturday KJ who also was really a nice person and just fantastic.

On the karaoke song request slip, please write: 
*your name
*your song title
*the numerical code from the songbook provided
*if you want the song's key changed you can provide that info, too
*use the songbooks for the codes instead of the website

Know that your bartenders, KJ, and bouncer work hard. Encore Karaoke Lounge in particular has a great sound system, super gobo's/lighting, and clean bright bathrooms that look like you're in a nice hotel bathroom! Shucks I felt like I stepped into Embassy Suites when I went to powder my nose. 

I see it from the biz point of view, having worked in retail for many moons as a wee babe. Taking control of a biz with inebriated folks is not easy. As a sober observer at many a karaoke stint, I can attest to witnessing drunk or even just buzzed people get mad for almost nothing when it's their own dang fault.

And even if you are sober, you may forget to do something and the KJ will assertively tell you what needs to be done, because he knows you need clear simple instructions when you are in a loud place with lots going on. 

By the way, one of us didn't know to write in the code but it was no big deal. He simply wrote the code, and guess what? He then sung songs because our friend was laid back and followed instructions with respect. He made it easy for them to do their jobs.

They have to make sure everyone follows general protocol so they are able to easily (key word: easily) keep everyone SAFE and HAPPY, so make it easy. If you follow their rules, know your limits, be friendly, introduce yourself to establish rapport and good communication, you'll be fine. And if you mess up somehow be friendly and say you're sorry, do the right thing. As in life my friends, as in life. 

We sang, danced and networked for more singers to join our friendly happy crew. Join us next time!
author: Monique M.

description: This place was recommended to me by a friend who is a local. Great bartender, rude Karaoke DJ.
author: Jen D.

description: Probably the best KJ ever!!! Best management and bartenders I ever did meet. The atmosphere is exactly what I needed to keep my buzz going!! CHEEHOO!!
author: Mafi K.

description: The guards at this property are prejudice and cant tell between a  criminal and a life guard
author: Etevise L.

description:
I was looking for my ID to get into this place last night when I was assaulted by the bouncers. I was choked, pushed down the stairs, physically thrown outside, then when I was attempting to get up I was hit in the face. 

This was because I could not find my ID, and they asked me to leave the entryway but I didn't leave quickly enough. 

If you go to this place realize that the people who are hired to work there do not value your safety and likely get pleasure from beating up drunk patrons
author: Jonathan K.

description:
This place is a little divey, but it's friendly, with a well-mixed crowd on pretty much any nite. The best nites are Sunday through Tuesday because of Lee and Vu. The song books are old, and so are the songs in them, but Lee's got the hookup!

... and remember to tip your bartender and KJ!
author: Sarahbella D.

description: Ken was amazing very invested in getting people the drinks they were looking for, while serving a smile and accommodations. Didn't get to sing my song but the service was so fun and accommodating it almost didn't matter. If you want attentive bartenders who are nice and easy going you'll want to go here!
author: Chrissy H.

description: Unless you want to part with a $20 tip for the KJ on a Friday night, don't bother. It's a shame as it's in a great location in the Polk neighborhood. Go to Pandora in the TL instead
author: s y.

description:
DO NOT EVER LEAVE YOUR CREDIT CARD HERE. On Saturday, I forgot my credit card because I had it there for a tab.

I wasn't able to come back the next day, so I had planned to head there as soon as I could. The day I planned to head over, I received a text from my credit card company.

Someone had used my card to rack up about $3000+ in charges at Apple, a liquor store (twice), Postmates, City Bike Share, a travel agency, and Hotel Tonight. They also attempted to add it to their Android phone's pay system.

Thankfully, I filed a report and got my charges reversed, but I must warn everyone. Apparently, you can't trust them to hold on to your card. AVOID USING A CREDIT CARD HERE. And if you have to, DO NOT LEAVE A TAB. And if you MUST leave a tab, DO NOT EVER, EVER, EVER leave your card here.
author: Jina A.

description:
I was physically assaulted and thrown down the stairs and need the owner to contact me immediately.  A lawsuit will follow. 

If there is anyone else that has experienced this on yelp please contact me at encoreassaults@gmail.com

We need to solve this issue before it gets any worse.
author: Laurel W.

description:
Assulted by staff. Friday night KJ is a piece of shit that pushed me when I demanded my tip back after waiting 2 hours for my song to come on.  Aggressive and violent security attacked me and threw me down entire flight of stairs when I wasn't resisting and trying leave. Mike, the only name I got, and his security crew are simply looking for a chance  to hurt somebody.  After waking up in pain today I will be seeking medical attention so that's fucking awesome.

 You better watch out. you better not cry. you better not pout I'm telling you why. Santa Claus is coming to town.  Cheers and go fuck yourselves.  Just read another review describing a very similar experience. Class fucking act here.
author: Michael B.

description:
The horribly pretentious bartender with the painted fingernail needs to have a bad acid trip and ego death his way back into reality. 

Pros:
-My friend Spencer got to sing

Cons:
-Spencer paid $20 to sing immediately after 2 hr wait
-Everyone else in my group did not get their song called after 3 hrs
-$10 minimum on cards, absolutely no tabs 
-gotta tip your KJ to sing
-bartender with painted nail is stuck up and belittling 
-chicken tendies were dropping from the ceiling 
-pacman game ate my quarters
author: Miranda M.

description:
All in all, this is a quality bar, that mostly is known for their karaoke. It's a fun spot, but unfortunately their bartenders seem to sing more songs than the customers, which is always a little strange. I get that bartenders should absolutely be having a fun and tipsy time, especially when you're doing karaoke, but the people getting paid to be there shouldn't be getting more stage time than the people paying to be there. Just my opinion.

The drinks are alright, well-mixed, but the signs are misleading. This bar is risking a false advertising suit, but at least it's small claims right? When they say any mix, they really don't mean any mix. There's a chance you'll be charged extra for a drink than what is advertised, and you'll be too tipsy to notice or care. To be frank I wouldn't have tipped if I hadn't noticed they charged extra for an advertised drink than posted. 

The karaoke selection is better for older songs (80s-90s) but has a decent selection of more recent songs as well.

If they had done a few things differently this could've been a much better karaoke bar. The customers should be up there more than the bartenders though. I've been to plenty of karaoke bars where they realize this.
author: Mike P.

description:
Matty, the svelt bartender, gave us the most wonderful, award-winning pineapple upside down shots. He was hilarious and entertaining.

We were walking back to the office from a work happy hour and stumbled upon this gem. What a happy accident! :)

I am leaving this review mainly so I can remember to come back.

Karaoke starts at
8pm Monday-Thursday
5pm on Friday
4pm Saturday
author: Kiona P.

description:
If you know the ppl who work here, you will get special treatment... you don't know anybody, well then you are not welcome. We came here at 9pm and didnt get to sing one song (from our group of 6ppl) till closer to 11:30pm. At the same time we kept seeing the same ppl go up stage song after song. As well as ppl who came to the bar, way after we did, go up and sing. Also drinks are over price. The bar staff was nice though, but the Dj totally power trip... over some karaoke. 

*Saturday Night, bar was pretty empty.
author: Anjani V.

description: Horrible place with physically abusive staff. This yelp page is filled with reviews which say the same.
author: Anthony T.

description: WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT VISIT THIS BAR! I had the most awful and disgusting experience last weekend. I witnessed the bartender attack a female customer. CORRECT, a FEMALE customer. I am not sure why the male bartender assaulted the customer, but the whole ordeal started due to a racist and disgusting "Hail, Hilter" song. Our group was in disbelief that this was happening and they would allow/play or even HAVE this song. Someone from our group was going to go up and ask them to change the song, but we saw another group ask. All of a sudden we see a fight happen, leading with police arriving at the scene. If this whole situation couldn't get worse and witness a male bartender assalt a female customer, the police did not charge the bartender with any crimes. We will never come back to this place and I hope you chose not to either.
author: Lauren C.

description: "GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE" were the words of the DJ WHO DEMANDED MONEY before he played any song for us. We bought drinks for 4 hours and the bar tenders would advise us to bribe him with money to get our songs played. If you go he will never look at you in the eyes. He is constantly on his cell phone and he makes you feel like he is doing you FAVOR .
author: Susanita F.

description:
The karaoke DJ was a quite incompetent and rude asshat. But FURTHERMORE, this bar does not care about its patrons, please see below.
Now....I don't think it's a bar's responsibility to watch after us. However, women or those who identify as women are the hardest group to get to go to a bar because we often feel creeped out or unsafe.

I went to this bar on my vacation and ALONE. So just was willing to trust them. Bars in my city  (San Diego) have made sure to make their patrons feel safe.

This bar could care less.

I arrived and met two new friends. They were quite nice. But they noticed a girl at the bar that night was highly intoxicated and being creepily poached by two guys, one of which kept trying to buy her drinks. Thinking it would be an easy solution, we alert the bartender, who says, "if she can't drink, she can't be in my bar". He was way more concerned about making money than making sure his bar was safe and fun. He has security kick her out and then they eventually beat the shit out of the guy who was trying to keep her from being taken advantage of. It. Was. horrifying!!!! I've never heard of a bartender just not giving a shit about a girl who is being taken advantage of in the bar. I felt disgusting and scared and worried and grossed out, none of which I want to feel on vacation  (...unless you're into that).

Then, a group of zealous white people sang a song about nazis. Then the karaoke dj fucked up my song request. Then I sang and got the hell out of there. (It wasn't until this point that I realized the guy who was attempting to help the drunk girl got beat up by security.)

I wish I could say it was misunderstanding but the guy helping was not drunk. I wish I could say it was business but good business is to want your patrons to feel safe in your bar. I wish I could say it was busy but it wasn't even that packed and none of the above should have happened.

STRANGEST. MOST JARRING. KARAOKE EXPERIENCE EVER. and I've sang a GRIP of karaoke.

10/10 would NOT RETURN HERE. AHHHH!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
No bueno... The guy playing the songs (I'm going out of my way not to call him a DJ) is rude as heck and acts like he's doing you a favor by taking your song ticket. Then the wait begins, and you see people who signed up after you sing before you. Don't sign up for more than a few songs or he'll tell you to wait, too. Song selection wasn't bad and the bartender was cool though. 

Highlight of the night - the song jockey telling us to 'get the fuck out' over his mic when we got a little rowdy and chanted for our friend to sing. What a prick. 

I'm sure you can find a better place to go to, dear Yelper.
author: Syl D.

description:
Bad experience. Immediately when we walked in the bartender was pressuring us to buy a drink for a kareoke song and then when we walked up with papers of song requests and the kareoke guy was insisting on a dollar per song. So this was weird because there was just a tip jar but we paid the price ($5 for 5 songs). The guy said it would take a while but we waited a good bit for our songs at the empty place (ironic). They threw out one song request bc our friend's name was on them to sing two songs (and that wasn't allowed). I wonder if they threw away the $1 for a song too? -___-
 By the time we were going to leave they had only played 1 of our songs. I was asking what they do in the scenario where we tip but don't receive services. He gave me a huge attitude how some people pay more to hear him play their songs (for what, I have no idea, you're literally just pressing play man and you have a hardcore attitude that needs to chill TF out...) He then played another song of ours and then we just left with not asking for any other tip back because it wasn't worth arguing with this man. We were just taken aback by this place and especially the kareoke guy's customer service. Never coming back here again. Rude AF.
author: Daniela B.

description: Hey, guess what? I went to inquire about the order of a song request and the DJ told me he doesn't care if I'm a female or a minority and I shouldn't go around acting like I'm "all that". He was so rude and disrespectful. Shame on this organization for hiring someone like him. I am leaving the birthday of my closest friends b/c that man is a disgrace to social graces...No one should ever be treated like that, ever.
author: Meera S.

description: The absolute worst karaoke bar in town. Its dirty, its ugly, and the bouncers act like thugs. Stay away
author: Andy T.

description: Terrible karaoke lounge. We put a dollar on our song request and the dj threw them out and never played our songs. Very rude and did not have a good time. I'll never go back here again.
author: Conor M.

description: The bouncers and staff abuse patrons. See the many reports here and also view KRON4 news. Do not visit this establishment !
author: Kevin P.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday recently and had a horrible experience. We arrived just before 10pm and put in our song requests promptly, but waited over 2.5 hours before any of our names were even near the top of the list. I tried multiple times to explain to the "DJ" that it was our friend's birthday and she specifically came to conquer her fear of singing in public, but he honestly couldn't care less. He was too busy moving other people up on the list in front of her as long as they threw him a couple dollars. I'm sorry but I refuse to tip someone who doesn't actually provide any sort of service, other than pressing a button, and who had been such a dick to us all night. 

I made the mistake of leaving my tab open for all my friends to order drinks on, only to find out at the end of the night that they don't do itemized receipts (what??). They handed me a scrap of paper with "$7 well" written repeatedly, so it was a not so fun guessing game trying to figure out how many drinks everyone bought. It would've been easy with an itemized receipt since we all ordered different drinks, but that must've been too much work for their service staff to handle. To top it all off it was pouring rain, and their outdoor cover over the doorway was completely caved in. We all got soaked while flagging down our uber. Overall, if you expect good service and to actually have an opportunity to sing at a karaoke bar, go somewhere else.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Great karaoke spot; service will depend of who is working and how crowded the place is.
author: D Andrew P.

description: Didn't get to sing but still had a good time. A good amount of people were still there by closing without it being too overcrowded.
author: Marissa F.

description:
Just don't go to this place!
I traveled A LOT in my life and I never ever been treated like this is in my life. 
Even in Philippines you are treated 1000 times better!
If you want to sing be prepared to pay a "tip" (which it's not compulsory but, in fact,  it is)! 
I asked to a girl who was lucky enough to sing and she waited 1 and a half hour to sing even if she pay a tip to the deejay.. 
i don't know how thinks works in USA but this shouldn't be normal, even more considering how rude the dj was (pretending to go to the restroom every time someone was waiting to speak with him)...
I hope this bad review will help future visitors to focus their attentions to different karaoke bars because this one (as previously reviews said) it's totally useless.
author: Ste B.

description: While I did love this place the new karaoke deejay pretty obviously orders things by who gives him a jimmy. After suffering through various off key renditions by pert types that came in after me - I have had enough of the place.
author: Diana R.

description: Jonathon K came in one day starting trouble. Stalked a girl in there he met on tinder tried to enter with no ID bouncers did there job and denied him access. He then plays victim gets aggressive and starts attacking the security not to mention he came riding in on his bike drunk! Called Kron news fabricated a whole lie wasn't even man enough to show his face and accused the bar of a lot of things that wasn't true. He is a rapist and racist. The lady he stalked thanked the bouncers for not letting him in which resulted in him getting bitter. I was there that night and I can't believe the news channel took the story with no evidence or proof and just tooks the word of a racist and a rapist and stalker just for material. Hey I been going to this karaoke bar for years and the truth is most people have something negative to say because they're drunk and pretty much did something out of pocket. Just keep in mind your reading reviews from a bunch of drunks that couldn't have it their way
author: Jay U.

description:
We went here last night and had a great time!  We showed up about 9PM and put in requests; we got to sing a few minutes later.  We put in a second request that the KJ didn't get to, but by then there were 30 - 40 people there.  If half of them put in requests, at 3 - 5 minutes each, you could easily see why you might be waiting for more than an hour.

I found the cell phone bandwidth lacking near the stage area, so I got the best results by putting my phone down and enjoying the company of my friends, and the other people who were singing: some really well, some really funny, and others (like me) quite poorly.  All equally entertaining.

I honestly found the staff and service to be great.  I was polite, they were polite, cocktails were karaoke-inducingly strong, and empties were cleared from our table quite promptly.

These are some general impressions the day after; I might have forgotten a few details since I didn't post my review while I was at the bar waiting for my turn to sing.
author: Ben P.

description:
It is with a heavy heart to write this review. I have been referring friends & colleagues to Encore for 10+ years. I was excited to bring karaoke lovers to Encore this past Friday. We got there around 7 to start our night. As we were waiting for our names to be called we were jamming with all the karaoke patrons singing to their great song choices. The mood changed when a man got up and started to sing a ballad. It wasn't until we saw the actual words on the screen when we were looking at each other in disbelief. The song was titled Spring Time For Hitler. After the song ended, another man took the mic and said some words which we couldn't understand. But the attitude was clear. He was making light of this song. Whether he was trying to be funny or grand standing we were just confused. 

I tried to shake it off and move on because I didn't want to ruin the night by booing or yelling. But I wanted to vocalize the poor taste of that song. I spoke with the manager behind the bar. I was thinking to myself, why would any karaoke establishment allow someone to sing, which in our eyes/ears, was an anti-Semitic and socially racist song in a place that welcomes/invites all people of race, gender, sex orientation and lifestyle. The manager tells me the owner was here and he would tell him. To my surprise the manager approached the same guy who grabbed the mic praising the controversial song. That is the owner? WOW. The owner came up to the table and instead of calmly explaining why this song was okay to sing, he proceeded to really defend it. Telling us "that the song was written by a Jew and it was supposed to be satirical. And if you can't understand theater I feel sorry for you... It was an inside thing. We were singing it because we were making fun of our friend, who wasn't here, because HE was the one that was racist". Whaaat!?!?  I couldn't believe what I was hearing. I may have had a little bit of a sense of humor if there was an actual Jewish guy singing that song and killing it... but it was a blonde hair burly man singing it flat with no hint of humor behind it whatsoever. But regardless what inside joke the owner had with the 2 people at Encore that actual thought it was appropriate, it was still executed in very poor taste. Especially with everything that went down this past weekend, what message are you sending to a crowd of diverse Asians, Latinos, Caucasians, gay and straight individuals that live and work in San Francisco? Even as we tried to explain why were upset the owner pulled the "well I'm gay and my boyfriend is Asian line". What the heck does that have to with anything?? I am not a business owner. But if I heard that a group of my customers were offended by a song with lyrics of anti-Semitic and racial undertones, I would immediately try to see what I could to do to calm things down. 

But that didn't happen. The owner became more combative and aggressive. So much that I threw my hands up and said we're leaving. You just lost business and we will write about it. As we proceeded to leave, the owner was still in our face trying to justify the song. The owner kept forcing his way to me as we were leaving. My friends were being the protective type and even other patrons were trying to calm things down. Just when I thought it was over and headed down the stairs, the manager jumped over the bar and physically assaulted a female friend of ours. I witnessed his hands on her throat and shoulders. As you can imagine this was the tipping point. A shoving matched ensued and i felt I was back in college (20 years ago). A moment of exchanges, the physical altercation ended and we all escaped this devastating experience. You would think by completely leaving the premises the harassment would have stopped. The owner was still relentless and even had some choice words to suck his you know what. Really!?? This is the owner of Encore. Wow. Our friend wanted to file charges for battery and cops were called. Because it was a case of a she said he said, our friend, shaken up and traumatized, didn't want to go through the process of the court system. We did insist the cops to make the manager come down and apologize. At least this would send a message that you should NEVER put your hands on a female. No matter how it went down, it is NEVER ok.  She now has bruises on her back. Great job guys. 

It has taken me 4 days to process what happened that Friday night. I am more hurt than angry because what was once my Mecca of karaoke, in one night, the owner and manager had deleted/stained any wonderful moments and fun memories of Encore I cherished over the years. You lost a loyal customer forever. 

Encore is failing their customers.  If you are against inappropriate behavior, batterers and abusive owners, please stay away from Encore.
author: JA G.

description:
This place really brings out a struggle for me. I much prefer public karaoke over private karaoke, however I feel like the DJ has some scheme that allows people to sing more frequently than others. I've probably been here about eight times total now, and the time between each visit keeps getting greater and greater and here's why...

The bar is fine. Its not great, not bad. That's fine. The karaoke is what brings people in, but there have been nights where I've waited hours and have effected put in multiple songs and haven't been called up for my songs. I was there recently, and despite being one of the first people to put in a request waited about two hours to do a song, and then waited nearly two more for another song.

I love what this bar is and what it stands for. The owner and bartenders really seem to care about people, but if you want to sing you might be better off looking elsewhere.
author: Bradley C.

description: Don't bother. You will wait 4 hours to sing and the bar staff are rude. Do not waste your time
author: Maria W.

description: Update: Wednesday night kj is horrible. She doesn't know sound or stick around when your song starts, to see if it's even the right song. She's too busy meddling in the bartenders stuff to handle her job. I love this place but will go somewhere else on Wednesday night. Her attitude sucks the fun out of karaoke. I feel bad for the bartender, since I'd go back for drinks.
author: Julie L.

description:
My sister and I stumbled into this bar by chance. We were looking for our next diversion and just happened to spot a Karaoke bar. Onward!!

This was so much fun. We love dive bars - we prefer them over fancy ones. This was a pretty quiet crowd, but we were thoroughly entertained by the singers (not us).  We were drinking beer, and we thought the prices were good for the area.

I am not a huge Karaoke lounge visitor, but I would go back. Kim and I agreed this was our favorite night in the city.
author: Kari W.

description:
I downloaded yelp to leave this one review.  We have been to this bar three times, and I still haven't had my song played for karaoke.  One time a couple hours after putting in my request I heard another person singing my song and asked the DJ about it, and he said their request was ahead of mine.  So I requested to have a new song and be up next, at which point he said he wouldn't do that, and when my wife came up to complain and he told her to "go fuck her self."  We promised to never come back. Two years later we went back, last night, and after three hours of waiting the DJ had played one of our 5 requests.  He continued saying it would be up soon for the the last hour we were there.  This while he was singing songs.  We got there at 9 when it was slow and saw people singing who had come after us, the same people over and over.  Clearly the DJs friends.  When my brother complained one of the DJs friends said "Why don't you cry about it."

So, we arrived at 9, by midnight one person in our group of five had had their song played.  It seems like unless you are willing to bribe the DJ to have your song up next, you will be bumped to ththe back of the lineup.  (We tipped $1 per song when we put in our request.)

Honestly, this place sucks so bad.  We usually go to Yama Sho, which is great! On this particular night we couldn't get a room...
author: Tyson C.

description: I have been here a couple of times and there's always a long wait for your turn to sing. The songs seem very long and should be shortened on busy nights. It's totally cheesy.
author: Denise C.

description: Had a bday party there late February (stated I'd be back in earlier review). It was pouring rain and thought no one would show...well, what a party it was packed and the staff could not have been more fun and accommadating. The owner was there and he was very nice as I brought in catered food for the guests and any customer who was hungry. Everyone sang, ate, and drank!!!  I'll be back!!!
author: Googie G.

description: Poor quality sound system plus DJ politics make Encore a place to avoid.
author: Paul M.

description: Adding two stars because I was being an idiot in 2013 and realize that I actually love this place. Still agree about the whole part about Polk St. being the worst, but come early and it's not a problem. I do wish they updated their books more frequently (go to the Mint if you need to sing new shit), but overall I'm a big fan. Also you can buy buckets of beer which is pretty hilarious and very appropriate.
author: Brittany L.

description: We were here for 4 hours and our song just came up once! That's consider pretty lucky! The DJ ONLY PLAY YOUR SONG IF YOU GIVE HIM MONEY!! and we complained to him and eventually he told us to "GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!" his words! Wow! Can't believe we got kicked out bc we didn't pay him to play our songs!
author: Marjorie L.

description: My favorite place in the world. This bar is spacious, the bartenders are personable, and the karaoke song list is huge and totally awesome.
author: Brooke W.

description: The karaoke would have been ok if not for the worst assholes who work there. In all of my years going to bars I have never been treated so horribly. I will NEVER go back and I will never recommend this awful place.
author: Kelly B.

description:
Most disrespectful experience I've had with a bartender, who come to later find out is also the owner. (He was sure to make this clear to me) If I could give zero stars, I would.

I stopped by Encore for the first time ever to meet up with some friends on Friday, 8/14 - first and only stop of the night after a long day at work.

I order two beers for myself and my friend, I give the bartender my credit card and I walk away. No issue. Come back to the bar and ask for a Widmer Bros Hefe. Bartender puts his hand up to his ear as if he couldn't hear me twice, so I speak louder and point to the beer behind the bar to make it easier since it was loud in the bar. The bartender takes offense to me speaking louder and rudely says, "You don't have to yell at me" and then stares me down... I'm completely confused by this point. Ok, I assume since I couldn't be heard, that the only logical thing to do was to speak louder and help point out what I was asking for. THEN, he proceeds to tell me, "It's pronounced (heffA) instead of (heff). Last I checked, hefe was short for Hefeweizen, therefore should be pronounced (heff). My mistake if I've been pronouncing it wrong my entire life, but if he knew and heard exactly what I was asking for, was it worth hearing me but making it a point to let me know that I was pronouncing it incorrectly...? My friend pays for this round.

I come back to the bar to order another round. I order something easier to pronounce since I'm clearly incapable of reading, bartender comes back with two beers, tells me the price. I tell him that it's under my tab and off he goes again. He tells me that on Friday's, Encore doesn't "do" tabs and that I'm going to have to pay in cash. I tell him that he took my credit card already with the first round and can he just put this round on my credit card that he already has. He tells me, no one took my card, makes sure that he let's me know that he's the owner, so he KNOWS that they don't take tabs on Friday. I open up my wallet and show him the empty slot where my card was and tell him, "sir, someone took my card and has it behind the bar. Can you find it so that I can close out." He tells me he's going to look for it, proceeds to help 3 or 4 more people at the bar, doesn't look for it AT ALL (I'm staring at my credit card in a plastic cup behind the bar, mind you), comes back and says he doesn't have it. I point it out to him behind the bar, he picks it up, says, "Oh, this is yours?" to which I reply, "yes, that's the card that you took". 

He looks at it, puts it on the counter and says that he was about to get rid of the card. What???? Since when do bars get rid of credit cards, let alone one from 30 minutes prior?? He then tells me that he called me, from stage, three times, and that and that no one came up and claimed it. I 100% disagree with this - who interrupts people singing (three times mind you) on a Friday night to announce a credit card is still at the bar? My group was standing front row on the floor waiting to be called up for a song, you mean to tell me I missed my own, birth given name, three times? I give him the benefit of the doubt and apologize for not hearing him call me. He again, stares me down and tells me again that he was close to throwing the credit card away. I again, apologize and tell him, sorry, I didn't hear you call me any of those times. Typically if a bar isn't going to keep your card, you're told before you walk away that they're giving it right back.

Meanwhile, two wasted girls next to me order a vodka soda and a water, bill comes to $7. The girl hands him $4 in singles and attempts to walk away. Of course, he nicely calls her back and tells her that she didn't give him enough money, almost in a flirtatious manner. So apparently, if you're a cute girl trying to skip out not only on paying for your full tab, but also skimping on a tip, you're golden in this bar.

I will NEVER step foot in this bar again. I have zero clue what I did to make this man so upset, but if mispronouncing a beer's name, not knowing that the bar has a weird "no tabs on Fridays rule" on my first time visiting and not "hearing" him call me on the microphone is enough to make him treat his customers like trash, I hope no one ever steps foot in here again either. Even with being treated like this, I tipped you appropriately on the beers that I purchased because I firmly don't believe in skimping on a service and product that I've received, no matter how terrible the service.

Mr. Owner, whatever it was had you so upset last Friday, I hope all is well for you and that this was just an anomaly - but...reading through the other reviews, this is not the first time you've been extremely rude to your customers. You've lost my, all of my friends' and whoever else I can tell business forever. I'll make sure I spread the word. There are too many other karaoke bars in the city to deal with your rude, despicable behavior.
author: Mike J.

description: If you don't have the money to bribe the DJ to play your karaoke requests don't bother with this place. I really wanted to like Encore, good crowd but after watching people who arrived HOURS after me getting their songs played I realized Encore is more "pay to play" than it initially appeared. To any extent I won't be returning.
author: Megan A.

description:
If I could leave 0 stars I would. I use to come here often and it USE to be really cool. Tonight however, I got here around 10pm, tipped the dj (or kj) $5 off the batt for my first song, which came up in about 30 mins or so after submitting. My friend got here 10 mins after me...  it's been 2.5 hours since she submitted her song.. we have talked to the dj twice and "your up next" came out of his fucking mouth 3 times. Clearly not. Cherry on top is I submitted a song 2 hours ago and a girl who just fucking walked in the bar sang the song. Excuse my language but get your fucking shit together and FIRE that kj.

Update: I'm still freaking heated... you ruined a Friday night with a friend I don't get to see often. I hate this place.
author: Leah R.

description: This place rocks literally best karaoke in town affordable drinks awesome staff fun folks in the building loved it ..can't wait to come back again
author: LaDasha M.

description: Bartender was rude and was the owner... it wasn't even midnight and he was aggressive and mean. Wonderful introduction to San Francisco. Couldnt event look at the song list without one of the owners/bartender tried to start a fight with me. Thought i flipped him off when i was doing was telling a friend if mine (who he was extremely rude too) .. i was saying to ignore him, we are just here to have fun... he then thought i flipped him off... just wow..  beware.
author: Kimiko R.

description: Bar tenders are rude and forceful. They make you close out afterthe bar tenders shift is over to make sure they get the tips for their shift. Older songs list nothing modern. Great spot but needs a fresh vibe.
author: Dominic K.

description:
Sitting in my relatives hotel room in the Huntington up the hill, looking at my Yelp app to see what's nearby for after our planned early dinner. Hey look! There is a karaoke lounge a few blocks away. And OMG! Look who left a 4 star review! Our ex-Yelp community manager Hazel Q. Thats all I need to validate this place and sell my crew on what a fine time was to be had.

We arrive around 9:00 to a mostly empty dark room (a Monday night), but were very warmly greeted by the bartender and KJ. Not only dark, but very divey as well. Do we care? Hell no, it is apparent we will be well cared for, and Hazel reported that the drinks will be strong, so lets camp out. 

People started trickling in, the KJ started up his system, and deftly performed a few songs to warm everyone up. Man can sing, and so can the bartender as well. Some regulars showed up and brought their awesome singing skills. Me? Oh yeah, terrible singer but am also game. The ladies in our party even came up with me on two songs and perked my "show" up as my dancers. I got a very enthusiastic thumbs up from one of the regs, yep for my dancers not my singing. Well hell, I'll take that!

This is maybe the most fun karaoke bar I have been to, as the regulars are all cool to 1st timers, and there was even one or two others that were worse singers than I. At least thats what the LF confirmed. I believe her, and you should too.
author: Dan H.

description:
I've never had such an offensive experience with a business owner/manager. 

I came here on Friday evening with a couple coworkers, and we were having a nice time ordering each other rounds of beers and chatting while being amused by everyone's tributes to Prince. This is the second time I've been here, and the bartender, a blonde gal, was very friendly both times. 
We are sitting further away from the bar, and I have a Trader Joes sparking water bottle sitting in plain view on the table, because it did not fit in my backpack with my laptop and rain coat. A gray haired man that none of us had seen before walks up to our table and says " You need to put that water bottle away NOW". I was startled and asked why (I also had no idea who this person was).  He says Why?? Because it's against the rules, there are SIGNS, put it away NOW. 
Okay.... I comply, and feel very jolted by this person's harsh delivery. 
I go to buy another round of drinks, and ask our bartender, "Who is this man, is he the manager or owner? He was just incredibly rude to me". She looks over at him, keeps her head low and says "He's not feeling well today I think".
In an effort to try to mend what was a lingering gross feeling about how that short interaction went down, I walked over to his section of the bar and said "Hi, I just wanted to apologize for having my water out, and this is only my second time to this bar and I like it, but your communication made me feel very unwelcome here."
This would have been a perfect opportunity for this man to say something along the lines of, Hey, sorry for how it came across, I'm the manager and I just have rules to follow and we cant have outside drinks for legal reasons.

Instead, he laid into me... Can't you read the SIGNS everywhere, what if a COP walked in, "I was perfectly nice" (he claims he used manners when he asked me to put it away, my friend as my witness, he did no such thing). 
 I said "Your staff has been kind and welcoming, I didnt even know who you were when you walked up to the table, I've never seen you here before" to which he gruffly says "Yeah, well I've never seen YOU here before". 

Dude was straight up mean, for absolutely no reason, to a patron whose crime was having a water bottle on her table, and who went up to APOLOGIZE for it. 
I'm not saying he's wrong for having me put it away, I'm saying I'm shocked at how big of a jerk a person can be to stranger straight out the bat, and then continue to be one when given the opportunity to create a better interaction. 
To the owner, sorry if you were having a bad day or not feeling well, but maybe take a second to re-evaluate how you communicate with others, because that level of negativity is so unnecessary.
author: Chelsea V.

description:
It's a discrete, divey Karaoke Lounge place that is located right upstairs!  I would not have known about this place at all until some friends decided to go here for Santacon Saturday outing at night!

It was fun - people were drinking, jumping up and down and singing their lungs out.  

They have good selections on mainly pop music.  

Bring a loud crowd and good company and you will be Encoring it all out!
author: Tiffany D.

description: After waiting for an hour and a half and requesting 3 different songs me and my friends ended up leaving disappointed that we weren't called up on stage. Apparently the dj only plays songs that he likes or the person who leaves the biggest tip. Drinks were good though.
author: Jenn R.

description: Fun music, crappy bartenders and staff. They treated me fine, but multiple members of my group came up to me and said "bartenders a d!ck" separately, so that lead me to believe it. Still, only place on polk I found to do karaoke. If you want better, go to bow bow karaoke and see mama, she's the best.
author: Crystal J.

description:
My boyfriend and I went there on a Monday night and the place is definitely a dive karaoke bar but we certainly didn't mind b/c we love to just have fun and sing so we know what to expect. It was almost completely empty, had a real funky smell to it, and the KJ was not very friendly. We were tipping him every time we put in a song because that sign is plastered all over which I think is in poor taste. Especially poor taste when you're not very friendly, there's hardly anyone in there and you proceed to tell me I have to put in one song at a time when we hand you a few songs we want to put in at once. Really?!? I could care less how you spread the songs out between my boyfriend and I, the KJ singing who's getting paid and tipped to be there and the only 1-2 other people in that whole bar. 

Then the bartender tried taking my boyfriends money off the bar after he just got done paying for shots. It was $6 work of shots, he paid with a $20, $14 in change was on the bar and he tried grabbing it but I caught it out of the corner of my eye and called him out. Either he was being shady or drunk. Not sure which but either way not good at all for a bartender. 

Then the KJ was rude to a group of girls and all of a sudden they're in eachothers faces and one of the girls did make an extremely uncalled for comment to the KJ about his sexuality. This resulted in a fight which was extremely uncomfortable. I did feel bad for the guy but he does act like he's got some control issues and did have an attitude the entire night. Doesn't at all justify the comment just saying dude could provide some better customer service.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Stopped in the other day after a long hiatus. We were hoping they had a different KJ. Nope same old rude, drip that lacks personality and has attitude that screams out, "I don't care!" 

Too bad because we live in the neighborhood and love Karaoke. We would be there all the time, drinking, spending money, tipping the KJ's if the place was at all inviting or responsive to customers (sigh).
author: SCOTT L.

description: Fun place but the Karaoke is rigged.  The guy place your name in the lineup if you bribe him. That's not cool!!  We've been waiting for hours to sing and found out the others have been singing multiple times because they bought their turn.  Screwed up system!!!
author: Jenny V.

description:
People have different ideas of what they want in a karaoke place. Some want private rooms and ability to drink with friends while others want to do their best American idol audition in front of drunk strangers. Encore is the definitive version of the latter for aspiring sf vocalists. The place is divey and dirty and smells kind of weird but you are okay with that because you are drunk and singing your butt off.

Encore has the look and feel of a dive bar but with the amazing addition of karaoke on the side. It is located on California street near other bars of Polk and is perfect for a night of barhopping in the city. This is the place to grab a few friends and convince them against their will to give karaoke a shot. What better place to make a fool of yourself in front of others than in a place that is dark with about 20 people screaming their lungs out for you. If you pick the right song you can even get some people to come up and be backup singers or dancers for you. It's that kind of bar, people are having a good time and don't care if you are nervous or not you will be at least one person yelling for you. 

The bartenders and staff are excellent and they are also great singers. They will take time from serving you heavy heavy heavy pours to go up a sing a couple songs before settling back behind the bar. The song choice is what you would expect with most of the classics available. It doesn't get to current with not much past 2012 or so but they do add songs to the menu as they go. Your favorites will be there though and that's all that matters. The sound system is great as you belt your way across the decades and the DJ is supportive and will get you on the list to sing with the proper liquid or monetary persuasion as it should be. 

Be forewarned there are a lot of Encore locals which can lead to a couple things. The queue to sing can be quite long so you may have to wait up to an hour to get to sing but hopefully you are in it for the long haul. Also some of them take themselves really seriously and are actually very good so don't be intimidated when someone gets up and does a perfect rendition of les miserables. They don't represent the entire crowd. 

Encore is just silly drunken singing fun in San Francisco. You feel like you have discovered a place that only you and your friends know about and that's the best part. No overcrowding like the mint and it's not as shut off as Pandora or L2. This is the place to go to get your friends up to sing in front of others while secretly recording them for blackmail from your seat. And really isn't that what karaoke is all about?
author: Nick R.

description:
Rhymes make for great pneumonic devices. For Encore, remember: "Pay-pay the KJ, or way-wait all day-day."

Why? Because Encore mashes the two things every disassociated piece of walking irony loves to hate to love: dive bars and karaoke. And as San Francisco is lousey with this demographic, it makes sense that Encore is packed to the musty gills every night of the week. There is no shame in this house; everyone sings, and if you don't camp out, be prepared to shell out.

Still a fun time, as karaoke spectating is wont to be. Unless you're on Team Hydrate, in which case, you should go home and rest. This is no place for sobriety.

Cheap dranks from 3-7p daily. "Don't Stop Believin'" inevitable. Cash only.
author: Damien S.

description:
It's been a while since my previous visit. Last time I was here I was more of a spectator than a participant. It also was a busy night. This time, I stopped in during the day for a friend's birthday and it was much different. We were able to sing all of our songs. The song selection is okay. They had a few of my favourite obscure classics and a lot of not as common songs in their collection.

The bartenders even sing when it's not as busy and they're actually quite fun to watch and pretty talented. Drinks are fairly cheap. Although, I've paid less for cider at other bars but that's all right. It's all in good fun.

Who knew my rendition of the Flaming Lips' "She Don't Use Jelly" would get some cheers? Looks like I found a new song to add to my repertoire. My group was pretty off key, but that's okay. You don't need to be a rockstar for karaoke. Just come with a fun attitude and you'll have a good time. Tipping the KJ gets your song played a little faster so I've noticed.
author: Amy J.

description: The fat black guy running karaoke on Friday is a worthless pig.  We waited 3 hours and our song never played, finally we asked and he stated "I don't care, you're at the bottom".  Go to the mint or silver cloud.  I warned you.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Dive bar meets karaoke lounge.

Definitely not the kind of place I would typically venture into, but this was the final stop on our Mexican party bus for a friend's pre-wedding party. Let's face it, karaoke is hit or miss. They have a decent selection of songs and the alcohol was freely flowing amongst our giant group. There's also a pool table in the corner if you feel so inclined.
author: Leana L.

description: To add to previous reviews. Now their KJ and security team thinks it's acceptable to assault their patrons. My boyfriend, like others, was agitated after waiting two hours for his buddy's song to come up and the KJ told him there was no system (basically to fuckoff as it appears he often does) so boyfriend asks bartender/"co-owner" about it who's reply was "did you tip him?". Yeah 2 bucks. Boyfreind, agitated, tired goes back to KJ tells him to fuck off and wants his tip back. As he reaches for his money from the tip jar the kj stands up pushes him and the team of security swarm and proceed to force him out even though he repeatedly said I'm leaving. They push him down just before the door tell him to get up to which he replies again, I'm leaving and when he's up they decide it's not enough for him to walk out they want to physically throw him down a flight of cement stairs, follow him down and punch him. All the while I'm screaming begging them to let us leave. It was a surreal unnecessary event. Ive been coming here 10 years i could not believe it.
author: Shalana M.

description:
Divey, welcoming and has strong drinks!  

You don't even have to pay for putting in your song! (just tip the KJ please) 

They have a large space for rowdy groups looking to wail throughout the night or for neighborhood regulars who just want to hang for hours holding a beer and belting out damn good songs. Always expect anything by Journey to come up and expect the unexpected too, like this chick who was singing broadway songs.  Seriously?! 

Come before 10pm if you have stage fright.
author: Janice C.

description: Awesome , laid back spot , with a chill vibe. If you like to sing check it out. The place is upstairs. And if aren't exploring, you might just miss it. Good sound , And lots of songs to chose from. I'd go back again on my next trip to the City by the Bay!!!!
author: Paakuma' T.

description:
Came in from Phoenix, AZ to go to the Niners game. Stopped in here for a drank. Great happy deals for California. 
Cleanest bathrooms I've ever been in for a bathroom.
Helpful, kind, and nicest staff aka Skyler..
Tim, the manager and the Owner, Chris, was super cool. Came around and greeted everyone.
author: Christina A.

description:
Over priced shitty beer
They seem to have cleaned up a bit
Karaoke guy never called up my friends after being there for 2 hours... Even after tipping him
(It wasnt busy when we arrived)
Silver clouds is a better choice
Never again.
author: Andy H.

description: Had a great time here. Though I can't remember singing the second song - darn you happy hour(s). I was told I sang pretty well! Such a nice bunch of people.
author: Jacob V.

description: I am giving 4 stars for the bar. I would only give 0/1 to the DJ. We were a party of 3 and we waited for more than 2 hours for any of our songs to come up. (We put 2 at the same time) We finally got one song. Then it was another person, and another........ I went up to ask the dj when my song was coming... the DJ told me it was 5 more songs for the next person- we waited another hour. We ended up leaving. I never got to sing my song, neither did my husband. We sat there for close 4 hours waiting for  songs. And the dj telling us we were "5 songs away"   We're locals in the neighborhood. Don't think I'll come back again. :(
author: Rhia E.

description: I believe I must have killed his dog or his firstborn. In his mind at least. But after this evening, I might not go there ever again. The staff seems to have forgotten how to treat me like a human being.
author: John F.

description:
Absolutely the worst Karaoke I ever went too. 

Super-rude and unprofessional staff! 
The place looks dirty and old, 
and the toilet is absolutely disgusting. 
The Microphone audio was set way too high in comparison to the music. You could hear every flaw and mistake made by every singer.. including myself :(

We barely arrived and wanted to deliver our song to the DJ because we didn't want to wait in line too long to sing, and then the Bartender came up to me and said "You need to buy something at the bar to sing". Then the DJ said on Mic: "please remember to buy drinks at the bar before delivering your song". It made me feel very embarrassed! 

We were going to buy drinks but this nagging does gives off seriously bad vibes. If you have to tell people to buy stuff at the bar, you are doing it wrong. You should rather have a note or something on the song-notes - money talks should be done discretely: ALWAYS - never embarrass you guests in public like that.

Toilet was absolutely disgusting. It could seriously need a paint-and-wash. It didn't even have a lock, so I had to hope no-one else entered while I was there. 

I'm never coming back
author: Chris K.

description:
It's unfortunate I have to give them one star, they don't deserve it.  They deserve -5.  I'm a fan of a good dive bar, I can look past a dirty carpet and questionable bathroom.  Most dive bars have an extremely charming staff that more than makes up for cosmetic flaws and funky smells.  THIS IS NOT THE CASE AT ENCORE.  I have literally never been treated so poorly by an establishment as a whole.  
I think I was the first one of our group to pick out my song, I walk up to the booth and there is someone else waiting to turn in their pick.  Then someone else comes up after me.  As the current song is ending the "KJ" finally comes back to the booth from messing around behind the bar, you can tell he has a seriously bad attitude.  He stands there for a second not even wanting to take the slips from us, then he mutters something rude to me about there being a long wait.  Looking back on it now, he was probably waiting for a tip that he didn't deserve.  It is my understanding that most KJ's are paid to do their job, and in all honesty it is a job a monkey could do.  Encore needs a better trained monkey.
Someone in our group finally gets to sing, meanwhile it's going on over an hour since my request.  Right before last call, I finally get called up, but for a different song my friend and I put in well after my first request.  So, it's pretty obvious that he is picking songs based on how popular they are.  I have never been to a karaoke bar that filters their song requests, or that allows bribes.  This is ridiculous.
Once we realized this was a corrupt system we tried to pay off the KJ to get one song on that was extremely important to my friend, and he refused and told her to fuck off over the mic.  I didn't hear any of this happen, bc you can't hear anything he mumbles into the microphone (apparently he's too lazy to talk clearly, let alone do his job). My friend informs me we're leaving and why, and storms out.  I go to grab my husband to tell him what happened, and that it was time to go.  I still had a basically full drink so I decided to finally give the KJ the tip he actually deserved.  Unfortunately there wasn't any money in it, and he threw the drink at me as I walked away, I had cleared the stage by that point so I'm sure he also doused a handful of innocent bystanders.  I'm not justifying my drunken actions, but throwing a drink into a crowd of CUSTOMERS is totally unacceptable behavior for an employee.  At this point, my husband throws his beer at him, and he proceeds to follow us out with one of the bus boys to try to fight my husband.  The bouncers were more concerned with keeping me away from the fight, than breaking up the grossly unfair fight that was going on.  Fortunately the KJ's laziness resulted in nothing more than a ripped shirt in the scuffle, and we left.
Management did absolutely nothing, but apparently this happens more often then not.  They should probably pull their heads out of their butts and hire someone who isn't going to cost them business.
author: Nikki D.

description:
OK... this place is a karaoke joint that is frequented by hipsters, which immediately puts it in the mehhhh category. Went here for an after work shin dig. There were a few pluses: It's large. It's relatively empty on a weeknight. And since we had a party of about 14, they hooked us up with a free shot of some variety of liquors (reminded me of turning 21 and having a "Kamikaze"). Also, the bartender was pleasant enough - when I ordered an Irish Coffee, he happily brewed up a fresh pot. So props for that.

Now to the bad: It's grungy, the food (free) that was set out was pretty craptacular, and the worst thing ever? The DJ. Prior to putting on the karaoke nightmare that was me singing Cameo's "Word Up," homeboy got down on the 1s and 2s. Well, sort of. First off, I don't think he had actual vinyl. And second... I haven't seen this many train wrecks since Johnny Cash sang, "The Wreck of the Old 97." Seriously, if you can't make the tracks meet up, drop em down and give them a break. 

After wreck # who could keep track, we kind of jokingly gave him a little, "boo," from our booth. He then came up to me, tapped me on the shoulder, and was like, "YOU KNOW, I DON'T APPRECIATE YOUR ATTITUDE." Um, sorry. I don't appreciate that you DJ like a 12 year old that just got a pair of Geminis from the swap meet, but hey, to each his own.

It's not a place I plan on returning to. Maybe if they get a new DJ, but until then, pass.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Ummm...I was gonna write a review for this place, but I guess I'll "update" the one I had (and don't ever remember writing)!

Anywho, it's the same. Except, this last time I was here I sang (badly, and drunkenly I might add).
author: George A.

description: It is so unfortunate that the KJ here completely ruins what could be a great place.  If they replaced him with a fun, upbeat personality, this would be the best Karaoke bar in the city.
author: R D.

description:
I love karaoke. I'd go to karaoke every night if I could and part of that is I actually like singing. I could do without ever hearing someone sing Journey, Gloria Gaynor or Katy Perry ever again but that's just a personal preference. 

Encore is one of the diviest bars I've ever been to and that is saying a lot. The bathroom is heinous, the seats are all cracked leather, the carpet is less like carpet and just ground in fibers. It's redolent of old booze and desperation but Encore and I, we still have a strange connection. Perhaps it's because it was one of the first bars I went to in SF when I first got my job. 

Despite the atmosphere, here are the need to knows: If you tip the KJ, he'll fit you in. He's also REALLY grumpy. It's cash only but they have an ATM. Don't let the microphone touch your lips. There are some darn good singers. Interpretive dance is always welcome. Wear close toed shoes
author: Kelly S.

description:
Very cool place everybody sings and has a great Time but the KJ is a complete asshole!!, very rude heard him be rude to several customers and very much my self we were just here visiting  from southern Cali asked him how long it's going to be  thru a 5$ in his tip bucket he said less then a hour  and came back 45-50 min later because my wife was tired and wanted to find out where I was in the rotation he said and ((I quote you just fucking got here)) and I said no I got here about 45 min ago!! he said  I told you over an hour ,I said no! You said no longer then a hour .. I said just tell me where I'm at in the rotation how many singers Till I'm up .. He said I'm not going to tell you ,,I just told you over an hour ... I said ok you kidding so an hour more .. 
He Tells me no!!! over an hour more .. Completely a extremely rude asshole almost knocked the fucking red hat right off his fuckin face !!!!
author: Keith H.

description: This was fun for the special event we were at, but many places were much too loud, which kind of cramped our style.
author: Becky T.

description:
If a girl who goes by the name of oznolA were to have an amazing experience hanging out in the city there are a few hypothetical situations that may demonstrate such. 

Scenario 1- She  has had too many beers and should probably go home but instead convinces her friends that more beers and pizza is a better idea.

Scenario 2- She has had too many beers and  is en route home  but instead  she decides to show off the  Yelp Monocle. Yelp advises her that there is a karaoke bar near.  She then proceeds to an acapella session with 3  random girls outside of the bar that believe Aaliyah's "One in a Million" is the end all of slow jams.

Scenario 3- She has  had to many beers and orders more beers ( For everyone-cash only)  and  sits down with a group of 21 year old boys that serve her chocolate cake . Boys convince her and her friends  that butchering an Alicia Keys song is a really good idea .  

Scenario 4- Girls think to themselves that they are really good singers and that they are sexy.

Scenario 5- Other people think that as well, for reasons unknown.

Scenario 6- If you like it than you should have put a ring on it. 
Oh, Oh, Oh    Oh, Oh, Oh.

This is not an admission of guilt. However,  If these things did happen it would be permissible at Encore. If anything, it would be encouraged.
author: Hannah A.

description: It was my sister's first time going to karaoke so we decided to uber after attending a concert down at The Fillmore. I'm so glad we yelped and found this little spot. Tons of musical choices, great stage and microphones, hype crowd. The bartenders were funny, Stacy and Mattie, they made our night!  I'd recommend this for the super social and not shy karaoke singers; someone boo'd my sis in the crowd. Not cool! But the DJ had her back saying "this is a non judgment zone!" I loved that. She wasn't singing loud enough to be heard over the crowd. I redeemed us, belting Alanis Morisette's 'You Oughta Know' and was graciously hand kissed by Mattie at the bar! Sweet! We shall be returning in the near future.
author: Ashanna B.

description:
Drinks: strong. 

Regulars: rad. 

Songs: deep. 

Stage: huge.

Groups: tend to jack up the local dive vibe and make for long wait times in the singer/song rotation. Etiquette and patience get tested when the house is full, be advised. 

Otherwise: sing your life in the church of Encore. We've got tonight, who needs tomorrow...
author: Kelly O.

description: After a random day in SF I stumbled upon this place while searching for Karaoke Bars. A group of us went at about 5PM which was right when the karaoke started. The bartender Chris was great, he interacted with us and was cracking jokes. Lee was the KJ and he was pretty fun as well. There was not very many singers so I got to go up a bunch of times but even with the place not being super busy the staff made it a good time for me and my friends. The only downside would be I think the books... That's kinda old school and they have a lot of older songs, not all the new stuff as the books were printed in 2009. I would like to see a updated book. Lee was great and didn't mind me asking him what newer songs they had. Overall I would definitely be back to this place!
author: Victoria L.

description:
Encore is essentially a dive bar with karaoke. I rate this place a 5 for atmosphere (lots of energy, everyone having fun) but a 3 for everything else. Honestly I can't comment too much on the drinks since we just had several rounds of Fireball shots, but I do know the bartender didn't know what a SoCo & Coke was. I forgive him, since I'm not sure knowing this is really a positive attribute? T

The rest of the 3-star rating comes from the horrible state of the bathroom, and the fact that they don't have any songs from the last decade! I thought of about 5 songs I wanted to sing and none of them were on the list. Sad. So we ended up singing "The Boy is Mine"....poor life decisions.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
We were visiting from LA perhaps feeling that SF would be egalitarian clearly, giving all singers a chance to showcase their vocal chops. 

But sadly, disillusioned i was to a place that caters to tips, song choice, and I don't know racial or sexual profiling.  

Perhaps this was an anomaly or perhaps it was just Miles, the unscrupulous karaoke DJ, but regardless if you want to sing, buyer beware, 3 drinks may get you a #20 spot or nonexistent song request lost in Narnia.
author: Jeff M.

description: Such a fun karaoke spot! Great people, bartenders, and everyone sings a long! I love this place!
author: Katie D.

description: Really average place, in a down and out deserted building. Waited ages to sing anything. But more disappointing than anything was the stupid hidden step down to exit the venue which I saw two people fall over and hurt themselves as a result of. I asked the security guard why there's no hazard tape on the step and he shrugged. Pathetic.
author: Joe B.

description:
Stumbled upon Encore on our walk home from the Cabin Bar. We wanted to end the night singing dancing queen!
Its not a ritzy and glamorous entrance; stair case located on the left hand side. However, the bar is very spacious and has a lot of room. I'd say its bigger than some night clubs that I've been in. We arrived around midnight and there were only 5 people singing, which is great because I wouldn't have sang if it was a packed bar. The dj rotates song requests, the bartender even jumps in and takes the mic. Super chill place with awesome customer service. Nightly drink specials...and we actually got someone to ring the bell and buy a round on the house! woop woop! They have a great song selection and tons of books available so customers dont have to wait for the books to be rotated. 
2 types of books: one listed by artists, one listed by song titles
$1.00 per song 
tons of tv's and stage teleprompter to see word captions
2 mics available
deejay booth on the dance floor
Tons of space to dance and cheer the singer(s)!
I am a fan and I will return and I have already recommended!
*dont know if food/appetizers are available, we didnt think to ask, we were to busy singing our hearts out
author: Darcie P.

description:
I REALLY wish I would have read these reviews before coming here. 
The DJ was the rudest person I've ever met in my entire life. We put songs in and were skipped over for over two hours. We tried giving him money and he said "If you're not on the list, you're not singing". We spent A LOT of money at the bar as well.
We came here after a friends wedding. She really wanted one of us to sing a Blake Shelton song so her and her husband could have their first dance and he ignored us the whole evening. Things got heated after last call and it resulted in him coming outside to physically fight our group of friends. He ended up grabbing (and shredding) my brothers shirt and was going to hit some females. 
I spoke with Ken, who said he was the manager and offered us free drinks, but obviously that won't change the bad attitude of the DJ. 
If I were the owners I would seriously consider finding a new DJ. It seems like I'm not the only one who has had a problem with this person. I could tell from the second we walked in that he had a bad attitude and he proved me right. 
Do not waste your time coming to this bar!!!!!!
author: Dannie D.

description:
Went here last night for the first time and I have to say, I have mixed feelings. The drinks were nice and strong and the bartenders were nice and friendly and they didn't overcharge me. However, the karaoke dj was somewhat of an ass, only playing his friends requests, or stupid drunk girls that must have been regulars. I'm sorry, but if I have to pay extra to sing, then this isn't really a karaoke bar, now is it? My friend and I were there from 10:30 to closing, putting in our songs right when we got there, and tipping well. We didnt get to sing until after 12:30, and the kj didnt even put in both of our songs! This is a good overall concept in the city, but if you want more people to come around, change out your crappy dj and get someone who is good for business, not in it for himself. 

Plus side: strong drinks, nice bartenders and barback staff including bouncer, comfy chairs, 2 levels, big stage, 2 bathroom stalls, good karaoke selection, good neighborhood.

Negatives: terrible karaoke dj, poorly attended bathrooms, dimly lit, funky smell, and RUDE kj who only caters to himself.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Yes, there's no telling WHAT kinds of people and songs will turn up. It's simultaneously part of the charm and part of the skeez. Go with some friends who all love to get up and wail in front of strangers and you should be set.

Bring a stash of ones or be ready to break a bill for ammo to tip the bartender per drink and the DJ per song. Also, just two beers cost more than a sixer of PBR. But I didn't see PBR. I did see one plaid flannel shirt; I was wearing it.
author: Dan B.

description: Everyone in my group can't stop talking about how shitty this karaoke bar was. Karaoke is supposed to be fun... Right? The people there seemed to be regulars. They all took themselves way too seriously. Every single song was a slow, sad song. The DJ or whatever you want to call him didn't do too much to lighten the mood or pump up the crowd. The entire time we were there the crowd applauded maybe twice. My friends who went up and sang fun songs and tried to get everyone pumped up. They were met with blank stares and an unwelcoming attitude. Avoid this place (with overpriced drinks) if you are trying to have a good time!
author: M W.

description:
The first few times I went here were great but I guess I had gotten lucky. After the horrible experience I had here last night I will never go here again. Overpriced drinks and corrupt KJ's. I brought a group here for a celebration and after 3 1/2 hours of waiting only one or two of us got to sing a single song because we didn't tip as high as the people who were getting to sing over and over. My husband tips both the bartenders and the KJ highly but didn't get to sing once and he was furious. A complete waste of money!

Don't go here, you'd be better off getting a private karaoke room somewhere else. You'd pay less AND you'd get to sing.
author: Amy M.

description: Honestly the best place to get your karaoke groove on! Great bartenders, dj's and family/community style feeling! You register your song of choice and wait for your name to be called to the stage! Fun times!
author: Helemano G.

description:
Well karaoke can be fun but it can also be weird, like Twilight Zone weird. Encore Karaoke Lounge seems to always be a strange place to me. I think I've been five times in the past two years. Once it was just three other people besides my little group who kept singing silly ol' lovers songs. The tight Asian chick was good.
Another time I went and it was like a rock n' roll concert, everybody was deeply insane and belting out big classic rockers. Girls wuz dancing and boys were less than timid.
The drinks here are necessary and reasonably priced. The place has weird vibe but I like it.
I like to sing Rod Stewart songs, so save, Hot Legs for me. and don't forget to tip the DJ.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Not the best Karaoke experience I had. We came to celebrate a group of 14 on a early Sunday evening. I was negatively surprised with several things here:
1. The DJ decides to sing multiple songs while our requests are pending. He really likes to hear himself sing, how weird is that?
2. Heavy tipping is necessary even if the place is almost empty :( Oh and also only the regulars got to sing multiple songs, we got 2 songs each cuz the place was empty, lucky us. 
3. The bar apparently was having a happy hour while we were there but the bartender didn't mention it, nor was it written anywhere so we had no clue until the DJ yelled "last call for Happy hour". How annoying!
4. The place is so old fashioned there's only books for choose songs from, no way to search with an electronic device.
5. With few versions of the same song you'd expect the DJ to choose the best one for you 'cuz you basically have no idea which is better. But no! he did an awful job at that. 
6. Most of his "free time" while someone was singing the DJ spent with the regulars and at the bar. Then when the song was done he would run back there. Like, really??? 
7. The overall feeling in this place wasn't that great, there are far better places for Karaore in SF.
author: Mashav S.

description: Hey great place to sing your heart out. The kay jay looks funny but if you tip him he'll be extra nice. Remember $1-$2tips, thats what everybody else is tipping so if u want to move up the line tip more$$$. Security are some  really cool guys if your a cool guy yourself but if your a douche.....
author: James L.

description: Gross bathrooms. Fratty as heck. Old fashioned and fun to watch the hijinks.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I have been in numerous karaoke bars throughout the Bay. 

This one by far has been the worst!

Long waits for songs and if you don't tip the person playing the songs, your song will be delayed more. 

Bathroom is a little run down and dirty.

I will most likely be singing at another karaoke bar instead.

Not so happy singing.

Toodles~
author: Mae M.

description:
What's up with this shithole?
