Oh, and despite the sign that says "limit one song request per person," you mysteriously see the same guy get up to sing Josh Groban and Jason Mraz 600 times while you're waiting to bust out your version of Hey Jealousy.
author: Kristen B.

description:
A night at the Encore with my co-workers convinced me that I am in need of a song. Not just any song, mind you, but a song worthy of calling my own. Perhaps with a well-choreographed dance routine to accompany said song?

Stevie Wonder, Blondie and Joni Mitchell have been offered up as options. Yet none feel quite right. But trust that before I return again to Encore I will be armed with my song so bring earplugs!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Sometimes I see someplace in SF with 150+ reviews and I wonder to myself, what the hell is the point of weighing in?  Honestly there isn't except maybe to boost my review count.  But hey, why should that stop me?

With a group of about 10 friends in tow, I decided this would be the perfect follow-up to my birthday dinner gathering at Nick's Crispy Tacos.  YUM!  Well, actually, hold on.  We went to the mint first, where there was ZERO seating room, because 3 different parties had reserved all of the tables.  Screw that.

Enter Encore Karaoke Lounge.  The place seemed pretty chill.  We were able to scrounge up some seats despite it being fairly packed.  The drinks were so-so at best, but the karaoke was perfect.  One of the things I HATE HATE HATE about karaoke lounges is that often times they don't have enough books circulating, and then you have to go try and steal one from an indignant table of drunken-would be american idols.  This is a risky venture for anyone.

Fortunately for us, Encore had the foresight to provide ample songbooks for all, which is pretty darn cool.  It would've been nice to have alphabetical list by songs, and not just artists, but nobody's perfect, right?  The wait for our songs was about an hour, which is kind of sucky, but gave us more time to drink and play pool.  Not bad.  Oh, also, BOO on cash bar!  I'd probably subtract more stars if I had actually had to pay for my own drinks on my birthday.  Cash-only establishments piss me off.

All in all, I'd come back here.
author: Daddy O.

description:
After two years of dating a Filipino I think I have become an expert on Karaoke bars...
...And with that being said, I'm totally shocked by a lot of these bad reviews. I have gone to Encore on several occasions... and as I would totally agree that their bathrooms are disgusting- what do you expect? Its a dive bar. As far as purses being stolen- s*** happens, no matter where you go, and Encore is not in what I would consider a bad area of the city. I totally disagree about the DJ being rude, hes a totally awesome guy, he's never made any rude comments to me even though I am entirely tone deaf (this is the only place I will sing without fear of being booed off the stage), and unlike The Mint, they always play your songs.. On busy nights you'll have to wait, and I'm sure if you tip the DJ (which you should) he'll probably be more inclined to get your song on quicker. I have never had any problems with the bartenders. If you're a germaphobe, bring some hand-sanitizer. Drinks are strong & cheap, the song list is pretty awesome, and the crowd (if there is one) is usually pretty friendly and very diverse.

Cash only!
author: Camiel A.

description: Stiff drinks, great bartenders, and the KJs are awesome and really nice guys.  Go see Lee on Friday happy hour- he's the kind of KJ that takes care of everyone and makes you excited to stay and sing another song!
author: Malia K.

description: This place closes early and pushes everybody out very early. They're rude to their customers and are only focused on getting people out. I do not recommend this place due to the unfriendly staff and the unconventional closing hours.
author: Collin H.

description:
Great potential and history, but under current management this karaoke bar SUCKS.

Although it used to have great KJs, now the prime KJ is one of the bouncers who plays favorites with people who tip higher.  So that means if you tip him a couple bucks, you could be waiting for hours before you hear your song because some big drunk group just came in and tipped higher than you.  This bouncer/KJ is also an infamous douchebag who has charged people in the past to bring in outside food (payable directly to him, not the bar, despite the fact that the bar does not serve food and allows outside food in).  

Songbooks need to be updated and there needs to be more of them.  About 8 books, most by song (listing by Artist is preferable), and when there are 100+ people there on a busy Friday/Saturday night, its nearly impossible to find a songbook.  Not to mention, the books have not been updated in years.  

There are a few bartenders that are okay, but it seems as though when the bouncer moved to KJ, more douchebag bartenders were hired.  

Speaking of the bar, if you want a decent beer, expect to pay 6$ (bottled Sierra Nevada).  Nothing is on tap.  Well drinks are overpriced and weak.  

Bathroom is in horrible shape, even for a men's bathroom.  Floors are dirty and unkempt.  

Watch your purse.  Shit gets stolen here all the time.

Bottom line:  take your business somewhere else.  I will never be coming back to Encore unless they get new management.  The Mint, even with its wait times, is now better than Encore(and at least it has draft beer).  Or check out the various karaoke spots in the City (Deco on Tuesday/Thursday nights, Rumors on Wednesdays, Butter on Sunday, Rocketfish on Thursdsay).
author: Matthew D.

description:
Encore, by far the Best Kareoke spot in the bay area!!!! You guys are great.

To the people who complain about the $40.00 food charge for bringing your own food, that is standard practice EVERYWHERE, (If places will let you bring your own food period) so stop bitching.

Also, the DJ's are pretty cool there. If you try to hog the mic, like a douche, while other's are singing, the DJ's will call you out, like any DJ would... Tip them, and don't abuse the 10 commandments of Encore, and everything will go good. Bottom line, dont be a douche, and you wont get treated like one!!!

Finally, I was there on 5-13-11... IF YOU ARE THE GUY WHO DID THE PERFECT SOUL RENDITION OF SMASHING PUMPKINS 1979 SONG, HIT ME UP.... YOU AND I HAVE TO DO KAREOKE TOGETHER, and paint the town red!!!

Encore, I love you guys, and keep it up.
author: Brian P.

description:
Alert the authorities. Call the press. Make a mental note. Take a picture. Whatever. I am reviewing a karaoke lounge. Dragged beyond my better judgment (thank you Kevin N), stuffed full of steak and good wine, my evening took a turn toward tacky town as I hopped in a cab and headed toward my own person hell:

karaoke at a cash-only bar

Ok, let me take off my Debbie Downer hat and break it down for you. If you're going to insist on karaoke, and your going to coerce your non-singing-in-public friends to go along, this is probably the place to do it. Especially if your friend loves dive bars. Encore is the love child of a dirty townie watering hole and a karaoke queen; yielding a stiff-drink, cheap-beer, matted-rug establishment with plenty of room to watch the show without having to be a part of it.

Thankfully, I am blessed with hilarious and talented coworkers who sang everything from "Hey Mickey" to "Ice Ice Baby," entertaining our crew (who took over the entire bar) and the random strangers who, good sports they were, slipped in a song or two between all of our riotous and ridiculous performances. And by 'our' I of course mean 'my coworkers' because I don't sing karaoke. Really, it's better for everyone that way.

Sadly, I cannot say I won't be back. It's totally fun to get a little tipsy and watch your friends act silly. Even if I have to pay cash for it.
author: Leighann F.

description:
me:
Wandered into the Encore and  fell in loooooooove with Tim the bartender.

my friend:
At 1st glance it seemed a bit off. 

me:
Tim poured me strong drinks and free shots if I drank with him (he appreciated a girl that likes whiskey)

my friend:
A few free drinks and now becoming a regular.

me:
I stumbled outa there... will be back.

the end
author: Missy D.

description:
Yes Yes Yes! Encore has rehashed my love for karaoke. Well, that and the drinks that were readily available. But still... this place is great!

A little dark, a little dingy and a little shady, this joint caters to the singer in all of us. I started off being shy of the mic but by my third drink I was ready to rock out with the best of them!

Apparently it's a huge hit with regulars who were surprisingly good singers! It was hilarious watching some of them belt out their favorites.

It's cash only, so come prepared. The vibe is laid-back and the DJ is cool as a cucumber (I'm looking at you, Mint), providing the ultimate karaoke experience.
author: Nikki B.

description:
First, the obvious: there's little doubt that Encore Karaoke Lounge is a hot mess, full of teetering covers of most of the warbling you hear at other like joints. It plays well to groups, and as such, that's pretty much exactly what you'll often encounter here, from the flock of regulars doing their level standards to the ambling pack of screechers wandering in from the street to belt out momentary lapses in reason. That can make for terrific people watching. 

Know that it's cash only, that while you don't technically *have* to grease the KJ to get him to play something, he tends to inflate (or at least infer that he's inflating) wait times in favor of those who contribute, but in reality, wait times are often much shorter than the "it's going to be an hour plus" aside would lead you to believe. There are only a handful of books here, so get your mitts on one early for options. And singalongs seem to be the rule of the day. Typical crowd pleasers prevail, and I've seldom (but occasionally) witnessed a ringer. That said, fussing about some of this stuff is roughly akin to moaning about a two drink minimum at comedy clubs - we all know the culture when we walk in, and you can either opt into that or not. For my part, I love a bit of the joyful trainwreck that karaoke often brings, so I'm sure I'll be back. But that doesn't necessarily mean this spot's without its hangups either.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Nearly all of my karaoke bar experiences are the same: walk in tipsy saying things like "oh no, I don't sing, I have a horrible voice (I really do), there's no way I'm getting up there" and end with me several shots in, on stage, belting out ABBA, David Bowie, Barry Manilow, or some such singer that peaked in the 70s. It's kind of become routine at this point.

And such was the case at Encore. It was a weeknight and my 30+ coworkers and I pretty much took over the space. Sorry to the 10 other patrons who didn't appreciate our "let's get the whole crew on stage to yell along" antics. The KJ didn't seem to mind us *too* much, but I wouldn't say he was our number one fan. Definitely more friendly then the jerk at the Mint, plus he didn't care about us having our drinks on stage (essential with this crowd).

I'm really not a fan of cash only as it gets in the way of me racking up a real tab, however the photos from my rendition of "Take A Chance on Me" are telling me that's probably a good thing.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
I give encore one star because the bartenders are great. However, I am assuming you came here to enjoy the karaoke. The KJ, I believe, has lost the will to live and is taking it out on the world.

The reality is if you want to sing you have to tip- which is an odd situation since you tip when you receive good service. But the KJ sits and surfs Facebook, looks up at you, and goes back to his Facebook until you can ask if you can please put a song in- then he grudgingly takes it. If you don't tip you don't sing. So you pay so you can sing, but the odd part is he still continues to be the biggest a-hole in the KJ scene (even beating The Mint). It's hard to tip someone for being a prick, but that's the scene here at Encore Karaoke Lounge.

Other options:
Sunday- Pandora, 500 Club, Butter
Wednesday- El Rio
Thursday- Pandora
Friday- Pissed Off Pete's 

There are heaps of other nice spots to karaoke in SF where the KJ isn't a turd.
author: M F.

description:
This place is pretty fun.  Lots of space and non-pretentious crowd.  The only thing that would make it five star is slightly cheaper drinks but then most karaoke spots are gonna make their dough on the magic elixirs that make people more likely to sing.

Love that it's in a nondescript location and I love going upstairs to any place for some strange reason - well going underground is cool too, but not here...
author: Gene X.

description:
Miami's on the scene just in case you didn't know it
My town that created all the bass sound 

so those were just some of the lyrics I was singing poorly at Encore. I'll admit it I'm tone deaf, dumb, and blind but I still had fun jumping on the mic to help a fellow from Vegas do injustice to Vanilla Ice Ice Baby. 

In what now might be tradition a crowd of us kicked off our work week with karaoke. Encore is a fantastic karaoke dive bar; nothing fancy, trendy, or chic here this is a bare bones dive (it's even cash only). The song selection is large and the stage is perfect for duets, back up dancers, and attention loving entourages. It's ideal for hardcore karaoke pros who take their performances oh so seriously and for fun-loving, too many shot downing tourists in town for the night. 

Next time I promise no Vanilla Ice... unless you really, really, want me to.
author: Maria A.

description:
Used to be a fun place for kiddies and adults alike.  

Drinks used to be good.  The bartenders used to be friendly.

The bouncers are real jerks now.  (It's not like I snuck in, just saying, don't have to be an asshole to man the place, okay?)

Now it's changed ownership....and no longer worth the trip--not to sing, drink nor people-watch here.

Find some other place...and let me know.
author: Fannie S.

description: No Cover Fee, spacious, with a pool table area, moderately priced drinks, and cool casual atmosphere. Also nearby selection of food.
author: R C.

description:
Not a bad joint. After reading all the other reviews detailing the bouncer from hell, I'm glad that on the night I went a soft spoken, rather meek man in a jacket with "Security" on the back was the only muscle in the place that I had to deal with. And he complimented me, for what it's worth.

There's a big crowd here. People love this place. If you come in with a group after, say, 9 PM, you will be standing the rest of the night. The four of us had to.

Divey, a little grimey and cash only.
author: Wes T.

description: Bum deal! My out-of-town cousins and I dropped into Encore just after 9pm on a fairly slow Tuesday night and signed up for a couple of songs. An hour and a half later, after watching the same people (including lounge employees) get up and and belt out blah ballads and way off Boadway show tunes, my cousin asked the d.j. how much longer before we were up and he told her another hour! To be sure, other customers were paying him off to get bumped up in the queue, which we considered, but instead we bought yet another round of drinks and waited our turns patiently, clapping in support and camaraderie for everyone else. LO, WE WERE NEVER CALLED. Given this injustice, coupled with the general lameness and overall stinking "raunch" of the place (literally, it was filthy), we finally beat it at 12:30am. Thanks, Encore, for the lovely welcome to out-of-towners and newcomers. You can keep your crappy clique and your sad shower song dreams of stardom; you're totally full of yourself.
author: EA O.

description:
Buncha drunks.

No beer on tap.

Rude DJ.

Smells funny.

It's your typical dive bar with a Karaoke infusion.
author: Alex S.

description:
I didn't inherit my parents stage presence....

Whenever Mom stepped onstage to sing, dance or emcee a party there was just this confidence that she had and entertaining came naturally

Dad, on the other hand, had the twinkle on the toes that if Ginger Rogers were blindfolded and dancing she wouldn't be able to tell if he was Fred or not

Like every kid who wants to prove to their parents that they can do it to, I redeem myself at Encore Karaoke Bar

I'm not a great singer but I like it at Encore & thank them for providing the awesome DJs, great songs to rock the house with & last but not least...the alcohol to keep you on the stage as you try to scream it out and not notice how much pain you've caused just by your beautiful singing ( or shrieking)

They seem to have the most recent songs too... from "Single Ladies" by Beyonce to classics such as "Open Arms" by Journey

And...they have a dance floor!

Mom, Dad...eat your heart out
author: Charmian D.

description: Originally from LA. Came here on a monday night while vacationing in SF. The atmosphere was welcoming. Gave us 2 shots on the house. Karaoke was awesome. Knocked 1 star off cuz there no beer on tap. Would come again
author: Jonathan M.

description: I have been here twice. First time - really enjoyed it. I just randomly walked in and decided to belt out a song. It's divey it's random - my kind of spot. I was at Encore the second time last weekend and I couldn't believe we had to pay KJ tips just to get our songs played. LAME!!! SOOOO LAME. Not coming back.
author: Jen R.

description:
Walked into this lounge to find a group of Asian drag queens on stage. First thought: "This is going to be a riot!" Alas, it was incredibly lame.

Tables are crammed too close to the bar. Place is unevenly lit.
author: Ryan M.

description:
We went with 20+ people on a Tuesday night, and I'm never going back. The DJ was incredibly rude, and insisted he get tipped for every song.  He mentioned this to EVERYONE who went to request a song. 

When we arrived, the scene inside was something out of the Star Wars bar. Probably 5-6 locals, a few people playing pool and our group. The place wasn't exactly packed, and this tool DJ was being an ass.

Cask only, pricey drinks and the DJ sucked. I strongly recommend taking your Karaoke to Silver Cloud.
author: Scott C.

description:
In my time, I've been known to get up and sing a rousing karaoke version of The Wreck of the Emund Fitzgerald, or even a duet of the immortal Rockwell hit "Somebody's Watching Me" provided I have enough social lubrication (aka booze) in me. I made the mistake of showing up to Encore sober. While they serve booze, there isn't any beer on tap and the best beer they had in a bottle was Sierra Nevada. At $5 a pop, there was no way I was going to drink enough liquid courage to get on stage. However, I do have to give props to the intensive amount of songs listed in their karaoke book and to Tom R. for his rousing version of Steppenwolf "Born to Be Wild." However, a good bar is a key component to a good karaoke place, and Encore failed me in those regards.

What? You want me to sing my song now? (guzzles whiskey)

The legend lives on from the Chippewa on down 
of the big lake they called "Gitche Gumee."
The lake, it is said, never gives up her dead
when the skies of November turn gloomy.

(ducks from rotten tomatoes}.
author: Joey J.

description:
Took some out of town friends there on a Tuesday.  I'll let the video do the talking, but hands down best Karaoke experience I've ever had.   Think we got up for 4-5 songs between 11-2am.  I will be back.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmdaadIjaEI
author: Adam L.

description: Cool little karaoke bar in Nob Hill.  We went on a Saturday night and it was packed out.  Apart from the main bar and karaoke stage/dance floor, there are various small tables with rolling lounge chairs for you to chill at.  There's also a pool table at one end of the lounge.  This place feels a little old.  They still use CRT-type televisions to display the karaoke lines throughout the bar.  Overall though, this place has character and the crowd was fun, which made for a good time.
author: Daniel B.

description: I didn't go here expecting much but bartenders that make stuff up are just not cool. Don't offer a drink and then be too lazy to make it. Not so hard, right?
author: Jane F.

description: The perfect after party party after dive-bar hopping on Polk! Cheap drinks, drunk singers, and a diverse crowd. What more could you ask for from a karaoke lounge??
author: LuLu M.

description: Omg this place rocks my socks!!! Most fun i have had in a long time! Came here with my friends for his b day and never wanted s to leave!! I will most def be back great drinks and specials!!!  The bartender hooked us up with some special whiskey he had.  We were instructed to sip not shoot it but my buddy was too hammered to know the difference and slammed it anyway...and he paid for it haha  I loved the drink it was killer!  If you want to be moved up in the que tip the DJ and magically your name will be called sooner than you think!  Also put in multiple songs at once so you can be put into the mix if you wait too long you wont be called and may be to trashed to sing haha
author: C. M.

description:
I stand by my belief that karaoke is one of the absolutely worst forms of entertainment ever. And this place didn't change my mind.
A group of us gathered at Encore for a friend's birthday on a Friday night. Getting in was shaaaaady: it really feels like walking into one of those "massage" parlors. The inside is pretty run down and was pretty empty until near midnight. I never went up to sing, but my friends that did complained that the DJ didn't let them sign up more than once, while other groups definitely had the same people going up over and over again.  So I dunno...I'm waiting for a magical karaoke experience that will change my view, but Encore didn't do it.
author: Emilia S.

description:
Great bartenders...Check
Great Drinks....Check
Great Music Selection...Check
Great Place to bring a Group...Check
Great Parking....(crickets chirping)......LOL!  
                I definitely suggest cabbin it, cause parking is a you know what!

Other than that, I've come here with a couple of different groups and I've never had a bad time :)
author: Ashley J.

description:
How I love Encore...let me count the ways. I've been coming here since the days of Tango Tango when the bar was full of middle aged gay men. Now its a place where regulars, hipsters, old and young alike can unite in their love for karaoke. The Mint is where wannabe singers go to die, The Core is a place where karaoke enthusiasts go to live!

In addition to being a regular, I've had two birthday parties here: the first was Cowboys and Indians and the second was Encore Olympics. I will never forget when Chris, the owner, came up to my gangsta friend (who was not in costume) and said "Honey, I believe the theme is Cowboys and Indians, not Homeboys and Indians!" And then bought us a round of shots.

Your experience at Encore will depend on what day you go there. Sunday during the day is when the really good regulars go to practice new songs (awesome if you want to hear great singing, but intimidating if you just want to belt out your favorite shower song). Tuesdays and Wednesdays are the best because that's when Brent and Vu work and they are AWESOME. They'll sing with you, take shots with you and make sure you get a chance to sing. Plus its less crowded.

I heart this place!
author: Sushi S.

description:
So, who doesn't use car rides as personal karaoke sessions, belting out tunes with reckless abandon even at stop lights when other people can see you?  I for one, am utterly and completely guilty.

In fact, I'd go so far as to say I have actually trained my voice pretty successfully in my trusty CR-V, especially on the long treks to see family in Arizona...  But what does it all mean?!?!?

Afflicted with crippling stage fright/anxiety, alas, I've never been able to really test myself. Until now.

I used to work with the Monday DJ Matt, and he would stumble into the office every Tuesday with dark circles under his eyes and a big smile on his face.  Really, he'd say, it's the Best crowd on a Monday - no pressure, no judgement, just fun.  But still, I was worried.  The last time I did any karaoke, I ended up on the sofa for three days with marginal alcohol poisoning.

My roommate had a relative in town, and tonight (a Monday) was his last one with us.  Karaoke was at the top of his list, and so I offered up Encore, knowing Mondays were cool.  1) I didn't count on being dragged along and 2) have to go to work early in the AM.  *#$&!

Seeing Matt is always a pleasure, and we settled down into our chairs and drinks.  No Way, said I.  I can't - no way.

Needless to say, a few drinks later I'm belting out Carrie Underwood and the Motels like nobody's business, and you know, it was flippin' fun!  Sure there were moments that I stumbled and refused to attempt some of the high notes, but overall, not a bad performance, and so much fun, I'm already coming up with my next set list.  Whoo-hoo!
author: Syndi B.

description:
I Friggin' LOVE Encore! As far as bars go, they've got a great drink selection at fair prices, and a pool table with a typically short line.

As far as Karaoke bars go, it's the best in the city. there's a great mix of skill levels, so you can be comfortable going on stage if you've never been to karaoke before or if you think you're amazing and really want to belt one out.

the only down side to this spot is it can get pretty packed, so show up before 9 on a weekend if you want a chance to sing. I've also seen it busy at random times during the week, so some patience is key. Otherwise sit back and enjoy the wide selection of songs the patrons tend to sing
author: Ryan M.

description:
Attended a friend's bday here last Thursday night.  Even before I submitted a song, I overheard someone refer to the DJ as "the DJ nazi".  Harsh words, "He can't be that bad," I thought.  

I thought wrong.  It took over 2 hours for my name to get called after submitting my request.  After an hour, during which time I'd started to see people get called up that had arrived AFTER I'd put my name in, I went up and politely (trust me, I wasn't drunk and pissed off...yet) asked him for an eta.  The DJ got defensive and basically shooed me away, saying there were "a bunch of people" ahead of me. 

I returned to my table thinking perhaps he'd forgotten to put me on the list and didn't want to acknowledge his mistake.  Fine.  It's a busy, loud bar, that sh*t happens.  But no need to be rude about it and act like I'm fresh off the street on the bottom of the list when I've been sitting visibly in the audience for an hour.  20 minutes later, some young drunk chick rolls in outta nowhere, submits a song, and is up on stage in minutes.  I get it, I'm a dude.  We get no priority at clubs, bars, etc. whatever.  At that point I figured this guys never gonna call me up, no big deal, I'll stick to Japan town.

Sh*tty DJ aside, the bar is a cool lounge set up, and cheap beers are always nice, but the DJ gets an "F-" for UNfriendly customer service.  To make our exprience even more absurd, 15 minutes after my inquiry, my friend asks the DJ for an eta as he was running from the DJ booth to the back of the bar where he'd sit during the performances.  Again, more defensive attitude from the DJ to the point where he kicks my friend out for asking a simple and what i'd imagine is a fairly common question - how many more songs before we're up.  DJ needs to chill!!!!

In the end, 3 of our crew of 7  waited 2+ hours before getting our songs called.  This occurred around 1:15AM after the bar and our other friends had pretty much emptied out.
author: Forrest W.

description:
Saturday night, it was the roommate's birthday. We ate a big feast at R & G Lounge and then grabbed the 1 over to Polk Street to do a little crawl. After dancing and laughing at Kozy Kar, we decided we wanted to spice up the evening with Olivia and my karaoke version of "Shoop." So we rounded the corner to Encore and proceeded to get ridiculous.

The crowd is pretty eclectic. I recall at one point hearing a Tom Petty love ballad followed by Lil Jon "Get Low." Drinks are cheap, the bartenders are irritated by the bridge and tunnel crowd but take good care of the locals...and they have the most extensive karaoke song list I have ever seen. We found our song number, created fake names (Trixie and Lacey...can you guess who I was??), and tipped the KJ.

A couple of songs later, it was our time. We each grabbed a microphone and proceeded to amaze the crowd with our Salt N Pepa singing abilities. Mid-way through the song, a few ladies came up on stage with us to act as back up dancers, and the roomie was even able to join the show for the male rap portion of the song. At the end of the song, I wished my roommate a happy birthday and bowed to the crowd. No autographs please!!

Overall, this was a super fun way to end the evening and I will be back to sing another day....whenever the mood strikes.
author: Lynsey C.

description: First time I went here I was a bit skeptical. It was on a 2nd floor of a building above a floral shop. Inside was a little divey, but the main thing is you have a good time. Lawrence is a very animated bartender and really makes you feel at home. He is super cool. He is a fellow kama'aina so we always shoot the breeze about Hawaii stuff. If we do stop by, its usually with a bunch of other Hawaii people for happy hour on Friday. During the evenings it gets really crowded but we're usually out of there by that time.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Encore is a great place IF your definition of karaoke is "drunk and idiotic douchebags singing badly."

If so, you'll have lots of fun.
If not... :(
author: Rob C.

description:
I've been here a total of 3 times. The first time I just wandered in with a friend and wasn't there to do the karaoke thing. The second time I went with Jaime and Keane, and that was kinda fun. The third time was last night, when I went with a couple friends for my birthday. It was a Saturday night and the place was busy. We waited an hour and I blew just under $20 on three of their overpriced drinks, when I could have put that money towards going to a place that lets you rent a room and sing.

Pros:

- a much higher ratio of women to men, and quite a few attractive ones


Cons:

- the place smells fucking disgusting, of vomit, piss, and shit
- a huge waste of time; you'll be waiting an hour before you even get to sing
- a waste of money; there are NO drink specials and all bottles start at $5 + tip
- most of the people who go up to sing don't even try; they butcher the songs and it sounds like shit

Waited an hour just to sing a song that I didn't even get to sing because my ride had to leave. Happy fucking birthday to me.
author: P A U L.

description: I'm upgrading to three stars because I went in there again and they got rid of the urine smell! So I got a drink and it wasn't half bad! A simple Long Island Iced Tea, but it had a kick to it!  Not the watered-down drinks you get in many other places.
author: Steve J.

description:
We had loads of fun at Encore Karaoke! 
The staff were all friendly, especially Matthew, our new favorite bartender. He had a huge selection of delicious cocktails to recommend and we had fun trying many of them. The other two gentlemen behind the bar were great to us too.
The song list had everything to choose from, and there were lots of singers with a wide range of selections. In fact, my only complaint would be that it was SO busy, we only had time to sing one song each. Next time I would arrive as early in the evening as possible. 
We can't wait to get back to San Francisco and visit Encore Karaoke again!
author: Tania D.

description:
I was only in Encore Karaoke Lounge for about an hour, but I enjoyed several things about it:

1. The beers seemed pretty cheap, and there was this neat thing where the bartender made some crack about how we could have gotten a free drink if we'd said it was someone's birthday, so my friend blatantly lied (I think she used air quotes!) and said it was hers, and dangit if he didn't give her a free shot. That's service.

2. This couple got up to sing "Suddenly Seymour" from Little Shop of Horrors, and they were wonderful. Just so good. Pretty much professional level. Normally I resent people who are too good at karaoke, because I'm small minded like that, but this just warmed the cockles of my small, bitter heart. They were SO GOOD. I may go again, just to see them.

3. It didn't feel like SF in there. And I love SF, I do, but I felt like we were in Fresno or maybe the less-hip areas of Sacramento. It was nice, for a change.
author: Leata H.

description:
When friends come to the city, I actually find myself taking them here, more often than not.  The setup is conducive to chatting in small groups (as opposed to yelling over the music to be heard by more than just the person next to you).  The song selection is comparable to The Mint,  and it's easier for me to get to by bus (I'm car-less now.).  

I've gone to more karaoke places since I wrote my last review, and I've decided that my previous review was sort of biased towards The Mint. This is honestly a grade-A karaoke setup, and with friendly people and great fun to be had.  There aren't as many karaoke superstars here as at the Mint, but that's not really a bad thing. It means that, if you can sing really well, you get a lot more excitement from the crowd :D

So far, Encore Karaoke and The Mint are my favorite fully-functional karaoke places.  Pandora Karaoke has promise, but it's a bit of a different vibe, and it's not fully open yet.

I'll be back here, to have more fun playing pool while waiting to sing my song. NOTHING beats that :D

This review is for Sat, July 17th, from 8pm-10pm; Mon, July 26, from 10pm-1am; and Thurs, July 29, 11pm-1am (and one or two other times that I can't remember the date of).
author: Jenee H.

description: encore is depressing.  it caters to tourists and burnt out locals.  BUT if you are already in a good mood, come with friends, and don't mind paying like $10 for a bud light (ok maybe $9) then it can be fun.  just gotta accept it for what it is, you know?
author: Christy C.

description: Found this place while doing the trolley car tour in San Fran and decided to go in.  We got there before the karaoke started but it was still a nice, relaxing place for drinks and had a pool table.  The drinks were good and when it was time to karaoke, the song selection was massive.  Had a great time, met lots of friendly people and looking forward to going again.
author: Carri H.

description: Drinks were cheap but weak.  You can't hear the karaoke, bartenders ignore you and too many people shoving.
author: A W.

description:
Well, its a Karaoke bar that you can never get in for a song.  I think the DJ only like to play songs for his 'friends' who actually mostly aren't even that great of singers or have lousy song selection. 

I was there with a group of 10 people and we put in 4 different songs to the DJ and in 2 hours not a single one came up. It was a friday night, but there were only about 40-50 people in the bar. Either people put in songs and left and came back or the DJ was up to something shady.

The music and microphone volumes didn't seem to be right either. For a Karaoke only lounge, I would assume they would have got this right.

The only salvation is that the place does have a good lay-out and good tables and chairs.

We all left the lounge after 2.5 hours after not a single song was sang and went and got a private Karaoke room in Japan Town which was a blast.
author: Marcus R.

description:
I wish I could give zero stars. We had the worst experience at this dump last night. We came here to celebrate my gf's birthday and when we started cutting the birthday cake some jerk came over and started screaming at me "ARE YOU GOING TO PAY THE F***ING CLEAN UP FEE?" They charged us $40 for a clean up fee. This place is so crusty inside it's gross, they haven't cleaned in years.This guy just started yelling out of nowhere, no attempt at talking to us nicely was made. He then went 10 feet away and started yelling at my girlfriend and when I said something he tried to have me thrown out. Someone in our group ended up paying the $40 and I was allowed to stay after talking to the bouncer who was much more reasonable than the jerk with the rat tail hair that started yelling. 
On top of all that, only one person from our entire party got to sing and she had to pay the DJ to jump ahead in line, some of our group waited 3 hours and never sang.
Even better was the fact that this place was filled with obnoxious frat party d-bags.
I have never given a negative review on yelp but the way we were treated by Encore was totally disrespectful. I will never set foot in here again and would strongly recommend you find an establishment that appreciates you celebrating your birthday, not charges you extra for it.
author: Arthur F.

description:
"The karoake guy is a toolio. Where do I begin. He publicly scolded karaoke singers who accidentally sang out of turn. He neglected my good friend's turn as he wanted patiently. He trumped other singers to make his 3008th debut. Otherwise, the place is alright."

The following review is brought to you by my drunk Gavin. I will add, that they do have a nice selection of karaoke songs. Just avoid the weekend crowd. And put in your songs in early...
author: Roth E.

description: The staff was extremely unfriendly.  We went to celebrate a birthday but the Dj was rude, shaming us in front of everyone for requesting 2 songs at a time.  We went early when there were only about 20 people there and it took 1.5 hours before they let us sing a song.  When we asked why others were singing two songs each but we hadn't sung one song, they said "have you ever run a karaoke bar. No?  then you don't know what you're talking about."  It sucks.  Karaoke is all about having a good time and they sucked out the fun.
author: Daniel S.

description:
If anyone tells you it is a good idea to go to a karaoke place after an afternoon of dollar beers, followed by an evening of two dollar beers, followed by some dinner and lots of sake to go with it.....

DO NOT LISTEN TO THEM!

You will find yourself being dropped on the floor by another drunk person, dancing barefoot on the stage while a large audience watches you, stumbling down two flights of stairs as you try to hurry up and smoke before your turn to sing End Of The World by REM (very badly) comes up,  and panicking because you think you lost your purse which is right in front of your face.

The people who work here are nice, the drinks are reasonable, the place is spacious and they have a pool table if you don't like to sing. Plus if you are an entertaining enough drunk they wont even kick you out!
author: Drue C.

description:
First thing's first: No ONE will care if you're tone deaf! In order to really enjoy yourself here, be with people who WANT to sing, it's pointless coming to a karaoke bar for a friend's b-day just to watch others sing. Everyone is drunk or buzzed anyway and won't care what the hell you sound like.

I didn't really enjoy it as much as I wanted to solely because people in my friend's party didn't want to participate. So majority of the time, we made idle chatter and pretended to be interested in other people making a fool of themselves. We could've been those fools together!

I even volunteered myself to go as long as someone does a duet with me but nooooo.. makes me sad coz I practiced with my magic mic at home before I left.

Come on people, let's make coming here worth while! Overall, this karaoke bar was pretty chill. A bit more for the 30-somethings, and definitely for people who have a sense of humor. 

Small area with one pool table, CASH only, and no food menu. It smells like piss in the pool table area btw...
author: Jaye C.

description:
As far as Karaoke venues go, this is not my favorite. Each time I've been here it's something different. The KJ's are decent (at least they're honest about when you can sing) and the bartenders are great (free shots?! Really? For moi? Why thank you!) but mainly it's the crowd that I just don't dig. 

When it's crowded you have to wait to get in... Encore is miserable when it's crowded. Then once you get in you have to grope your way through the crowd to get to the bar, which when it's crowded is impossible to get to. I hate Encore when it's crowded, but when it's not it's pretty ideal. 

The bathrooms always smell disgusting though. 

I found a dollar on the ground - score at Encore!
author: Mary Ella D.

description:
I've been coming here far too often lately. I don't do karaoke, strangely, but I do enjoy watching the (trainwreck at times) show. 

The good thing about this place is that it's right in the middle of San Francisco, but it doesn't try to be anything more than a suburban-style karaoke lounge. I mean, people aren't all crazy talented in there. They're just ready for a good time. The decor is meh, the chairs and tables are super old-school, and pretty much everything looks like it's headed for thrift store heaven. But I think this is part of its charm.

Good times during the week. The weekend gets a little nutso.
author: Rachel F.

description:
It's OK. If you've spent the last twenty years listening to stuff that never charts, you got to go way back. Still, there is a vast shortage of AC/DC, Ozzy and Rodgers and Hart in their playbooks. Yes, Rodgers and Hart. "Ev'rything I've Got" is meaner than anything by those heshers. Even my mother-in-law has Nirvana and The Stooges on her machine. Don't they have any idea how many drinks 'You Shook Me All Night Long' sells?

The bar service bordered on negligent, considering so many stellar performances are fueled by liquid courage. 

Eventually, the beer worked well enough that the singing "improved" as the night wore on, though I ran out of time before the que wore down enough to accomodate my eclectic ass. Lucky them.
author: Andy R.

description:
I volunteered myself to be the back up dancer for every song....
Theres even this little box in the back to stand on.  Very nice prop for the back up dancer.   Or, was it a prop?  Whatever it was, how plastered was I?

Great place for birthdays because you can sing happy birthday out loud and the cool karaoke jokey who danced with me to baby got back, will give a big shout out to the birthday girl!  He even let me write the birthday girls name (Vy) on his hand.  I insisted so that he won't mess up.  What a nice guy to  just go along with my retarded requests.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I don't get it.  
Is it because I don't sing?  
Is it because I'm total white bread? 
Was I too sober to comprehend the beauty?
Is it because I don't get a thrill from the Yacht Rock classics?  
I just don't understand why you people love this place so much.

Cash only bar.  
Totally odd crowd.  
The place looks like a bowling alley.

Security guys spent all night hitting on my friends and then gave me dirty looks and overly-aggressive handshakes when I came up to chat.  

And they were handing out liquor infused ice-pop samples that tasted like cherries and lighter fluid.

This place rates a great big DON'T BOTHER.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I popped my American karaoke bar cherry here.  It wasn't what I was I expecting.  Oh, how nervous I was!  But Kristine, Keane, Kate K and others were there for me.  They told me I would do just fine and when I totally bombed, they held me and told me I did just fine.  

Any karaoke bar where you butcher the song and people still come up to the dance floor to get their groove on is a quality joint in my book.  

I still prefer the Japanese karaoke boxes but hey when in Rome, well you know the rest.  

I will make up for last night's rendition of JT's Senorita.  Time to go practice in the shower.
author: John B.

description:
Karaoke Bravada
A lesson in linguistics

Nadja screams: "SHOW ME YOUR TITS"

translation: Its very brave of you to get up and sing crap music in front of all these people.  Why did my vodka get more expensive as the night went on?

Nadja screams: "SHOW ME YOUR TITS"

translation: I applaud your effort Mr. balding forty-something taking karaoke way too seriously.  You're right is is a good practice to tip the DJ because the karaoke IS free after all.

Nadja screams: "SHOW ME YOUR TITS"

translation: Drue C. I love you almost as much as you love Journey!
author: R M.

description:
Encore is the place where they have an excellent song selection to choose from with a pretty good sound system to boot. 
The bartenders are quick and friendly. I clocked them-30 seconds to a minute to put a drink in your hand. Since I'm not a boozer-I go for a Coca Cola. They are kind with the price as well. 
Now, I love it because I love to sing. 
Songs I did last night-
Heartbreaker-Pat Benetar
Love Hangover- Diana Ross...
Because, I'm  a diva like that.
I even had the outfit to match.
I hope to go here again soon. 
Happy Birthday Grace!!!
The ultimate diva!
She even had hairpin curls. =)
author: J A.

description:
Keys Me.

Jazz Hands.

Yelpers.

Free Whiskey Shots.

Uninvited Marie Duets. 

Good Times.
author: Aim E.

description:
There's something to be said for going to karaoke and not having to deal with people singing obscure showtunes every other song. Also, if you are a non-believer in the power of karaoke, I'm not sure if I really want to know you. Sorry.

Edit for the true karaoke fans: Their song list is very limited, especially if you are used to The Mint's wealth of song choices. If you show up on a week day, you will have the place to yourself for the first few hours and you can have the chance to warm up before the crowd arrives and you BLOW THEM AWAY.

All in all, a solid spot to supplement your (and i mean my) karaoke addiction.
author: Maria D.

description: Yay! We always have so much fun at Encore. The crowd is different on any given night but that's what makes it awesome! The staff is the best. Some of the creepy SF hipster girls dress weird with their high wasted pants and shoulder pads but we get over it! We always get to sing tons. The drinks are good and reasonably priced. We'll keep coming back again and again!
author: Ashley P.

description:
It doesn't surprise me that Yelpers give this place an exaggerated rating.  This is NOT a good karaoke bar to go to with friends.  I mean it's okay.  But not if you want to sing.  We sat and watched several regulars sing multiple times while most of our group (after arriving at 10:30) did not get to sing once.  Not once.  While other people sang three times.  I am friends with Yelpers.  I guarantee you the people who sang three times while my friends didn't sing once were Yelpers.  I mean, you can tell.

And that was okay.  If that was the end of it, then I could cope.  But it wasn't.  The last song (while there was a whole group of customers who hadn't gotten to sing yet) was sung by the staff.  That's just wrong.

When I went up to the KJ to talk to him about it he took the traditional road followed by assholes and threatened to throw me out.  It was 1:50 in the morning.  The bouncer was SINGING.  I don't think the threat of throwing me out was really that ominous.  Whatever.  I was trying to make a point.  The KJ didn't get it.  His point was that the people who sung three times were regulars.  Mine was that they weren't going to get more regulars if they didn't let people who had been there for 3+ hours sing.

So, of course the regulars love this place.  And if you're not a regular, then you won't.

That's all I have to say about that.
author: Brian G.

description:
Apparently, I sang "On Top Of Spaghetti" here one night, as a duet with my girlfriend. I have absolutely no recollection of this what-so-ever, which I'm inclined to believe is for the better. It would probably be for the better if everyone else in Encore that night also blacked out that memory, since there's no reason to believe that my singing gets ANY better after two or three of this establishment's gin & tonics... or whatever the heck it was I was drinking. I'm certain that the several beers and lack of food beforehand didn't help the situation any.

That said, a heavy dose of preferential treatment is given to regulars, so if you absolutely need to belt out a half-cocked rendition of your favorite ditties, you'd best hope that whomever you're singing with or to can cram into your bathroom shower, because you're going to wait half the night for your turn at Encore.

On the other hand, waiting half the night gives you sufficient time to down enough liquid courage to have a go at it and be able to forget later, so maybe that's all for the better.
author: Paul B.

description:
I had a blast here.  The place was great and the bartenders were friendly.  The people singing karaoke were super funny and looked to be having a good time. I am not a karaoke singer, but I looked at all the music and there was a HUGE variety.

The only negatives are the Ladies rooms needs some ventilation and some warm water to wash up with. It needs better circulation as it can get quite hot on the second floor of an SF building.  

I noticed a pool table in the upper area of the place.  It also had a few tables up there with a perfect view.  

I will be back the last weekend in September for a birthday bash, and I am sure that time will be just as good if not better.
author: Tarra R.

description:
How have i not reviewed this place yet???  Many a great night has come from a visit to Encore.  The last one was cut a bit shorter than usual, and the company i was with might not have gotten the true "Encore experience" that i am accustomed to having, but hopefully he gives it another chance.

Whenever we roll to Encore we roll at least 15-20 deep.  This is what makes this place fun.  You have to OWN the bar.  You have to have EVERY song on the list belong to someone you are with.  You have to get up on the dance floor for every song and sing into beer bottles even if you don't have the microphone and make that song yours.

More often than not you can find one of my friends singing a Love Shack duo, or singing arm in arm to an Easy like Sunday Morning.  This place is great because even if you don't have a great voice, and the song isn't the one you picked, there are screens all over the bar.  It isn't a private room kind of karaoke bar...in fact its quite the opposite.  Its a;  "Hey everyone!!!  Yah, you too!  The guy i don't know!, Come up here and look like an asshole with me!! Its fun!  What?  You don't know the words?  That's OK!!  Look everywhere!  There are screens all over the place! Man you sound just like Prince," kind of place.  Fun for the whole family
author: Lauren F.

description:
I like to go to Encore on week nights because the crowd is usually sparse - plenty of seats... and you're able to get a drink in no time. They have a HUGE book of songs to pick from and usually have a few new ones also. 
And - for the most part - the people that work there are super nice. One of the KJs even remembers my name when I come in and that makes me feel special. Encore has probably one of the friendliest bar owners I have met and it pains me to write a bad review because I know that he prides himself on how much people have a great time and he loves his bar.

HOWEVER...
Last night my friend and I were yelled at, talked down to and disrespected by the KJ to the point that I actually thought something was about to go down right in front of me.

We got to the bar at 1030...there were lots of regulars there and some sprinkling of other people in the bar...it seemed like the perfect night to practice some songs and get in a new one or two. The KJ told us the wait was 1 hour - mmm....okay... I mean, it was 1030...
And sure enough...after one hour we were up! Woot! 

After we both sang our first song...we gave him another one --- standard procedure that they won't let you put in more than one song at a time...
He said it would be another hour....okay...doable. That would put us up and singin' around 1230.

When I asked the KJ at 1:15 if we were going to be able to sing that night...he was not only rude, he was borderline hostile about my inquiry. I totally get that he probably gets asked a million times when people are going to get to go - but to get mad, blame me for not paying attention (I'm totally sober at this point and had been waiting patiently with my friend)...it's just not necessary. He told me that both my friend AND I were not going to get to sing because we missed our turn. Umm...wait...what? I didn't give him attitude, but you could feel it coming off of him when he declared he was going to do us a "favor" by letting us share a song. 
Meanwhile, all the regulars had gone before us more than once, people who had JUST walked in were blaring their little drunken vocal cords across the room and many others got more than one song in while we waited.
He took "pity" on me and put me on the list to sing in a few songs.

My friend also went up to him to talk to him about the mix up. Instead of just plainly telling her what he said to me...he got IN her face and grabbed her arm while he spoke to her. I was sitting wide eyes at our table. Ready to jump in...because it was clear he had crossed the line and broken her bubble. Like a lady, she walked away...what could you do when someone is that upset at a customer?

We were both livid, and to be honest a little scared (or I was) at this point. My song did come on...and my friend decided to film my last bit.
While filming the KJ came up to her AGAIN!...and said, you're going to get to sing...she asked why he was yelling at her and he said she was rude and disrespectful. I have it all on video...she was sweet and kind to him...and he was jumping down her throat.

I used to love this place but now I really am not sure. I know that the owner wouldn't have been okay with his attitude towards us...and I  know that the other people at the bar are good people...
But this guy is scary. The fact that he actually grabbed my friend and came within inches of her face to unnecessarily tell her off really isn't okay. To be honest, it makes me feel unsafe in that place... What would have happened if it were a busy night and there were multiple people truly rude and un-cool to that guy...how would he take it out on us that time?

I will change my review once I know that guy isn't working there anymore...
author: Katy A.

description: A karaoke dive bar.  The whole place has a layer of grime so try not to touch anything you don't have to.  It is a fun establishment with cheap drinks and the usual karaoke mix of really good and horribly bad singers.  One woman sang a beautiful All I Ask Of You and was booed off stage which really surprised me.  I can only hope this was a fluke and the normal patrons aren't as rude.  Great song list, but even after an hour my name wasn't called and I did not get to sing at all.
author: Jordan F.

description:
Now can I get an encore, do you want more?
Jay-Z

Eh, no thanks.  I stopped by early on in the evening for DYL and had a Negro Modela that tasted skunked.  Then after dinner I came back by and ordered a Stella for $5.50.  $5.50 for a bottle of beer in a glorified dive bar?  I don't think I'll be making an encore appearance here.
author: phil h.

description:
--UPDATE 12/2/06--
another happy hour at encore, and this time it was a friggin ZOO!  I tried to get to the bar when I first got in at 10 PM, but there was no way I was getting there.  Good thing I brought a hip flask this time...hahaha.  This DJ, Vu, was way better than the last guy, and he and the bartender Chris (not the owner from my first impression) got up for this amazing doo-wop duet of "Come around again" (I think?).  awesome.  When I finally got to the bar at about 10:45-11, Chris made me James Bond's Vesper (or as close as we could get to it, since they didn't have Lillet blanc), and later had a shot of bushmills with me after he helped me find my coat amongst the massive pile in the side.  Great guy.  So despite the zoo, and singing only one song at around 12:30, I have to raise the review to 4 stars because Chris was cool.  Maybe next time it won't be so nuts.

--original review below 10/21/06--
Paul, my taiwanese brutha behind the bar, saved this place from having a 2 star (or really, a 1.5 star) review.
First impression:  I go up to the bar with Ed M (who knows the bartender from his bday party).  Ed gets the bartender's attention rather quickly, and I can't really fit at the bar next to him, so I wait.  Ed orders his drink (which was on me), and then the older bartender dude (I think his name was Adam) moves on to other people.  I'm like, WTH, I didn't order the drinks for everyone else!  after a few mins I get a space by the bar.  The bartender knows I'm with ed, and DELIBERATELY ignores me!  Passes over me TWICE.  Even calls out "any simple orders?  The guy on ed's left said "jack and coke" and the bartender, shrugs at me, and then, RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME, makes the guy's drink without even asking if it was OK by me.  

When he finally got back to me, I order my 4 drinks.  At least the guy let me taste the vodka before I bought the martini.  And he made it well (no ice in the glass), with the tiniest shaker I've ever seen.

The song selection was really good here, but perhaps us yelpers just overwhelmed the bar.  I got to sing Wicked Game, but didn't get to follow it up with any of the other 4 songs I put in... from 7:30 til almost closing, when I bugged the DJ and he finally put another of my songs in.  I know that Marie A tipped the guy $20, and still had to wait like over an hour for her song to come on, and even had to bug the guy til it did!  messed up!

The saving grace was my taiwanese brutha Paul behind the bar.  He got ice in my martini, but he was the nicest dude, and poured a few jack daniels shots with whoever I was at the bar with :).  chinese style--no wussy shots.  If it weren't for him, I wouldn't have gotten my second song I don't think.  Paul is awesome!

So final tally.  first bartender/manager 1.5 stars (at least he let me try the vodka first), DJ 1.5 stars (it was a busy night, so I cut him SOME slack), Paul 4 stars.  Average:  3 stars.

I might come back later, when it's a little slower.
author: Fong L.

description:
If you want a weird and crazy way to spend a night in San Francisco, this is as good as anything you'll find.  And San Francisco has some weird and crazy things to offer.

Maybe it's a little more happening on a Saturday night, but on the random weeknight I came through there were some real characters up on stage here.

What compels someone to sing a heartfelt and completely tone-deaf version of Sting's "Fields of Gold" in front of a crowd of complete strangers?  I don't know.  Just how much effort did that guy put in to get that good at impersonating Ray Charles?  I'm not sure about that either.  

But it makes for quite a show.
author: Andy B.

description:
this has become our sunday night staple after takinig a nap from bottomless misosas. its cash only and the drinks are pretty cheap. sometimes it takes a while to get your song to be played but most people are willing to wait. its usually a good party on sunday nights. ive been a few times during the week and it has been ok.

the bartender is always fun to watch and its pretty funny to see what people will actually sing. i have heard it all here including disney classics and one time some girl belted out a paris hilton song. (i am a little embarassed that i knew exactly what it was when i heard it...fail on my part)

if you sing a good classic you can expect half the place to get up and dance or even sing with you. till next sunday!!!
author: Ashley H.

description:
I used to have such good taste in music until I started hanging out at Encore (formerly Tango Tango). Now it's all Little River Band, Bob Segar, Ambrosia, Kool and the Gang...you know, 70's soft-cock rock. (SIGH)

On weekends, the clientele ranges from middle-aged gay regulars to 20 something Marina types slumming it up for the evening. The staff is ridiculously friendly, the girls are usually cute and friendly, and the singing is generally tolerable. The bartender or manager will happily roll liars dice with you when it's not crowded.

You havn't lived until you've experienced 50 drunk strangers staring indifferently at you while you butcher "Sister Golden Hair". For shame John T.....Shame.
author: John T.

description:
This is the first time that I have deleted a review and re-written it because my opinion of the establishment has changed so much:

Where once I gave Encore one star - I now give it three and a half stars (dang-it, Yelp!  When ya gonna pony up with the half stars?)

Here's why they gain two and a half stars:
The past three times I've been to Encore I've had a great time.  Lemme run them down for you:

1. May 2007 with my brother and sissy-in-law... we were trashed, but headed over there anyhow because I heard that a particular group of friends would be there.  (More like Drue said: "You better come to dive bar and sing 'Sister Christian' with me!)  So we did... 

Beers?  $11  Cab home? $20 Memories made by singing Madonna's "Like a Prayer" with your baby brother and sissy-in-law?  Priceless.

2. After the Elite event at Otis.  They had free Finlandia vodka (!!!!) and ice cubes that light up and free t-shirts.  Plus, Drue and I got a standing ovation for 'Sister Christian.'

3. Last night - I did what our lovely mistress Jessica T calls "Sober Karaoke."  Why?  Because, even though I'm on the wagon I had to go celebrate my Dreamgirl Yelper's birthday by taking her a mix cd (I'm poor) and listening to her hawt-azz rock the mike out with some amazing vocal stylings.  In fact, a lot of peeps had amazing vocal stylings last night... Ed (who practiced a song for Gracie,) Berna, Molly  R. & Chris K., Joshua/Mascarawand, Faithy, Eric... Mebee I could appreciate it more because I wasn't slumped in a corner drooling on myself.

There were also a lot of amazing people who I haven't had much chance to catch up with since coming home out last night.  (Both Gabey-babies, Euge, Jeff, Beez, JT, Beau, Ted, etc.)  It made my heart smile to see them.  Plus, I finally got to meet Lulu and Rye G!  Yay, two of my favorite online people in real life!!!  :)

Sober Karaoke has it's advantages - you can leave when you're tired of it with very little effort - AND, you don't have a sore throat and hangover the next morning.

Plus, chair dancing and singing along was fun.

Why encore loses a star and a half from me:
1. Remember in my old review when I said drinks are HELLA expensive (I believe the bartender charged me $12 for a Kettle One and cran...)  Yeah, well they are STILL hella expensive.  Ask me how much a bottle of water cost.  Go ahead, ask me.

Okay, I'll tell you:

$2.50

WTF?  I coulda had a beer or well drink elsewhere for that amount of money!!!  Baby is poor, she's drinkin' tap water from the bathroom from now on when she gets her karaoke on at Encore.

Yikes.
author: Kate R.

description: My favorite karaoke spot in the city, been coming here for years. Great bartenders, friendly KJs and a strong large song book that has a really deep selection. Recently that selection has been broadened thanks to KJ Lee who has added some great hard to find tracks to the mix. You'll also find Lee behind the bar where in addition to boasting a pretty formidable t-shirt collection, he's quick with a drink and a friendly face. Recommended any night of the week.  Tues nights with with Robin behind the bar are also turning into a really fun and wild night.
author: Peter G.

description:
This place has it all: 
As you walk in you'll see Wahoos, tattoos, gurus, cuckoos, hoohoods and shrews. 
At the bar you'll get your share of booze, brews, cashews and chews. Listen for the karaoke blues sung by girls with big hairdos and pink tutus. 
Beware of the restrooms there is a strong sent of mildews and spews.
Leave your values and curfews behind and bring your kazoos for your debuts.
author: Dee C.

description:
Like Kate, this place has redeemed itself in my eyes.

Last time I was here was with my ex, over a year ago. We were in the process of separating but had friends in town, and decided to make nice for the evening. The veneer of being a happily married couple came crashing down in the presence of alcohol and songs. 

My ex decided to verbalize our drama in interpretive song. Each performance was preceded by a sarcastic dedication to me, which culminated in a nearly forced duet of "Don't You Want Me?"  It was so uncomfortable that two of my friends have been permanently scarred from karaoke. Looking back, I understand it was his way of working out his anger toward me in the way that he could. 

After a year's reprieve, I decided to give Encore another chance. How time, a beautiful birthday girl and new Yelp friends (some of which have quickly become an extended family to me), can make all the difference in the world. 

Joy and Gracie knocked me out with their vocal abilities. Who knew that such robust voices emanated from these tiny women? And Eric W rocked the house with "Epic." Christopher K and Molly's duet brought tears to my eyes. Ed to the M, I live in a sea of regret for missing you rock Christina Aguilera to new heights. If there's anyone I left out, blame my moth-eaten brain, eroded by too many DYLs. 

Truly a magical evening. Thank you for making karaoke safe again.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Maybe we just went on an off night.

The KJ or karaoke MC, whatever you want to call him, was being SO rude to people, in a spiteful way.

The busboy, or whomever, didn't seem to be able to go around the people in our party. Instead, he scowled and was mean to whomever was in his way.

If it weren't for the fact that we got over it, put our collective sense of humor to use, and had a great time singing (poorly, in my case) to great and new classics, I would have given this place 1 star. 

So, yeah. Encore -- 1 star. 2 bonus stars because my group of friends are awesome. Meh.
author: Da J.

description:
I really really like this place a lot more than The Mint.  First impression... why the eff are people smoking right next to the door.  Yeah, so there is a permitted smoking area right outside the entrance of this place--which actually worsened the air quality inside the place (really hot and humid).  

The drinks I had were not that strong, which I appreciate, but if I don't even get TIPSY off 3 pineapple malibus (low-alky-tolerance), then maybe they're really not putting enough rum in my drink.  
The wait for the songs are ridiculously long.  I had to harass the KJ a lot to make sure that my song was coming up.  In the meantime, I provided enough backup dancing for a number of performances.  

I really like that the view of the stage is unobstructed, lots of seating space (unless there is a throng of people standing in front of the singer, then you really can't see), and they have 2 stalls in the bathroom.

I LOVE the karaoke system they have.  The song quality is very good, unlike the synthesizer crap I am used to with my Magic Mic (yes, I have my own portable karaoke system).  Will return here one of these days.
author: Grace M.

description:
No one believes me.  I don't know why?  I'm not lying. 

I...used to be....shy.

Seriously!  I would tremble and shake when having to talk to a crowd of people!  I did ACTUALLY cry I was so nervous when I gave my speech to the student council for elections. I didn't even have anyone running AGAINST me!

Anywho...I was shy.  Didn't raise my hand in class, didn't stand out at all.  

Then my junior year I realized...Hey!  I don't give a good god damn what people think of me!!!  

Now I'm the fun, quirky, blunt as hell, kick ass BITCH you all know and love! 

Anyone want to jump up on the stage and belt out some rock ballads?!?!  

"Hit me with your best shot! Fire awaaaaaaaaaaaaayy!!!!"
author: Jay H.

description:
Encore Karaoke Lounge is a lounge specifically designed for karaoke, complete with a stage and lights that make you feel like a rock star.  There is an abundance of tables and chairs if you are with a group, and they let you take in or get food delivered from other places.  The collection of songs (conveniently sorted by song title or artist) is huge, as I found myself flipping through hundreds of pages.  The bar is cash-only, but at least the beer is ice cold.  The crowd can be loud, raucous, and fun, and they will also have the heart to compliment you if you sing well.

The only problem is, it seems like every other song, the KJ doesn't sync the words correctly, and he would have to abruptly stop and restart the song again.

Remind me what this place is again?  Oh yeah, it's a karaoke lounge.  You would have thought that these kinds of technical problems would have been sorted out by now.

As other yelpers have mentioned, this place does tend to fill up, so if you want to get your songs in, get them in early, or else you may have to wait an hour to get up on the stage and strut your stuff!
author: Marlon E.

description:
this joint has a good friendly local vibe..bit aged..but...large enough to accomodate large groups...75 cent pool table....large stage area to belt out some tunes....$2.50 beers....$3.50 well drinks....'til 8pm....always fun times in the neighborhood....

*thanks for the comp'd drinks....
author: Hen A.

description:
After an amazing evening including a hands-down Grammy earning rendition of "I will survive" with the Yelp HQ crew...you may wonder why the star count is not reflective of the star-quality performances...

One member of our party was very sick, and she was toting the normal baggage of a pack of tissues and a bottle of water.  Within seconds of walking in, she was accosted by whom I assume was the owner/manager.  The conversation went as follows:

Manager:  You can't have THAT in here.
Yelper: Oh - it's just water... (sniffs added for good measure)
Manager:  we SELL water here.

We all stood in an awkward silence for a moment where I both anticipated his "I'm just joking" comment... as well as her swift unleashing of a water-bottle upside the head.

Neither happened, and we all went along our way.  But I just have to ask:  really? I mean...really? It's just too bad.
author: Laura N.

description:
Encore Karaoke and Sofia's next door is a dangerous combo for my liver and my lungs. I honestly don't know how much longer I can live if I keep going to these places...

At Encore, it was the first time (but certainly not the last) I've...

1. Dueted with Ed M (Good Vibrations by the Beach Boys)
2. Gotten so drunk that I ended up in the fetal position on the carpet (which I don't think has been cleaned since the 70s?) 
3. Told by a bouncer that I couldn't sit down on the carpet (see number 2)
4. Had to be LITERALLY carried home by a friend 
5. Wanted to take a taxi for three blocks because my head was spinning (see number 4)
6. Done interpretive dance
7. Been hit on by a tall gay black man.
8. Been told "You're VERY cute!" by a tall gay black man.
9. Puked in the toilet while aforementioned tally gay black man was in the bathroom. 
10. Watched Ed M perform "Total Eclipse of the Heart."

Thank you Encore for these many firsts.
author: Patrick L.

description:
As a general rule, karaoke bars rate about as highly on my personal enjoyability scale as dentist appointments, meeting the Significant Other's parents at a formal dinner, and paying Social Security taxes that I know will get scammed and stolen by Halliburton anyway. 

But damn if I didn't have an awesome time at Encore.... 

How much fun was it? Glad you asked: It was so fun that I don't even remember the second half of it. THAT's how fun it was. 

I do seem to recall busting out a punked-up cover of "Rock This Town," stealing a cute blonde girl's beer during the guitar solo section (sorry about that), and then seeing a friend of mine get arrested later in the night...while he was onstage, no less! 

After that, I only remember things that would be impolite to mention in a public forum.

Drink prices are definitely borderline. But the upstairs "social club" atmosphere makes it feel like a hangout for second-tier yakuza members; as long as I leave with all my fingers still attached, I'd say that's a good thing. Maybe they can even help me navigate the karaoke songbook listings, which seemed to vary in quantity, quality, and page arrangement depending on which binder you had at any given time of night.
author: John G.

description: They were horrible at keeping people not only in order but also aware about their spot in line.  Then they skipped my friend who's birthday it was; when she asked him when she could sing if she gave him $5, he said "in 40 minutes" and then argued that he never received an original tip from him.  The cocktails sucked and you get bumped all over the place- I got so much stuff spilled on me because the people that come there are dicks. I would never go there again.
author: Chantel C.

description:
So, I don't really like karaoke.  However, my husband and some of my close friends DO love it, and, as a result, every couple of months I look around and suddenly realize that that wailing in my ears, that swimmy feeling from too much alcohol, & that leering guy in too-tight jeans are all my own precious fault for getting carried away and thinking I can do this too.  (Yeah, the wailing was my own sad attempt at trying to simultaneously snarl ala Billy Idol while singing 'White Wedding' or something equally 80's and equally silly.)  My "secret" to good karaoke is to try to sing something others will sing along to (and thus drown me out), and to dance around using wild histrionics (and thus distract people from the actual painful event of my singing).

But what I love about Encore is that they keep letting me sing!  (Granted, maybe this would = minus stars for the rest of you.)  It's not like those other pretentious bars (like the one that rhymes with "Lint," where you practically have to blow the KJ to get your song in).  Furthermore, the drinks are crazy strong, the crowd is a weird & friendly mix of office party, birthday party, and just-to-go-out party.  By the end of the night everyone is dancing on the dance floor all sloppy and huggy.  Just love it.
author: Ravena F.

description:
Finally visited Encore last night for some Yelp karaoke action and it was a fantastic time for all!

Much less attitude than many other karaoke bars, and the crowd acknowledges and apprecites all the singers' efforts. Extremely friendly staff who was very helpful when my jacket went missing. The song wait got pretty bad towards the end of the evening, which bummed us all out. It didn't seem like the KJ goes in the other of songs as they are received, but I could be wrong. My one other constructive suggestion is to update the song lists with more new releases and get more songs from RENT!!!! :)

Despite the minor kinks, Encore is a fantastic place which is great for a group. Friendly crowd, too!
author: Jill M.

description:
We arrived here way to late to meet up with some Yelp pals, or at least we thought.  It was nearing 1030p and some of the die-hard heads were still around which balanced out an already cool collection of peeps adding to the festive atmosphere of Encore.

I saw AP and gave him some love and he let me know most of the gang went over to Rockit Room to support Keane...oh snap, i knew there was one other place we needed to go!  Anyhow from revs i read b4 i heard it is near impossible to actually get some mic time after 10.

After ordering a bombay tonic i began sippin and scanning the songbook and immediately wrote in my two go-to tracks- Take On Me and More Than Words...went up to the DJ booth behind the main stage and looked at this dood with mutual familiarity.  He asked if i went to El Camino High and i told him a bunch of my friends did (i was still in middle school when i used to visit some friends there) and we started name-dropping till we hit one we both knew..

Anyhow, Sid was super-cool and like ten minutes later I found myself in front of the screen doing my best AHa impression with the moody look and rockin the Molly just a bit off-beat.  I even had some crowd interaction with people i don't know come along and act as my background dancers!!! Cool!!!

I felt like a rockstar for a bit cause of the super supportive and animated crowd!  Will defintely be here again..rock on!!
author: omar b.

description:
So we're sitting at our table waiting for our turn to sing, when this middle-aged black man walks in.  He strides up to the DJ (okay, are they called DJs?  Or just "that guy in charge of karaoke"?), drops in his request (and probably a hefty tip) and BAM.  A couple songs later, he's standing on stage.

He proceeds to belt out the best damn rendition of anything I've ever heard in a karaoke bar, finishes off to thunderous applause, and then proceeds to swagger out the door as if to say, "I came, I showed all you assholes how it's DONE, and now I'm out.  Peace!"

Thank god we weren't up next.  There was no way I could have lived up to that shit.

In conclusion - strong, awful drinks, hot bartenders, and a bizarre mix of people who can really, truly sing and people who really, really can't.  What more could you ask for?
author: Kelly V.

description:
Confession:  I don't sing. But apparently I do at Encore.  I'm not sure what it was about this place that led me from sitting and toe tapping to dancing and working the microphone.  

Maybe it's because Encore is an odd mystical phenomenon in itself.  Sort of like the mystery spot in Santa Cruz.

Maybe it's because all of the freaks, hip hoppers, yuppies, goths, punks and otherwise came out of the woodwork to gather and gorge themselves on cheap drinks.

Maybe it's because the DJ had everything from Justin Timberlake to Bon Jovi to The Cure to Heart.

Or maybe it's because Chris did a Fiddler on the Roof number.  

That must be it.

Best. Birthday. Party. Ever.
author: Nicole G.

description:
If you see me singing karaoke someplace that looks unseedy, I'm probably at a corporate retreat. In which case, shoot me.

But if it's someplace sufficiently seedy, then there's a very good chance I'm here. If it's a non-weekend night, so I can sing at least four songs for every three drinks.

Much Country, the owners preferred genre, and lotsa 80s Rock.  Most Country songs clock in at three minutes or less, and as a total Mic Whore, I can stand to sing a longer song most times. 

Always tip your KJ. Especially if you suck or are a high-maintainance drunk. Yeah, you're motorin'...
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I did not go up when I went but it was still awesome! It was a Friday night and we all got there around 8. It started getting super packed around 10 I think. 

The crowds were great. There are a lot of ppl that comes in groups. 
Oh, but the best thing about this place is their BLOODY MARY!
it is, so far, THE YUMMIEST thing I've ever tried. 
The bartender was super friendly and funny when he offered me to try it. It came with 3 or 4 asparagus sticks. A MUST TRY!
author: Miss C.

description:
I used to live at the Encore. I used to frequent it when it was the Tango Tango. Back then it always looked so intimidating and rather nefarious.
