I thought it was some sort of serious Asian social crime den. I finally got my nerve up and wandered in. I come to find out it was a gay karaoke bar, I immediately started kicking myself for being such a wuss and not discovering it sooner. There was almost never anyone there and the patrons and owners were always so nice. Less than a year later it was sold and became the current incarnation of Encore Karaoke. 

   The owner is fantastic, kind, funny and a great singer. He drinks Bushmills like it was mothers milk, or boys milk as the case may be. The thing about Encore is that it is the friendliest karaoke lounge in the city. NO Karaoke Gastapo like at the Mint, Actually efficient staff unlike Silver Clouds. The Encore consists of one large room, bar on your left, stools, and a single row of tables. To your right, raised up about 18" from the main floor  has another half dozen tables and a pool table. The ceiling height is low, and the place desperately needs a makeover, but that won't happen any time soon. There are two tiny bathrooms, also in desperate need of a makeover. The stage area is huge, and it is level with the rest of the bar floor. The equipment could use some updating, but their song list is undoubtedly the largest selection in the city. I know I have donated more than a couple songs from my own library. 

   Sunday through Wednesday is the time to go. You will get a nice mix of regulars and fun goers of widely varying types and walks. Thursday- Saturday it gets overrun with the Marina scum oozing and sliming their way out of their moist landfilled perfume reeking lair. It gets WAY too crowded and is really NOT fun. The drinks are priced on the higher end for the neighborhood, but the bartenders will always be good to you. If your looking for karaoke, then Encore should be your destination.
author: Christopher N.

description:
Up the stairs is a nice two-level bar with, as their name suggests, karaoke!  It was great to see people really get up and sing.  It makes me wish I knew how to sing better, myself.  And as far as not knowing any modern songs, most of the people who got up were singing classics anyway.  Fear of public speaking?  How about fear of public singing?  More power to you, Yelpers!  

I couldn't find the stairs back down, and I wasn't even drunk!
author: David D.

description:
Karaoke is a competition.  And the truth is, I always win.  On rare occasions, I may tie for first.  But otherwise, I tend to bury everybody else.

Last night at Encore Karaoke was no different.  Everybody in there needed an education in karaoke and I taught them all a lesson.  We were here last night for a friend's birthday party.  There seemed to be a good mix of people in there, different ages and ethnicities.  People that sang oldies, country, pop.  It was a good mix.

The bar at Encore Karaoke was a little run down, the kind of bar you see with old paint and Christmas lights.  Don't bother trying to open a tab here either, it's cash only.

As for the karaoke itself, it's decent.  There are screens throughout the bar for people to sing along.  There's a small dance floor area where you sing, and there's a KJ who takes care of all the requests (can also carry a tune himself).  The sound system is just OK, you do have to strain to hear some vocalists, especially when you're sitting in the back.  

Last night, it was up to a two hour wait to get your song played.  So if you want to sing, no playing the mic hog.  Also, the song selection isn't all that great, but it's adequate, and the crowd is friendly enough to sing along to half of them.

So if you're down for a karaoke-in-front-of-the-crowd dive, or if you're like me and simply want to obliterate the competition, I guess Encore Karaoke will get the job done.
author: Tony L.

description: This is my favorite place for karaoke! It doesnt get a crazy as the mint where you are lucky to get to sing.
author: Disco B.

description: Super fun people watching and great drink prices!!  Def a neighborhood gem!!
author: Deb T.

description: This is the best karaoke bar in the city! Cheap strong drinks and a song selection the size of an encyclopedia! Everyone is great so don't forget to tip at least a dollar per drink and song.
author: Zachary A.

description:
Im still giggling.... its a dive of the biggest proportions but it s so much fun ... and i wasnt partaking in the Karaoke... just watching.  The bar staff are really friendly , the song selection is huge and there's a cash machine inside. 

Its a great size for a party!
author: Amy W.

description:
Totally random. So random. Beyond random.

This place requires two big bouncers on a Friday night. And the KJ seemed more busy with a woman at the bar, instead of managing the singers and songs. 

The crowd is...odd as well. And no, I don't appreciate being asked by some foreign man to go back to his place for "some more white wine."

I crashed Chelsea's song after the KJ told me that the list was closed. It became a *beautiful* duet...Janet Jackson. So awesome.
author: Misha F.

description:
This was my first karaoke experience so I can't really judge. It was freaking toasty. 
My friend commented that it was "probably quite similar to hell, on many levels" 
They also don't have anything on tap. This is how I found out.
"do you have guinness"
"negro modelo is like guinness"
"no, do you have GUINNESS"
"It is good"
"umm, so you don't have anything on tap do you"
"no, why do you ask"
"uh, i'll just have jameson then."

oh, and I sang "I will survive" with about 50 other people. that was fun.
author: Mango D.

description:
Remember that trashy bar that you and your friends used to go to in college, the one with the nasty carpet and the busted pool table? The place that was kind of nasty, but all that really mattered was that there was cheap alcohol and all your friends were there?

Here's mine: http://www.yelp.com/biz/32XZxEGUFoU-M6ksQAry1g

Encore kind of looks like that place. And friends were certainly there, at least that night. But the alcohol was not all that cheap, and I'm old and snooty now and I pay attention to things like atmosphere. 

There's Karaoke, sure, but places like Amnesia and Annie's Social Club have karaoke nights too, and Encore lacks Amnesia's beer selection and ASC's seedy charm. If you live nearby or you have to have Karaoke more than one or two nights a week it serves a purpose, I guess. 
Don't pay too much attention to me though; I'm kind of like the karaoke grinch.
author: matthew r.

description:
If you know me at all - you know I am one big U2 nerd. I HEART them. There is no better band out there in my opinion.

And yet - I may have experienced the one performance that might give Bono a run for his money. ;-)

Encore Karaoke Lounge is the place where I watched Jeremy, my boss, the co-founder and CEO of Yelp.com sing "ONE" by U2.

PRICELESS.

Enough said.
author: Meg M.

description:
SF peeps really know how to put on a show~! And so nice too~!!

White girls in dark shades groovin' and rappin' to "Baby Got Back." And not missing any of the lyrics. Crazy~!! And a Celine Dion sound alike...I mean really amazing. 

I had a fabulous time at Encore. I was supposed to go to DYL because some of the SF yelpers asked me to come by. Funny thing is...the ones who asked me to come by weren't there. Haha. I did meet some other cool yelpers though...AP, Tien...ummm...can't remember the names of the others cuz I drank everything our nice bartender gave me. Sorry nameless yelpers. I'm sure you guys don't remember me either. Eh...whatever...it's all good. 

Our bartender was super duper cool. He gave me and my friend a couple of complimentary drinks. I got to try an Australian vodka made from distilled grapes. The name starts with a B. Bambosa? Bamboozle? Boombasa? I don't know. It was pretty good. It went well with my Henney and coke and mudslide. Not really. 

So...I didn't sing, but I did do some ALLEGED pole dancing by the bar. Me? Innocent moi? I don't believe it. I don't remember. So even if I did...it doesn't count, right? I don't know...by the end of the night everyone around me were my friends and I theirs. We sang along, danced (?), and best of all played PHOTO HUNT~!!! I love that game. Good times!
author: Caroline Y.

description:
Are there better Karaoke bars in the city? For sure. (The Mint and Do-Re-Mi are the first to come to mind.) But as far as proximity to home (Silver Clouds is also close to home for me but it's not nearly as interesting as this place) and diversity of the crowd this place has that in spades. I mean where else can you go, sing some Sinatra, and then be congratulated by an elderly, drunk, gay man who then tries to lean in for a post performance smooch? (OK maybe The Mint) Easy there killer! I had no idea my singing could make an old gay man swoon like a teenage girl *blush* I feel so special!

Ahh yes if you're ever in need of an ego boost to feel like a star Encore is your place. I'm pretty convinced that this place is the "UN" of San Francisco. Where all types of people come together and belt out their favorite songs in a place that appears to have been furnished with the same furniture that was in my Grandmother's basement circa 1977. You get some rougher types from the East Bay, Trannys from the gulch, straight, gay, hot, not so hot. 

And once inside everyone seems to bond on the one common interest that brought us all together... to drink, sing, and make asses out of ourselves in public and be congratulated by our peers. Hell I've made a few good friends from my many outings at this place. So in conclusion: Yay Encore.. Old gay smoocher... not so much but you can't blame a guy for trying I guess.
author: Michael K.

description: I'm a karaoke snob. I also detest any bar where you have to BRIBE The KJ to get into the queue. Went there on a Saturday night with some friends. Unknowingly put our songs in with our meager tips then proceeded to wait over 2 hours before someone discovered we'd been bumped to the bottom of the queue god-knows-how-many-times. Maybe I'm being a whiny b***... someone said that's just how it is in this city. I guess I'll start calling the bars ahead of time to see if this is their policy? I'd rather take my karaoke and alcoholic dollars elsewhere. Oh and the place is also kind of dirty...
author: Michelle L.

description:
Encore = best karaoke bar in the city! exclamation point! 

Encore never lets you down. The people are way more friendly and supportive than the crowd you'll find at The Mint. And the singers are not professionals like you'll find at The Mint; which to me, makes it a lot more fun. The bar tenders and KJ are cool and the bar is gay-owned. 
If you're the type of person who wants to listen to people singing karaoke classics like "Don't Stop Believin'" at the top of their lungs and join in as the whole bar runs up to dance behind them, then Encore is your bar!
Just don't bounce around too much because then the CD will skip :)
author: SarahM B.

description:
This place was pretty fun, but super crowded. But then again I went on a Saturday night. It was my birthday, but it must have been 3 other people's birthdays because it was packed. There was a table of 50 some girls, pretty crazy. One of them slapped my butt, it was fun.

They have a huge selection songs, but the sound system really sucks. They really should have fixed it, I could barely hear myself singing from the speakers although my mouth was right next to the mic. Some other people who sang, I couldn't hear them at all.

It is a neat stage, just wish they fixed the speakers. Probably loose wire somewhere. I accidentally kicked the speaker and it worked for a second, then it went out again. haha. So I know it's fixable. 

Probably come here on a weekday or really really early on the weekend if you actually want to sing a song. Otherwise it's an hour+ wait.

Also tons of pretty girls come here, and lots of straight boys too. At first I thought it was like a gay karaoke place, but it really isn't. But of course totally friendly. Everyone was laughing and having a good time. It was a lot of fun. Just wish it wasn't as crowded HAHA!
author: Xavier G.

description:
I am a karaoke golden god. Ok, that may be stretching the truth just a bit BUT I do love me some karaoke. When I walked into Encore I thought, not bad. Kinda divey, not too crowded, good mix of people. I saddled up to the bar, got a drink and took a look at the song list. More than impressive. Honestly, this may be the best karaoke song list I have ever seen. Things were looking great for a long night of singing, drinking and making an ass out of myself, my favorites things to do.... then things started to suck. 

I wrote down my song and walked over to the KJ. I stood there ignored for a few minutes reading the KJ rules, one being no more than one song in queue at anytime. I place my request, offer to buy the KJ a drink (he refuses) and go meet back with my friends and the waiting begins. I wait and I wait.... it was a busy night but not THAT busy. I start to see the same people shuffle up to sing songs, so much for one song in the queue.... After an hour, my name is called, I walk up to the mic and I am told that the song is for the "other" Melissa. The chick that just walked into the bar and had her boyfriend tip the KJ a $20 to put her first.  I walked out feeling jilted....  ugh. I will continue to go elsewhere, you know places that actually let everyone get a turn. :(
author: Melissa J.

description:
This bar onced called Tango Tango use to be a great place to go if you wanted to sing 20 times in a night. You still can if you come on Mon-wed or real early when they first open at 6. Alas such a great thing has been found out by the masses. I still love this bar and have been comming to it since it's first week.

I am happy for the new owners and I am happy to find that the people that work there are verry nice to everyone through all the staff changes. Yes it is true now the weekends are packed since people found out about this place but the drinks are still strong and everyone seems to still clap for every one getting up to sing (NO MATTER HOW BAD I SOUND).

As one of the owners likes to say "The more you drink the better I sound". Cudos to the new owners and the staff. On the notes about the KJ I have never had a bad dealling with any of them and as a former bartender around town I would only have to chalk it up to one thing. When you come back to someone over and over again asking when will it be my turn that can be a little frustrating to any one since many people do that to them all the time.
author: don h.

description:
This place would get a good review if the DJ would just get off his power trip.  No need for the attitude when you're just trying to go out and have a little fun.

*UPDATE* 
One of the DJs emailed me to apologize.  I have gone in since my last review and they were definitely much nicer.  We usually have a lot of fun here, so I don't want to knock the place, but I would expect they would be nice to everyone, whether they know they are going to be reviewed or not.

*Another Update*

Okay, the DJ must have just been having a bad night when I wrote the first review.  My friends and I have been back a number of times, and we have been treated well each time.  I really do love this place, we always have a blast and it tends to draw a very friendly crowd, so I'm glad I can now go back often without the bad feelings.  Encore, you have redeemed yourself in my book!!!
author: Erica G.

description:
Yup, it's a karaoke bar.  On the plus side, the bar is pretty big, the 'tenders are friendly, and the karaoke space is huge.
On the minus side, they have no beer on tap. This makes me cry.  And we can't have crying pirates.
author: Don H.

description: This place sucks...everybody that works there seems to be in a bad mood. The bartender was rude and arrogant, and the KJ only works with tips. We had to wait 2 hr to hear our names and guess what? and the KJ put the wrong song...so disapointing! . We waited 1 hr more and we end up leaving without even singing one song, while people who got there after us sang 2 or 3 times. The place is nasty, the TV screens old, the drinks expensive, the sound is horrible. Don't waste your time going there!
author: Lina C.

description:
"The race is not to the swift,
Nor the battle to the strong...
But time and chance happeneth to them all"

---- the biblical book of the Ecclesiastes.

Lot of success happens from Timing and Chance but once we achieve some success, our Ego makes us forget the real causes. That is why, comebacks are so rare and it is very difficult to have an ENCORE in REAL WORLD(maybe in MTV's real world). Thus, I was impressed at the boldness shown by Todd E. when he decided to do an ENCORE and return the DLT back to a night of karokee singing at Encore.

I walk into Encore last evening a little apprehensive since the laws of history are against a successful Encore happening at Encore. The last time, DLT at this venue was one of its most successful ever and it served as a debutante ball for several notable yelpers like Jenny O, Liza B and Amy W. This time, there were lots of other distractions like Holiday parties, Ice Skating events etc.

In light of the above, the DLT at Encore was a fairly successful Encore. Some notable yelpers like Marie A(with hubby in tow), Sav B., Gracie,  etc were conspicuous by their absence. There were too many non yelpers hogging the limelight. But on the positive side, we did get Omid wasted and I was suitably impressed by the quality  of conversation with some of the newbies on yelp like Brandymanhattan .

 Jill K.'s rendering of "All that jazz" from the musical Chicago touched my heart, and reflecting back, I realized that the lyrics
"Come on babe
Why don't we paint the town?
And all that Jazz"

stood for the spirit of yelp and particularly the DLT.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
Things I like about Encore:
+Cool inside/2nd story location
+Stiff drinks
+Cool bartenders that do shots of H2O 
+Great song selection
+Ample stage space
+The fact that you can just hang out and it feels like a regular dive bar
+The resident sultry songstress Heather

Things I don't like about Encore:
+Cash only.  WTF?
+Songs arranged ONLY by song, not artist
+Bathroom that made me walk on tiptoes to urinate

A fun place to go with friends, have a drink and soak up the atmosphere.
author: Eric S.

description:
Yes , the ladies' room is kinda creepy and the floor is sticky, but Encore is still awesome.  Lawrence is my bartender-boyfriend for life!!  Not only is he a sweetie, but he introduced me to the awesomeness that is sweet tea vodka and makes my whiskey gingers all special-like with extra gingery goodness!  All of the 'tenders dole out extra generous pours and charge very little.  happy hour prices are also ridiculously cheap.  the book is pretty extensive, I just wish they had some Save Ferris in it:( There is a great mix of patrons, however.  I have spent many a Friday night amongst the lady-boys, former frat guys, old men and grown up theater kids at the Encore and have only regretted having to leave...

As for the people that didnt get to sing...tip your kj.  It works at the Mint...and it works at encore:)  Also, sometimes your song will get rejected because someone else just sang it, or will have just sang it by the time you go up...noone likes hearing the same song over and over again.
author: Rena H.

description:
I wish I could give Encore no stars, the bartender five stars, the emcee five stars, and the owner a swift kick in the nuts.  

Last night I went to Encore w/ my two friends (I don't have a lot of free time for just anyone), Yayne (see her review) and Ben Feldman (benfeldmanshow.com). We are all stand up comedians; some would argue the best-looking  and funniest in the Bay Area.  As a gifted comedienne, I find it hard to simply sing a song.  Bo-ring! So between verses I decided to give the audience a sampling of my comedy stylings--for FREE, mind you.  I played the part of an ignorant lounge singer, brilliantly if I do say so myself.  The owner flipped out and threatened me because he mis-heard/misunderstood.  When Yayne tried to calm him down he got physical with her, and not in the Olivia Newton-John way.  I'll tell you what--if the owner thinks he's man enough, I would love nothing more than to go a few rounds with him without head gear.  Bring it on.
author: Candy S.

description:
Ended up at this place unexpectedly recently and it was actually kind of a hoot.  I haven't been to the Mint in ages, but this joint doesn't seem to be nearly as well stocked with wannabe professional singers and karaoke hustlers.  As a rule I don't sing in bars, but if I were going to try it I'd much rather follow some drunk frat boy idiot with bad pitch than a poor man's Michael Bolton.

My only complaint, as far as I can recall after a few cocktails anyway, is they don't take cards. That is just a stupid call for any bar....and no, I don't care that there's an ATM across the room.
author: George C.

description:
was very crowded!! Me and some friends waited hours for a song, and just ended up leaving.... Even tipped the KJ... Nothing more could have smelt like farts and broken dreams :(
Too crowded and too long of a wait for me.... I think for Karaoke, Annies Social Club is the best place ive been...(*for karaoke, that is) Everyone really gets into it there...
author: Bradley P.

description: Fun place, but unless you are willing to bribe the DJ don't waste your time trying to sing on the weekend. I waited 2 hours to sing and when I asked the DJ what was the wait he consistently gave me 1 more hr. as I watched him accept bribes and move others to the front of the line. I debated throwing a party here until I realized how corrupt it is. Save yourself the time and rent a private karaoke room.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Ok, so I love karaoke but I hate karaoke bars and this place epitomizes the reasons why.  I guess if you wanna get drunk, maybe sing one or two songs and spend the night listening to strangers sing then be my guest.  I have been to this place on a mon and Thurs night and both times I had to wait hours and I repeat...hours to sing a song.  When I kept seeing people who clearly had put in requests after me sing before me, my friends and I said something to the M.C.  He insisted he was playing them in  order and our song would come up in an hour....we'd already been waiting an hour.  It wasn't that packed and we tipped him when we put in our request. 

Plus, the place is dirty, bathrooms are gross and the song books smell disgusting.  Yuck.
author: Angie C.

description:
What a fun place to sing, listen to other great and not-so-great singers, and have a great time!  Super friendly bartender, cool security/bouncer, amazing karaoke host on Thursday nights! 

Love the song book, love the layout, love the big dance floor, love the expert way the karaoke host adjusts sound levels so everyone sounds as good as possible.  

Parking is a bit of a bitch in this neighborhood... so maybe don't drive -- just hop on the California Street cable car! 

Friendly crowd.  A few divas, but hey, this is karaoke, right?
author: Bevy M.

description:
Normally I don't go to karaoke, I got a lot of smack talk on me growing up cuz my parents do that shit at home with all of their friends, then all of my friends come over just to drink beer and watch...hey whatever, i don't poke at your insecurities...yet...

We've walked by this place so many times finally last Sunday night we stopped by here...boy were we in for a treat!  The crowd was diverse as can be, gays, straights, lesbians, black, white, asian, latino, whatever, it didn't matter as long as you were shamelessly singing your heart out.  One guy sang his heart out to whitney houston; it was horrible but there was sooooo much passion!!  A bunch of chicks went up and sang vanilla ice...it was pretty damn embarassing and I didn't know whether to laugh or cringe.  

One girl was soooooooooo trashed there she fell on the railing, then I guess being horizontal was easier than standing for her, so she just stayed there draped face down over the railing.  hey...don't act like you've never had a night like that before.

One dude (I think) in the table in front of us waited until all his friends walked out the front door, then he proceeded to audaciously finish all the halfies on the table and even ate all the cherries from the cocktails.  ok i've never done that before.

If you ever need a cheap thrill and want to bask in other people's misery, come here!  Hey, Karaoke is a spectator sport!
author: Nico M.

description:
Jay-Z once chanted... 

"Now can I get an encore, do you want more...what the hell are you waitin for?"

Clearly though, he wasn't signin bout this place. 

Encore? Shiiiit, I could barely stand the one performance! This place is just straight diiiirty and not in the good way. Perhaps it's the fact that I was wildly sober during my visit here and that is almost like good time suicide when you're in a karaoke bar and listening to people belt out sad and painful rendidtions of protooled for your pleasure hits. 

Maybe it's the fact that I was sick as a dog and just wanted to go home and curl up in bed? Maybe it was all of those things or maybe the place just sucked. I don't know, but it definitely wasn't any place i would rush back to.

The bartenders, however, were very nice and I did enjoy the fact that they had a pool table as far away from the "singing" area as you could get so you could at least attempt to drown out the sorry sounds with the crack of the balls. 

Other than that, I just don't think karaoke is my thing and with the exception of the Blue Goose Lounge in Hollywood, I'd sooner stay home and reorganize my sock drawer than go to a karaoke bar. So take my review for what it's worth, not a K fan.
author: Stephy S.

description:
I hell-waited for my turn.  It felt like purgatory: the wait (a good 1 1/2 before you get to sing), the heat, but most of all:

THE SQUAWKING.

However, after 6 beers, 2 tequila shots, a dry gin martini, and another tequila shot (compliments of the owner, who said I was "too cute") EVERYONE
sounded sooo GOOD, all the ugly people started to look like models, and the wait turned into cheerful dancing and frolicking : D

The end!
author: Jay M.

description:
Maybe it's because I am not an elitist and am able to recognize fun in its elemental form, but I was surprised how much fun I had after reading so many middling reviews of this establishment.  The venue is fairer on the eyes than the reviews lead you to believe, and fairer still on drunken eyes.  The people there were friendly and also generally succeeded in looking like they were enjoying themselves.

  The bartenders were non-surly, attentive, and quick.  One bartender who liked my necklace drank tequilla shots with me, further strengthening the bond developing between this karaoke bar and I.

   The guy running the karaoke machine even called my friend and I by the name I wrote on the slip of paper I submitted to him ("Steven and Eric's Steam-Powered Apocalypse").  The whole thing was like a well-oiled machine and I bet you one thousand dollars I'll be back.
author: Eric P.

description: Great bar with Hawaii ties. Low key and just fun.
author: Marck N.

description:
Damn - when Yelpers show up someplace, en force - it's crazy, baby, crazy! I have a suspicion that this Tenderloin joint would otherwise have been sorta dead, even for a Friday nite.  
The song books, while not the latest, latest and greatest, was fairly contemporary; it wasn't stuck in the 80s where I wish skinny pants would've stayed. 
And though the two bartenders were at times less than fast on their feet, they also had new peoples' face and drink down pretty early in the evening (in my case, a 7up:-).
I'd like to check this place out with a more intimate group of friends, sometime soon.
author: CINDY K.

description:
A few blocks up from me and right next to the Lumiere is this bar.  I totally dig it.  I'm unsure about the whole "you must drink or we'll kick you out thing" as we didn't encounter it.  Although it was Sunday night and I'm sure they were just glad to help fill the room.

We had about 20 minutes till our movie started so just planned on buying a quick beer.  The bartender was extremely friendly and offered one of his specialty items.  We thought it was cool he recommended something. (And yeah obviously he wanted us to buy something more expensive, but hey, bartending is about being friendly and workin' it for the tips. Personally I'm over the whole "I'm a bartender, I'm too good for you" attitude that most of the SF bartenders have now a days.)  And in fairness, his drink was tasty!   After a first sip he introduced himself and shook our hands.  Took extra care in saying my friends name right, which I thought was cool.  He seemed very genuine.

We took a seat near the front where it looked like locals/regulars were.  They were completely comfortable singing to an empty room, probably because they were all completed wasted. (And it was only 9pm!)

The atmosphere is very cool and people here are generally really young  and interesting looking.  People that look worth meeting.
author: Mary R.

description:
Any bar with a bartender who offers me a free shot, then insists on taking two more, and is named Basil... will always be in my good graces.

The drinks are decently priced, great selection of songs, sweet bartenders and bar back, and an awesome stage with plenty of room for you to make a fool of yourself and for your back up dancers to flail around and spill their drinks. The pool table is nice for killing the time until you get to sing and is kept company by the ATM since this place unfortunately doesn't take plastic.

I'm holding back on the fifth star because the wait to actually sing can get pretty unbearable and you'll probably end up sloshed before you've sang your first song... unless you get there really early or generously tip the DJ.
author: Anne Marie S.

description:
Great, almost divey karaoke bar!  It was packed last Tuesday night and there was only one amazing bartender.  He did an awesome job and I never had to wait for my next drink! 
Great location and the crowd was fun to watch and listen to!  I would definitely come back and maybe try the karaoke but while intoxicated.  Must not do sober karaoke!!!
author: Yamil A.

description:
Have you seen that movie, "Jackpot," by the Polish brothers? Ok. Encore is where THOSE guys sing karaoke. It's a dive. It's hardcore karaoke. It's cheap. It's in the TL. 

You know what? I had a good time here. I'd go back. My friends are big into this place. I know that if spent some more time in SF, I wouldn't mind spending a little bit of it at Encore.
author: Cristy M.

description: I've been coming here since the days it was called Tango Tango and had different ownership. I've had ups and downs, a few times leaving disappointed because of an overcrowded room or a few rare instances where my song request got lost in the shuffle. Thing is, everyone makes mistakes, and I also can't blame the venue for its location, right in the heart of all the bachelorette party and urban golf pub crawl activity. After the many years we've been spending together, Encore and I have reached a routine that works. I come at certain times of the week with friends (sorry, not saying when and sharing my strategy), knowing just when to get there to get a bunch of songs in and what signs to look for as my cue to leave. We take over the bar seat area, Robin pours us drinks with a smile, and Matty gets the songs going. (The only KJ I know with a particular appreciation for Yazoo's "Only You," to the point that he even knows the Spanish version, "Sólo en ti".) And when those big crowds file in, and you find yourself getting frustrated because four tipsy guys and gals are spilling their drinks as they try to plod their way a rambling rendition of "Bohemian Rhapsody," just grin and bear it. It's worth it in the long haul. Because if you're one of the nice ones, the ones who actually tip not because you expect preferential treatment but because it's the right thing to do (unlike most people in those groups), the ones that don't swing the mic, the ones who say "Please" and "Thank You" and applaud for every singer, then you're one of us. And you'll both enjoy yourself more AND find that in the end all that matters is the singing and the drink and the company of like-minded karaoke weirdos like me.
author: Tanya F.

description: This place was a blast!! It had room for my group of 8, and the drinks were affordable. About 7, which I think for sf isn't too bad. The entertainment was great, yes the singing wasn't fantastic, but the people were fun.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
My "go to" bar along with Nob Hill Tavern!  Strong drinks, cool bartenders, and a pool table to boot!

Come with friends and yell at the top of your lungs like idiots.  It's great.  I myself do not do karaoke, so this might seem like an odd choice for a favorite bar...but it's such amazing entertainment and better than going to any old bar.  Plus, I like to sing along, just not on stage. :)
author: Shawna S.

description:
Flex your golden pipes.

This place was packed! I was here for a birthday party.  There seemed to be a few going on that night because they were turning people away at the door.  One stage to sing, so it's a perfect place to work on your stage fright.  Only one song can be submitted at a time in this karaoke dive bar.  Good place for groups.
author: Po L.

description:
I hereby out myself as a karaoke fan.  Whenever someone asks, I explain it away by saying I lived 3 years in Japan.  As if it's quasi-genetic.  That's not really it, but people nod in understanding ....

This is a karaoke bar without attitude, where people of all levels of seriousness and ability can come to sing their heart out.  Great selection of songs & a friendly staff.  Go early (8) or late to avoid long waiting times.
author: Liz O.

description:
My parents are karaoke whores. They had a karaoke system back when people used giant laser discs. They even have wireless GOLD microphones.

Shockingly, I never got into the karaoke thing. Not until I saw Lost in Translation, immediately knew my next vacation was going to be Japan, and found a group of 7 friends and I holed up in a private karaoke booth in Kyoto, singing until 4am.

I've been to karaoke bars before but I prefer the private rooms. The ones in Japantown are BYOB and it's so fun packing in 10 of your friends into a 6 person room and singing your heart out. I guess I don't like to wait an hour to get my song on.

As far as karaoke bars go though, Encore is pretty good--lots of seats while you wait. It was nicely packed on a Thursday night but not insanely crowded. Most of the songs being sung were good karaoke songs. What's up with people playing sad crappy songs though. Just because you like a song doesn't make it a good karaoke song. 

It's cool they have a pool table but the wait was pretty long. We had to leave and go to Ha-Ra to get some table time. I'd come back here before I'd go back to The Mint though.

Update: Forgot to mention that the staff there is kinda sucky. Watched us like a hawk to make sure we didn't leave the bar with our drinks. Who gives a crap if we want to take our drinks with us to the next bar (BTW they were in beer bottles not the bar's glasses)? What are you, the drink police?
author: Cindy P.

description:
This Sunday we had a little gathering of friends to celebrate my buddy, E's, birthday.  When I say little, I am estimating around 30-40 of our closest friends. Admittedly, I'm a little frightened of the US version of Karaoke bars.  I've been to several upscale karaoke parlors in Japan and everything here just seems to be almost like a Western gone bad.

Encore Karaoke, formerly known as Tango Tango Karaoke, does give off a strange vibe.  It is quite obscure, right next to another Karaoke bar, my favorite tailor shop and some random flower shop.  You climb a flight of stairs and are immediately transported into a pool hall/dive bar type atmosphere.  It had me doing a double take, considering I'm an upscale kind of gal, but what a night! 

Our group brought the catered food and the staff made us feel like we were right at home.  The staff humored our group's desire to serenade the audience with Chinese songs and were super generous with the amount of alcohol that they put into our drinks...That lady bartender kicks ASS!  My cosmopolitan was strong and hard...just like I want my man *hahaha*...JUST JOKING, kiddos.   It is a gay friendly place, too, with the pride flags hanging up behind the bar.  I left the bar without damaging anyone's eardrums...that is a major feat in itself.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
This is easily the most depressing karaoke bar I have ever been to.

Maybe it is the thin carpeting that is near gone in some spots or maybe it was the fact that my friend got dumped that night and it wold have been depressing anyway.  But seriously.  I don't think I'll be coming back unless said friend has the wisdom to stay away from the mint while the breakup cools down as they were both regulars and encore is near her house.

The gist of my night was walking in and thinking this is where karaoke singers must come after their prime.  The music was depressing which didn't help my friend.  And some ASS spilled beer down my back and on my purse.  And didn't even have the presence of mind to get a napkin.  Dumbass

Not that any of this is really Encore's fault.  It was a bad night no matter what. But the ambiance was depressing and nothing pulls down a karaoke bar than a lack of energy.  And I do believe it was a Thursday.  It doesn't seem like a karaoke bar should be that depressing on a Thursday.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Two groups of friends met to celebrate for two birthdays on a Saturday night. We were 25-30 deep, buying rounds of Patron shots at $8 a pop, and generally spending a lot of $$ at the bar, etc.

The Bartender asks one of my friends if he needs a drink. He declines b/c it's 1am, already had a couple drinks there in the past hour, and he's sick. The bartender brings over the manager who asks my friend if he'd like a drink. My friend politely declines again. The manager tells him to leave. 

I explain that he's with the largest group in the house, and has already bought drinks in the past hour. The manager says he doesn't care who he is with or what he recently bought. "Buy another drink right now or leave my bar. It's not free to be here!" 

What a d*ck! No plans to go back. Bartenders got no more tips from me for the rest of the night as a result of being so hospitable. 

Here's 'the rules' of Encore from their website. Notice rules I and X. 
http://www.encorekaraokesf.com/commandment.asp

I don't mind a cover or a 2 drink minimum at a joint, but throwing people out for not having a drink in hand at all times is ridiculous.
author: Ed J.

description:
I finally decided to start a Yelp account to review Encore. It used to be a favorite hangout of my friends and I for years, back when it was run by the old owner. 

Lately I've discovered an unpleasant trend whenever I go there. For my last birthday, we decided to finish the night at Encore (after a dinner in North Beach). My friends and I all bought drinks and then began to write down our song requests. One of my friends put down a request under my name ("Busy B. and Friends"), and I also requested a song under my own name as well. Throughout the night, only one song under my name was called, yet there were certain individuals who had 4 to 5 songs called up. They were the best singers, and there was clearly favoritism at work. And to add insult to injury, the freakin' bartender got up to sing 3 times. As a paying customer, who wants to sing and pays for drinks at your establishment, I really don't think your staff should have more stage time than paying customers. 

So, don't go to Encore unless you have a very good singing voice because you're only gonna get one song the entire night.  Back in the old days, when the stone-faced Asian dude was running the songs, everyone had a fair chance (and it was possible to get more than one song under one request name). Sure there was a lot of off-key singing, but, hey that's the point of karaoke, ain't it? Also, back in the old days, the staff didn't monopolize the stage more than the customers. And the one time I did see an employee sing (out of the many times I'd been there), it was awesome (like watching your high school principal doing a tap dance -- oddly out of character and entertaining).
author: Busy B.

description:
It really defeats the purpose of a place where you are supposed to "sing" when people are allowed to smoke INDOORS. Yes, it's still technically """outside"""" (quotes added for emphasis)  the bar, but when the smoking area is in an indoor foyer with chairs designated for people to sit in while smoking is placed right where the door to a place with no ventilation whatsoever is at - then that ain't cool. One star for this incredible disregard for laws and health.

It stank like funk and smoke and yeast, and in addition, the DJ was incredibly weird with how he chose who to sing when.
----------- Edit------------
Apparently, they don't allow people to smoke "indoors" anymore - YIPPEE! Now if only they'll do something about the favoritist Asian KJ dude who keeps letting "hot girls" sing first
author: Joshua L.

description:
I wouldn't reccommend coming here if you are stone cold sober.  Unless you really enjoy people mucking up songs that were god awful the first time around.  It is what it is; it's all about the karaoke...............

Cash only.  

Watch the step leading down to the exit.  If you're in a drunken stupor and fall down the stairs, don't say that I didn't warn you!
author: Amy Z.

description:
I love this place so much that my husband and I had our wedding reception there, and it was a blast! It was cheap, silly and fun, and we couldn't have had a better time anywhere else. 

I've been going to this dive karaoke bar for about 5 years, and I have as much fun there now as I did the night I discovered it. I love the staff (hi matt!), the regulars and the cheap, stiff drinks. I cannot recommend Encore Karaoke highly enough - 5 stars don't cut it!
author: Brook V.

description:
Had a wickedly fun night here a few weeks back. 

The bartenders are by far one of the best features Encore has to offer. Tim was the man to talk to, he kept the liquor pouring(Sapphire'n'tonic's my poison), the shots coming(gave us 2 free shots), and the prices ridiculously low (Granted I am an LA boy, and a $10 AMF is just unheard of).

The Song selections were great, though I didn't get a chance to sing any, nor did my compadre.  For the most part we were on our last leg of our bar crawl, so i think we were simply to *ehm* liquidized to even sing.

Great crowds too, a group of five quite attractive ladies decided to park their butts on bar the right next to me, and well that got the conversation going quite easily.
author: Victor S.

description:
I honestly thought Karaoke was a fun group activity... at least, I've always thought so until last night, when we went with a whole group to Encore on California. We've been wanting to do Karaoke for a couple of days already so were very excited when we got to Encore last night. That excitement unfortunately didn't last long. 

Our friend already warned us that we had to pick our songs fast, cause there was quite a wait. So we did, 5 minutes after arrival we turned in our papers.. 4 papers were rejected without any comment (even though we picked the songs from the book). When our requests were finally accepted we drank, danced a bit, sang with the other singers, waited, waited, asked the guy from the Karaoke how long we still had to wait (got "not long" as answer) waited, got bored, waited, got annoyed from waiting, still waited. After SERIOUSLY 2.5 hours waiting for our songs, we gave up and left! None of us had to go up and sing! And it was not even crowded! We were with a group of like 20 people and there might have been max. 40 people inside!! 

This might be a nice place (I mean, they do have a lot of Karaoke songs to pick from), but it could only be nice if you know the guy who's doing the Karaok. Cause it seemed like the people who got to perform all knew him (it were the same people ALL OVER).

Other than the wait....the place stinks as well!!

If it's up to me, I won't come back here again.
author: Helen D.

description: Wandered in here before going to see a movie at the Lumiere. Really liked it, total dive, has a cool vibe. Only had time for a beer but plan on returning, kinda of a small crowd which the bartender said was unusal for a Friday, but the singing was sweet.
author: Brian R.

description:
I am from out of town, and came across Encore via a Google search. It happened to be closest to my hotel (Moscone area), and I'm an avid karaoke fan.

I went with a couple of friends and right when I walked in the door I felt at home. It was a Thursday night and not crowded, but most of the seats were full. We went to the bar and sat down, and were promptly greeted and served by Tim, who we later found out to be the manager. Not only did he make it a point to engage us, but he introduced us to regulars among the stories he told.

The karaoke: Song selection was top notch. I've karaoke'd in some fairly high profile places (Vegas, Austin, etc), and the selection was the best I've seen. They have a rule where the KJ only takes one song at a time from a singer...I found this to be great, avoiding the classic situation where a regular sings multiple times before you get to sing once. 

The drinks: Being from out of town, I was very pleased with the selection and prices. Very reasonable and tons of liquor to choose from.

The atmosphere: Amazing. I had great conversations with regulars, and really felt like I wasn't the new guy with his friends in the bar. There were all different kinds of people at the bar, making it an electric atmosphere and a ton of fun.

The staff: More than accommodating. Everyone there seemed genuinely happy to work there and offered great conversation and service. I already mentioned Tim the manager that we met, but Chris the owner came in later and again engaged us in conversation for hours.

I must say, coming into town and finding this place by chance on google was the best thing that happened to me on my trip. I had the most amazing night in San Francisco, and met some of the most interesting and genuinely good people I've met in quite a while. In fact, I signed up for yelp just to write about this specific bar.

Thanks to the bar for a memorable night. I may make a special trip out here just to visit again!
author: Christian S.

description:
First, the business.  I do like me some Encore.  The bartenders are friendly, the crowd eclectic and mostly smiles (unless you're a celebrity... ahem), the song selection classic, and the drinks stiff.  Good place to go with a raucous crowd.

That said, it's time to talk, everyone.  It's time to discuss that guilty pleasure we all share.  It used to be clever, a selection that made everyone in the bar go "oh, good call!"  It used to unite us as one in drunken, sloppy voice.  But now... the magic is fading.

Of course, Yelpers, I'm talking about Journey.  Now, I don't want to rain on anyone's parade, but we are in imminent danger of wearing out "Don't Stop Believin'."  "Faithfully" is on life support.  The "Lights" are going down on the band's renaissance.  Unless we do something about it, and reserve San Francisco's finest for only the most special of occasions, we may lose them forever.

This year, It's time to shine the warm light of nostalgia elsewhere.  I'm talking about Ambrosia.  Billy Ocean.  Maybe uncork a '91 Bolton and see if OfficeSpace was rightfully harsh.  Give The Police some love again.  Isn't it time Rick Astley got his karaoke dues?  And with all the Journey out there, how come we never hear "Foolish Heart?"  See, there's plenty of great songs still out there.  We only need to sing them.

So it's time to go our separate ways, Journey.  I'll be alright without you.  When it's the right time, we'll welcome you back with open arms, anyway you want it.  Until then, be good to yourself.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I have been going to Encore for every birthday, going away, welcome friend from out-of-town, and just-for-the-hell-of-it celebration since I moved to SF 3 years ago. I have always loved the ambiance, song selection, and the bartenders. Until their staff/untrained bouncers started a bar brawl that royally f-ed up my friends.

As Max R. described in his own Yelp review (I'm just waiting for Yelp to delete or "lose" these reviews amongst other more positive ones) there was a misunderstanding with the bartender that could have easily been rectified with a calm conversation. I watched Max approach the bar and say, "Sir, please..." in trying to talk about what happened. The bartender cut him off and yelled at him to get out, which is when a bouncer approached and pushed him to the ground. Max, and our whole party of 15, was ready to leave at that point. A friend and I grabbed everyone's belongings from the table and started walking to the entrance, where 3 other staff members were blocking the door. I watched as 5 of my friends, in trying to leave, were pinned against the wall by staff's forearms, put in choke holds, and punched in the back of the head. This included 2 women that were not in any way involved (not that these women weren't strong enough to hold their own, but against 4 men? Really?) They yelled at our group to leave but blocked the exit!

When we were finally able to pass through, the bouncers yelled inappropriate and unnecessary threats as we walked out. It was the most shocking and unnecessary violent situation I've seen in a bar. 

Now believe me when I tell you that I have been taking people here for the entirety of the time I've lived in SF, even building a relationship with the aforementioned bartender. I have no reason to slander Encore--some of my best memories in the city were at this bar. 

But the way their staff acted that night was absolutely inexcusable--and over my friend inquiring about $20 he put on the bar? No one stole or was even accused of stealing anything, we were not disorderly (we're all workers in social service!) and were ready to leave when asked (or commanded to), although we shouldn't have been told to the first place.

Encore, you really messed up. The 15 of us have been loyal patrons for a long time and we will NEVER be back. And neither will our friends and colleagues. I hope no one else has an experience like we did this weekend.
author: Kelsey P.

description: There's only One Douche Bag KJ..... and Basil is great. My favorite bartender in the city. If you play the dice game "Boss" with him.... Watch him.... he cheats
author: Melvin T.

description:
This is what a karaoke bar should be.  Silver Cloud is annoying and if I hear another Marina girl sing "I Touch Myself" I'm going to have to slap her.  You are NOT hot.  Mint just has too many professionals there.

But Encore is a good venue.  Upstairs, which is automatically shady, and perfect for karaoke.  Sketchy old guy who doubles as a barback and sings a song?  Perfect.  The DJ was nice to us, so I'm not sure what these reviews are all about.  Decent song selection, although I was disappointed to learn that Pour Some Sugar On Me, the greatest stripper song of all time, wasn't available.

Minus a star for being cash only.  This trend needs to stop.
author: Geoff K.

description:
There were only a couple of tables when my friends and I got there since we went early at like 8:30pm. We got some drinks and even ordered pizza from a few stores down and brought it in to eat on the condition that we gave them a $50 deposit just in case we made a mess. We didn't, so we got our money back when we left.

They have a huge book of songs. The thing is that it takes FOREVER for your song to come up. It was an experience, but I would much rather go to Japantown and rent a private room with my friends and pay $30/hour to sing as many songs as I want and not have to wait or listen to other people.
author: Linda C.

description: My friends brought me here on a random Wednesday night and I had a blast! It is sort of a dive??? as in not sparkly and shiny clean, more like funny black carpet with stains, but it is a great laid back fun vibe. The staff was friendly, helpful, patient, and also great singers! The women's bathroom was surprisingly decent, my boyfriend tells me otherwise about the men's room. Nice tables and areas to get together in groups large or small, and they have some wonderful organization skills in the karaoke line-up. I will be back here. Fun times ahead!
author: Kristen E.

description:
TWO WORDS - "SWEET CAROLINE" 

Hands, touching hands, reaching out
Touching me, touching you
Oh, sweet Caroline
Good times never seem so good....So Good! So Good! 
I've been inclined to believe it never would!

Sing it loud and proud while drunk and hope another drunken basatard doesn't run up and steal the mike from you. Guard it with your life...its been known to happen.. and it did. Good thing he was a friend of mine or I would have had his nuts! Neil Diamond Rules!
author: Stacy T.

description: If I could give this negative stars, I would. As mentioned in several other 1 star posts, THE STAFF IS VIOLENT towards patrons.  I have been a high school teacher for 10 years, and the friends I was with are all non-profit type good-doers.  We were out trying to celebrate, and when there was some miscommunication at the bar, my friends were pushed, put in chokeholds and PUNCHED by bouncers and the OWNER.  My friends are MUCH smaller than these tall and larger men, and the brutal and excessive force was criminal. And the bouncer with the tail attached to his hairstyle looked me in the face and said "I will punch you in the face bitch". These people need to be stopped. They are disgusting and have NO BUSINESS owning a business. We will be filing a possible police report, with the better business bureau, and STRONGLY encourage you to join "Boycott Encore" on FB.
author: Margot G.

description:
How have I been here three times already? I have no idea. The last time, a group of about 12 of us descended on this place after a long night of bar-hopping up Polk Street. It seemed like a fitting place to end the evening - slumped in the chairs, eyes half closed, watching people sing really bad 80s pop songs. It felt like I was on a cheesy cruise or something.

Anyway, come for the experience, stay for the ear-splitting entertainment!
author: Ava S.

description:
One time I went here with friends, and there were several bar fights that erupted because of some chodes with water guns.  I swore I never would return, but I lied.  

I went back.  This place is spacious, there's plenty of seating, you can actually perform karaoke, and the drinks are easy to purchase.  I see nothing wrong with weathering the occasional douche storm to get my karaoke on.
author: Kim S.

description:
Screw Silver clouds, Screw doubly The Mint.

ALL HAIL ENCORE.

This place is what I've always wanted a karaoke bar to be.
Huge song book, great sound system that doesn't drowned you out or play the backup so light you feel on the spot.

Singing from a dance floor your friends and other karaoke goers can join you for dancing on. Friendly staff and friendly patrons, it is the most supportive communal karaoke atmosphere. Not hard to coax newbies into their first karaoke at this joint.

They don't take CC so bring cash, and there's no song charge but a tip jar, I always tip a buck a song, I recommend you do the same.

Sunday nights are my favorite, any given night has particular regulars, that are for the most part particularly rad.

The owner, Chris, is the sweetest guy on the planet, and does a remarkable rendition of Dolly Parton's "Jolene", you'd have to see it to believe it!

For me, Yelling "JOLENE!" at Chris, is much the same as yelling "FREEBIRD!" at a show.
author: TheJane N.

description:
Jason the Kj is terrible! If you only request a 90's song, you're fine, andif 
he like's you, your fine.   If you are an average person, perhaps in a birthday group, he will ignore you!! I have gone 2 times when jason was the kj, and they were both terrible experiences due to him! I have been to encore many times before, which is why we come back...but if jason is working, don't bother....he won't play your song...Sundays and Thursdays avoid at all costs!!!!! Vu the bartender is great.....
author: Mickey A.

description:
Very cool place, had a great time... just a few minor annoyances.
As someone else mentioned, the song list lacks any soul/r&b, and you have to look everything up by song title...wth?
Having to watch your head at all times and dodge the boys with the wild pool cues was kind of annoying.
Last, my friend had their credit card stolen out of her purse, so don't leave ANYTHING on the floor even for just a minute. Shady Mo Fo's be lurking...
author: W W.

description:
Well someone finally sung my all time favorite karaoke song of all time - Total Eclipse of the Heart!

The drinks were good the service was cool.

But they never called the songs of the peep in my group. WTF?

We tipped well and re-submitted and still our songs didn't come up. And then the same ol loosers kept coming up and singing.

LAMB!

NEXT!
author: A P.

description: Get here early on a Saturday.  Happy hour prices, almost empty except for the regulars and the DJ's undivided attention.  You better have some thick skin though cause the people working here will clown you.
author: Corey V.

description:
This place was pretty lame when I dropped by the other night. It was filled with fratboys who thought that yelling into a mic or taking off their pants (yes, really) is entertaining. I'm not necessarily opposed to karaoke but this place is so small that you can't really focus on anything else but the karaoke -- which is a bad thing if there's some screeching wretch on stage.

When I ordered a bottled beer it came without a glass (there's no beer whatsoever on tap). I requested a glass and the bartender stared at me blankly for a few seconds before getting it. Then he just set it on the table and I had to pour the beer myself. Hey bro, for $4.75 you could at least pour it into a glass doncha think? Needless to say, I didn't give him a $1 tip for his sub-par performance.

Average place combined with enormous hassle of Nob Hill parking = 2 stars. Sorry Encore, better luck next time :(
author: Aaron V.

description:
Karoake depresses me greatly.  That is my fault.  This was for a wonderful woman's employee party with some wonderful people.

Still depressing.

Ugh.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: I'm here right now. Total dive bar, like usual for karaoke (Expected). Even for dive bars, the floor is so dirty! The kj works as a bartender as well. He totally plays favorites. He goes as far as saying your name is coming next then when you go up he says he didn't call your name. People who didnt know me heard my name. Im not hearing things. This happen for two songs. This guy makes a habit out of it. Its one thing to put names ahead for tips to an extent, its another thing to have the nerve to say the name coming up and then back out of it. Brutal. The crowd has ADD. I am here with my fiance and dont have any other support but i noticed that when people do , it makes no difference. Friends are supportive for the first minute then into their own world. Pretty bad if you think you will get much support here. Drinks are cheap though. So if your looking for cheap drinks, this is ok. Honestly I should have been called like 8 songs ago and still waiting. Will never come again.
author: MICHELLE Y.

description:
Okay, so I was there the other night. It's not usually my type of crowd. Lots of newly drinking age college students singing along to songs they heard their parents liked. Y'know... Journey and Bonnie Tyler. 

Geez... am I that old?

Speaking of old: Mixed in with these kids are 50ish men who really want to get laid and have a busted looking woman on each arm. Plus, they call the bartender "barkeep." Someone's been watching too many John Wayne movies again.

Despite all this I decided to just relax and have fun. It was a friend's birthday and this is what she wanted to do. 

I was actually having a good time until someone decided to sing "A Bridge Over Troubled Waters." Talk about buzzkill. Half of the place emptied out and my friend left as well. The guy killed her birthday. What a tard.

Ballads, karaoke, booze, and Saturday night do not mix.
author: Mark G.

description:
Although every person I've been here with calls it by its former name and says annoying stuff like "it's going down hill," I say "impossible...it's there!"

Either you get this place or you don't. 

I get it. 

Drink. Make an ass of yourself. Pass out.

Encore performance the next weekend.
author: Whit P.

description:
Went here on Friday night with a friend of a friend. 

You have to know that I consider myself to be a semi-decent singer (a fallacy, no doubt, but delusion is a wonderful thing). I wouldn't go to the karaoke bar if I didn't want to sing. 

The wait on Friday night: 90 minutes. Are you frigging kidding me? Add to that the fact that the drinks weren't particularly strong. 

I did enjoy the unpretentious vibe of the joint, especially since I'm usually found trolling at Ambassador (can you be more fake LA?) and Redwood Room (I love this place and SHOULD be ashamed to admit it). Everybody was in a good mood and there weren't any jerkoffs looking to start fights or stupid drunk girls (thanks Kanye!). 

Definitely worth your while but DO NOT go on a Friday.
author: Saumil M.

description:
This place is a boneyard for the insane.  Naturally, I'm in love.

I have a fondness in my heart for crazy, chaotic messes (ahem) and bartenders who remember me each and every time and make me feel like family, so Encore Karaoke has got my number.

Of course, I may be biased, given that my best friend lives around the corner and thus Encore has welcomed us with open arms through through recent years of crashing through our rites of passage.

Still, Encore remains a perpetual valentine in my heart.
author: Sasha S.

description:
I just started coming here and I like it alot.  ALOT less wait then at the mint, but still a very deep song selection book which blows away a place like Silver Cloud.  I think the staff is friendly and they let you bring your own food which is cool.

It is nearby Polk street so if you are a little bit of a homophobe or scared of transsexuals, you may want to trek back to Silver Cloud to karaoke instead.
author: Medwin M.

description:
I love this bar so much, especially on Wednesday nights. Great KJ, great bartenders, great crowd and Grubstake a block away for after... nights there are never bad.

I will say that some nights it gets so busy that you get to sing maybe only once but the crowd is so awesome that you can make fast friends and then impromptu duets can pop up (and who doesn't like those?)... that or just join in with your fantastic friends.

Seriously though, I'm here biweekly almost religiously. It's kind of ridiculous and kind of awesome at the same time.
author: Megan P.

description:
Yes, it's a dive bar.  Let's get that out of the way first.

It's also fantastic.  The DJ is hot, the bartender is old school, and the song list is miles long.  $2.50 beers and no line to sing during happy hour?  Count me in!
author: Ana C.

description:
I have had great experiences here in the past. Love the bartenders and the crowd.

Unfortunately, my latest visit was tremendously disappointing. A group of friends and I arrived on an uncrowded Thursday night. We put a song request in, along with a nice tip for the KJ. Got some drinks and waited for our song to come up. And waited....and waited.....and waited.......

And waited....

Two hours later, no song. It was not crowded. Was the KJ hating on our song selection? Was the KJ hating on us personally? Why did he let the same four people (regulars?) keep singing over and over and over again, without giving others a chance?

I won't be going back. I'll stick to the Mint from now on, where the KJ rocks.
author: Katy D.

description:
I will give this place only one star  and that's because the bartender was nice.

It was going to be my first time singing haha and i found good reviews about this place, but honestly i didn't like it...  so we ended up leaving with out singing. 


Why I didn't lie this place? 
because:
- the staff were not friendly ( the asian bartender was nice though)
-the DJ sucks! when I asked him where I had to write the name of the song i wanted to sing he  just gave me a piece of paper without saying a word, and when I asked to borrow me a pen he said " dont have" ... 
- only cash
-when they say you have to wait around one hour to sing, and do not bring beverages  from outside THEY MEAN IT!  

**since they only serve drinks you can make arrangement to bring food but you have  to pay $50 if you make a mess. **

I won't come back!  I would rather sing in the shower!!!!
author: Lorena Raquel B.

description:
i have a serious love for karaoke and i used to really love encore when i was a "kid". 
tonight i was here for hours and hours, patiently waiting to have my one duet played. i had put in my song the moment i came in and of course tipped the KJ. i sang and danced along to other people's songs and bought more than my fair share of beers through the night. but come near closing, after all my friends left, and after a giant birthday frat party (who arrived late in the night) bribed their way into 7 songs, i gave up and went home. total bummer. when an easily bribed KJ is in charge it takes all the fun away from the rest of the crowd. to add insult to injury, the birthday party dudes really didn't give a crap about singing when they sang. i guess it's a fun place if you don't really give a crap about karaoke, but i do, so i don't think i'll be back. no fun at all.
author: patty h.

description: Plus eight stars for very nice and attentive bartenders. Minus six stars for the douche lord karaoke king on friday January 24th.  This guy was completely ignoring all requests. my friends and I waited from 8:30, when the bar was empty, to 11:30, when there were plenty of requests. 3 hours we watched this moron have zero order in how he chose songs. I also watched the bar go from empty to full to empty again as people lost their patience for this carson daly wannabe. This is not the voice.  Don't worry, I tried to tip him, but this power tripping asshole didn't care. He did an excellent job of killing the vibe at a karaoke bar on Polk street on a Friday night...difficult task! I tip my hat to you, sir, for emptying out what is always and will always be a fun karaoke bar. I am sure the owners will realize how much business you drove out with your A+ douche skillz, but just incase they didn't , I wanted to put it in writing.
author: Liz K.

description:
This place is a riot. A group of us came here for my last birthday and had a great time. The bar is dark and charmingly seedy-looking with its cracked uphostery and pool table, but is actually really clean and non-threatening to those who aren't so sure about dive bars, making it a perfect neutral place for my variety of beloved friends.

The stage is level with the floor, so if you're a little shy about doing karaoke, it's not like you're on full display for the bar. I, however, to my own benefit or downfall, have no problem making a fool of myself in front of others. Which I did, three times. And I will do it again, you watch.

p.s. - The staff is fantastic. They're very helpful with arranging events like fundraisers, and are willing to help work out drink specials and include your upcoming benefit in their publicity materials. A definite option for a simple benefit with low overhead costs.
author: Jill C.

description:
Stopped in, was promptly alerted that there was a minimum drink order that had to be fulfilled by everyone at the table. 
Friend ordered a martini which was not so hot, and when she finished it, found a large piece of parchment paper in the bottom of her glass. 
It was pretty packed with high pitched squealing ladies. 
We left without even singing a song. 

I'd go back for another shot -- maybe Friday night is not the night for Karaoke?
author: Amy J.

description: Really fun karaoke place where everyone gets up and dances on the stage. Friendly, fun crowd. Only downer is that it's cash only. Also, if you come here regularly you learn that people pretty much stick to the same 5 or so songs.
author: Jade S.

description:
What the hell?

I've been to this place twice.  The first time it was REALLY quiet, and a guy dressed like a 19th century banker was playing pool.  The second time I was there it was annoying and later on scary.

It was a Saturday night, and we were meeting some friends there.  It was really busy, and lots of people were wearing inappropriate t-shirts for some sort of theme party. Unfortunately, the theme party also included water guns, which are an exceptionally bad idea in a bar.

So, these drunk idiots start spraying people with water guns, and sure enough a fight breaks out in front of the stage and almost takes down the TV at the front.  That fight gets broken up, and two or three more fights break out throughout the night.  All of my friends took off before my song came up, and I'm sure that I would have nailed it.  I was left with my friend from home who now believes the Canadian stereotype of the US as massively unsafe.  Screw you, inappropriate t-shirt wearers!

To top all of that off, the service both times I was there was extraordinarily slow as the bartenders only serve a tiny portion of the bar and there is a big barrier behind that area restricting flow.

I will never go back here, as there has to be better karaoke places in town that DON'T spray you with water and get you into a fight.  I also don't like cash-only places out of the principle of it.
author: Bill C.

description:
The trick with Encore is to get there early, tip well to earn the good graces of the bartender and KJ, and sing like there is no tomorrow. 

I like the people that go up there are rock it, even if they aren't very good. That's way more fun than the people that take it super serious or don't even really try. 

I love it there. I feel like a bad friend since I haven't been in months.
author: Elsa E.

description:
Fun karaoke time for all. Make sure you're loaded by the time you get here. Extensive song list but missing a few key songs ("Last Dance With Mary Jane" is a must!). Pretty seedy looking on the inside with retro leather bucket seats. It was relatively empty for a Thurs night but filled up late. Rocked "Blaze of Glory" and won over the regulars. The drinks aren't very strong and the bartender made me go outside with my one beer I brought in, and then another guy told me to go downstairs and around the corner to swill it!

Overall a good time and I'm always for more Karaoke bars!
author: Ali C.

description:
When the Mint got too crowded and snooty one karaoke night, a friend suggested we head over to Encore. Encore was a quieter alternative and while they didn't have quite the song selection of the Mint, we still get a good mix of songs to choose from and more mic time with a more laidback crowd.

That was a year ago and in that time I fear more people have discovered Encore. It was pretty packed with frat boys when we came here on a Sat. night. The bartender was great though and gave me a free drink for my birthday. The owner also helped get me plastered with several tumblers of free shots of I-don't-remember-what. In spite of the crowds, it was still a fun atmosphere and at that point, I'd had so many drinks that it was all the more entertaining. Frankly, it's such a welcoming place that I would definitely come back, though I think I'd prefer a weeknight when the crowds and parking aren't quite as crazy. I'm already pondering my next number...
author: Megan K.

description:
Thank god this place is close to my house. Sometimes I just like to have a few beers on a weeknight or early on a weekend and sing some songs. Yes, I know I am a nerd. Also they have a great selection of old school country and show tunes which pleases the old gay man trapped inside me.

Their bartender who also sings has an amazing country voice and sounds like Lee Hazelwood. I love taking people here because everyone is super nice, no one booes no matter how bad you suck. And there are very few instances of douchebags singing Bon Jovi or drunk girls singing songs from Grease.

Go to Encore to sing some Dolly, Dusty, Nancy, and Cash.
author: Katie M.

description:
this is my fave karaoke spot in all of sf, (unless there is some secret karaoke spot that I just haven't heard of) anyway, encore is fun and they have a pretty decent selection. The KJ that was there the last time i was there shot my friend a bit of snaptitude, which is why encore only gets 3 stars...the guy who was there a few years back was great and it's too bad he is not there anymore, but that's how it goes.

If you're looking for a good time, and good karaoke then encore is a good choice... it's all good :o)

* Went back here in August and the bartender was a little bitchy. Drinks were a bit pricey, but the 'roke was still good and the crowd was fun.
author: D G.

description:
I've hosted two parties at Encore and both of them were smashing successes!

The first was my company's Holiday party and the second was my birthday party. The owner was really accomodating for both events.

I've taken all my friends here since and unlike that other karaoke bar on Market St., the "K.J." doesn't give you lip about singing more than one song. Plus you can actually get a turn on the mic here!

My only call-out is that the song list could be a little more well-rounded, otherwise, this place fantastic in my book.
author: Fidel L.

description:
The song "A whole new world" was given new meaning after my first visit to Encore. I mean the performers were on the  stage growling and really getting into the theatrics. I'm sure Walt Disney never thought their Aladdin song would be used in that scenario, but hey...I'm pretty sure I burned more than a few calories laughing that night ;)

Every time that I've been back since I've got a few good laughs in...whether it's the bartender feeding me shots or the American idol wannabes on stage a night with Encore is sure to lead to a few good stories the next day!
author: Summer C.

description:
Encore, what more needs to be said...I really like it there and I always have a good time...so, just come through and sing your heart out or be entertained by the "talent"...drink and be merry...

Okay here are a couple of useful tidbits, the layout is nice and wide open...you can see the "stage" from just about anywhere in the room..the drinks are cheapish and the bartenders are nice...the rest rooms are clean...

I would give it a 5, but sometimes the list of singers is so long that you'll never get your moment to shine, and there is favoritism - good for them, but bad for you if you're not down...but them's the breaks...it won't stop me from going there and it shouldn't stop you either...

Enjoy
author: ManOverboard A.

description:
I love love love loved it. The karaoke guy Jason was awesome, the bartenders were nice, the atmosphere was laid back and the crowd was all so much fun!!!

I came here for my birthday and I will now come again and again -

only downside is it is Cash Only - but there's an ATM nearby... :)
author: Madeline S.

description:
There are different levels of Karaoke places. Think of it like a video game. You start out at level 1 and as you gain experience, you level up to new areas.   Encore is a great level 1 Karaoke spot.  (For more advanced karaoke, check out The Mint)

This is the bar I always say to my friends, "Let's go do karaoke" to which the reply is always "oh my word, no."  Two hours here and they're asking when do we go back. 

Many a person's karaoke virginity has been lost to 3 cocktails and Encore's massive selection of songs. The staff here are all great and the drinks are heavy handed. All the better to kick out the jams. 

Get a big group and come down to sing  your heart out. There's always some crazy crowd doing some solid vocal work. Best karaoke dive in the city.
author: Andy A.

description:
$4.50.

Remember that number, because that's what all the drinks are. The wine? $4.50. The beer? Also $4.50 (only bottle beers - no draft). Yep, you guessed it, the well drinks also run you $4.50.  I wanted to optimize my drinking potential and - as a public service 'survey' - tried one of each. (Ok, ok, one of each and then 3 more of one of 'em...) You get the most for your money with the wine, but who wants to be THAT GIRL drinking WINE at a karaoke bar?

My advice? Get the well drinks and go to town. 

They had a ton of songs (yay, "I Touch Myself!" Even more 'yays' for "Like a Virgin") though you had to scroll to the back of the book to find "classics" like these...the front pages were the recent songs, so unless you're a Hinder fan, I'd head straight to the back. Eyes of an Angel, my ass.

Awesome with a group - we went relatively early (8ish) on a Thursday and had no problem procuring a big table, nor getting drinks in a timely manner. Even as it filled up, we didn't have to wait THAT long for our songs to come up. We may have gotten upstaged by a birthday party of apparently professional singers and a transvestite convention after-party (no lie) but everyone was drunk, happy, and friendly. Kind of like one big family of off-key singers.

Hmm. Kind of reminds me of my own, come to think of it...no wonder I liked this place!
author: Aubrey S.

description:
Yes, it was freaking awesome.  I highly recommended 70's bands named after geographic regions, or 80's bands named after brothers.  Two points if you can name the six bands I'm thinking of spanning those two decades.

Be sure to drink before you go.  Decide what song you want to sing on the way, and get it to the DJ asap.  

Encore Karaoke Lounge is kind of like Denny's: No one ever goes to Denny's; you *end up* at Denny's.
author: Jay B.

description:
This is my favorite karaoke bar in the city. Hands down the best place. I've been to the mint and silver cloud and Annies social club.....Encore beats them all. I am a karaoke fanatic! I love the owner Chris and the bartenders rock. The KJs are always fun.  

I don't undersand the reviews about the bouncers cause they love me. I've never had a problem. If you're under 21 then you're not supposed to be there...case closed. Show your Id, learn to handle your liquor and don't be an asshole. Everyone is there to have fun. 

Basil makes great drinks and Tim makes ok drinks but they always do the trick. If you want fru fru drinks go some place else.

The whole crew is friendly and fun. If you love to sing go sun-wed. if you like a big crowd of rowdy people and lookin to score go thus- sat.

I love this place!
author: Rebecca C.

description:
This place is so not fun!
