Unlike the Mint, Silver Cloud or Festa, this place seems not to be about getting up and having fun but some kind of high stakes American Idol tryout for the less aesthetically pleasing.  On the one hand, the patrons can actually sing, on the other hand, what the hell fun is that??

Good Things
Nice Location
Lots of under age drinking  - they don't card

Bad Things
KJ - Is he breathing?
Drinks - eww.  Bad drinks
Space - really dumpy
Crowd - no damned fun
author: Margaret G.

description:
So it was one of my best friend's decided to have her birthday here and I was super excited because I LOVE karaoke! I instantly yelped the place and was nervous about all the reviews about the mean DJ but thought maybe it wouldn't be so bad.... how wrong i was. We got there at 10:00 and put in our song request and it tool till midnight just to get to the first one. Before even letting us sing the DJ announced that if your name was written to sing more than one song that it wasn't going to happen and pretty much threw out all of our song request! 
And to top that there was this mean, chubby, shaved head man who told me he could throw me out because I was "obviously drunk" because where i was sitting was next to some plug and i was dancing to the music and kept accidentally switching the lights off. what an ASS! You work at a karaoke bar you douche!
The only good thing about this place are the bartenders. They were fast and made strong delicious drinks!
The owners of the place must know the DJ is an ass just from several other yelp reviews so why keep him around?!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Oh, how true ring the sad words of Jared R. and Lainya M.  I can think of one million + karaoke ballads to describe the downfall of Tango Tango.  Hey KJ, let's strike up "She's Gone" or "You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin'" to start.

This previously 5 Star on the Fun Meter joint has started on a painful descent.  I can't bear to watch.  Once a true neighborhood bar with a warm crowd of regular pals, it's been overcome by weekly rotating groups to whom the owner and KJ cater.  So much for loyalty.

The songbook is the best in town and the stage/dancefloor is a unique treasure; providing groovy fun for those who wouldn't dream of weilding a microphone. But, alas, it is time to move on.  Good luck, Encore.  I've had my last Tango Tango in SF.
author: Michelle A.

description: I don't know how to sing and don't dare singing anywhere else other then my bathroom shower. I came here for a going away party and was so disturbed by a girl whose so drunk she was dry humping the air. Bothering everyone that was on stage singing. She went onstage and grabbed my friend's ass a couple times. Finally the DJ came by and told her she caused 7 customers to complain and leave so he was kicking her out. Poor girl. What kind of friends were her friends...letting her make such fool of herself. Anyways other than that girl making love to every song being sang, I enjoyed the place a lot. The bartender was super nice. Not much options on drinks but has a nice crowd. The crowd bought us some drinks. Will definitely go back.
author: Sflady S.

description: Fun!  Huge song selection although it's so popular that it can take, um, hours for your song request to be put through.  Crowd is a little young and eclectic, but fun.
author: Melinda C.

description: I want to give Encore a better review, but the dude at the front door/bouncer was horrible. I reserved a spot for my brother's birthday and he was nothing but rude and disrespectful the entire night. Nothing about the place made up for it, so sorry to say I have to give it 2 stars. Hope they get better people to work there, because it has potential to be a fun spot. With expensive drinks and a huge wait-list for getting a song in, I definitely will not  be heading back there anytime soon.
author: Alexi W.

description:
Oh, Encore. I heart you! I celebrated my Golden year with you on Wed. and it was the best birthday. After my fourth or fifth shot, I can't clearly recall the events of the evening. It's all a blur. I remember little, but luckily had friends who kindly reminded the following morning that I had behaved "wildly". Here are some of the highlights:

1. Walking around barefoot the entire evening. (ICK) Apparently the 20.00 pair of Payless shoes that I had bought for the ocassion sat carelessly in the corner while I pranced around without wearing any foot protection. Eww...

2. Around 10 Jager bombs and 3 body shots later....

3. Meeting new friends and  promptly stealing the mic from other patrons to give shout-outs to said friends. 

4. Lap dance? From a co-worker who sang #1 Crush by Garbage.

5. Showing off the chonies to the bar while getting lap dance.

6. A heavenly slice of Hawaiin pizza...hmmm....

7. Singing (Wailing) "I Wanna Dance with Somebody" by Whitney Houston. 

8. Changing the words to "I Wanna Dance with Bobby and Michael" and subsequently dancing with Bobby and Michael.

9. Lots of dancing and running. I was treated to video footage of my dance moves.

10. Telling Random Dude at the bar that I liked his hat. I think I might have tried to pet it....

I think that's about it. I apologize to the other patrons who visited that night. It's never fun to have obnoxiously drunk (but cute) girl interrupting you while you sing "Don't Worry. Be Happy". I'll definitely be back, especially because David (bestest bartender ever) works there. Thanks for making it so special.
author: Polly C.

description:
I love this place. The bartenders are awesome - particularly Basil, David, and the now retired Mason. I also like the KJ's, Matthew in particular, and security - - and the owners brought in pizza the other night, which you gotta love.

There is very little attitude at this place and I always find myself having plenty of great people to talk with. The Friday and Saturday night crowds are a bit much, but weekdays are quite enjoyable - especially when the regulars sing.
author: Ryan C.

description: Encore used to be an amazing karaoke place. Bartenders are friendly, awesome selection of songs, but alas, the secret got out. It now attracts a really (for lack of better word) douchey crowd. This used to be a place where the whole room would erupt in song out of enjoyment. Now it's clique-ish groups that are horridly rude unless it is their friend(s) singing. I am so sad for you my long lost Encore.
author: Ali M.

description:
its a decent place if you go with friends (which I did) but it's got that restaurant vibe.  The place is pretty large inside and I think that reduces the mingle factor, everyone is pretty much at separate tables - def not the best place to mingle single

song selection was decent, sound was ok, the night I was there, the KJ was like a robot, just sitting in his booth repeating over and over to my drunk ass "please write down the artist name" ... "please remember to write the artist name" ... "please blah blah blah"

I mean i know i was drunk and probably slightly annoying but if you don't know who sang "Mr. Brightside" or "Little Red Corvette" and you're a KJ, you have issues dude.  That's like a bartender that doesn't know how to make a gin and tonic.

crowd was friendly - no boos but not too much backup from the general audience either.  I think I was one of the better singers that night - and that's never a good sign :|

the bartender was very cool though and I had a great time talking to him - he said the Kj was not his regular, so I'll probably give it another go as long as I get a group of friends.
author: adam b.

description:
with dozens of birthdays served and many a happily drunk night spent -- ive loved all the incarnations of this place.

however, it's current version loses a star due to a bad kj. bad kj lags between songs, running various errands throughout his shift -- taking shots, macking on some ladies, fulfilling some need to hang out behind the bar til doh! the song is over.

last time we were there, we developed a drinking game based on bad kj's antics -- needless to say we got waaaaaasted. but that works in everyone's favor, especially the bar's, so i hope they don't take too much offense to this critique. only real complaint is that some of our songs were nixed at the end due to bad kj's time management skills, bummer.
author: chanchan c.

description:
When I first walked in, I enjoyed the karaoke and the overall atmosphere. I ordered a vodka cran for $3.50 (good price.) I gave the bartender at $5 and told him to keep the change. All good so far. Well I was halfway done with my drink-had it sitting on the bar-I turned around and my drink was gone. Turned out bartender had cleared the bar and tossed my drink but it was only half empty!! I waved him down and told him my drink was gone but I didn't even finish it. He rolled his eyes and was completely RUDE. He made me another one, I politely said thank you with a smile and again he rolled his eyes at me. WTF!! 

I am never ever going here again. I personally think that Asian bartender was hatin' ..
author: AE W.

description: Love this Place!!!  Where to start, the selection in music is vast. People are nice. It feels like  Cheers where everyone knows your name. Best night is Thursday. Love the bartenders.  Make sure to tip you KJ.
author: Bre M.

description: Met some friends here last night.  Although being in the company of friends was great, the delays in getting to sing the songs that were submitted was frustrating.
author: Barry Y.

description: This is the best karaoke place in San Francisco, I recommend  anybody who hasn't been there yet, you need to make it a regular hang out, don't go anywhere else
author: Scott E.

description: I absolutely love this place! You can fit in no matter who you are. Bar tenders are nice and the drinks are good. Pool table in the corner. Must see, I had a great time!
author: Kristina N.

description:
When I lived in the Mission, I used to go to the Lexington on those low-self-esteem days to get the attention I needed to put me back on track. No, I'm not a lesbian. Yes, I am insecure beyond your wildest imagination. And yes, I will go to extremes for validation. 
Now, I just head to Encore. Encore makes me feel young, skinny, and beautiful. Mostly because the people there are not. It also makes me feel like I smell good and have impeccable taste. Mostly because the other people there do not. I love the cheap drinks (which even starving student moi can afford round after round of) and the low lighting (which makes me-and everyone else- easier to look at). 
The performances here are questionable and sometimes painful to sit through but the kids are always really into it. For a karaoke bar, Encore is huge, so there is always plenty of room for you and all of your fabulous friends. 
Sketchy crowd at the bar sometimes, but they'll probably buy you a drink if you're a pretty girl (I get the feeling some of these guys are regulars). The bathrooms are clean and user-friendly, too!
author: Autumn K.

description: Encore is still the place to be, though it can get packed with yuppies on the weekends. Most of the staff are like extended family to us by now... hell, we've been going to this place for over four years.
author: Aaron M.

description:
love encore! great crowd, cheap drinks, good selection of songs and friend bartender/staff!

on tuesdays the offer free food! enough said!
author: Diana L.

description:
i got a long, intensive and an awesome ab work out here and i didn't even have to hit the gym.

we went here for a work christmas party and had such a blast.  at first a couple of regulars belted out amazing songs.  wait, was that...vibrato i hear?  dang.  gulp.  hard act to follow.  my favs are those true hard core rock stars complete with dance moves and twisted facial expressions.  

good or bad, if you are into it, i'm cheering for you.

yes, i left at the end of the night without a solo myself but i had no voice after wooooing and yeahhhhing, everyone else up there friend or stranger. 

the drinks are plenty strong liquid courage so get your groove on!
author: Anh V.

description: Encore is a fun karaoke bar that I've been to once and definitely plan on returning to. However, there's nothing super fabulous about it: you go to drink and sing karaoke, not sit and enjoy the environment. My only complaint is that it does take a long time for your selections to get played (which can be a good thing, because you can use that time to get significantly drunk and gain the confidence to sing in front of a crowd). I've heard more than once that  the dj welcomes a payment to speed up playing your song - not very cool in my book. Drinks aren't super cheap (or at least there were no specials the night I was there, average $5 beer). If you're in the mood for karaoke it's worth checking out - with a large group it is way more fun!
author: Anne A.

description: I had so much fun here!  Sure it was hot and sweaty and a bit difficult to navigate around but that was okay because I got to rock the house with some Sublime AND Bon Jovi!!!!!!!!  Encore, you give the DYL Tour a bad name!
author: Luis M.

description:
"I've been a bad, bad girl...I've been careless with a delicate man..." Fiona Apple
Actually, I wasn't "careless" and he was hardly "a delicate man", however, I WAS "a bad, bad girl" though...albeit ALL the good ways.  I'm going to blame it all on Encore too.  After all, I can't blame it on drugs...I was stone cold sober.  Can't blame it on alcohol...I'd had not a drop to drink.  So I'm going to blame it on the heady contact high I got from all the Yelpers singing.  How else can you explain me hitting that high C in the company of a relative stranger during the wee hours past last call?
Honestly, if I did karaoke then this would be the place for it.  I found something I do "DO" here though, so it's all good.  They lose a star though for that one dude's rendition (backed up by all of us Yelpers) of Unchained Melody.  That song usually reduces me to tears (which I LOVE) but I actually laughed through the whole song...damn the loss of my sensitivity!  Happy Birthday Graceypoo!

Update 9/27/07:
I sang "Aint' No Sunshine When She's Gone" with Jason K and "I Touch Myself" with the Yelp backup dancers tonight.  I was sober.  I also crawled across the floor during Fong's rendition of "Cradle of Love".  My knees have carpet-burn for the first time from non-sexual acts.  I think I may really love karaoke.  This can't be good.
author: Jill D.

description: Oddly named, given most people who sing in karaoke lounges rarely deserve an encore.
author: Gourmet G.

description: I don't like all cash bars.  What if I want to buy a bottle of Grey Goose?  Like I'm going to whip out $400, I don't think so.  Please let me use my plastic.  Anyway, you can't get better than booze and karaoke.  This place can definitely be fun with the right group of people.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: The perfect place if you're comfortable (coughdrunkcough) enough to perform in front of a crowd. You could even have back up dancers join you with all that performance space. Good, ample space for the spectators. There's even a pool table for those friends who claim that they're not into karaoke (buy them a couple more drinks). Encore's got one of the better song selections I've seen, but BE WARNED....there are some DAMN GOOD regulars in this joint. But that's cool because, to me, karaoke isn't just a way for you to exercise your narcissistic tendencies - it's also a celebration of others' talent.
author: Steph P.

description:
i've only been there once last thanksgiving (my friends catered a small orphan thanksgiving party there)

the owner (his name slips my mind) was really nice and was VERY into karaoke. he must have known the lyrics to just about every classic country song ever recorded

...and then the owner came over to our table with this new Australian vodka distilled from grapes called Bombora.

I now have a new favorite vodka

http://www.klwines.com/product.asp?sku=1025823
author: Thömas F.

description:
this place is a hoot.  don't come in expecting it to be like a korean karaoke place w/ private rooms.  be prepared to sing and make a fool of yourself in front of others.  i came here on thurs night after olive.  they have a pretty good selection of songs, ranging from simon & garfunkel to n'sync to shaggy to sir-mix-a-lot.  for those who don't sing, there is also a full bar and a pool table.  this place is cash only, but there is an atm in the back corner.

we sang a bunch of random songs and acted silly by dancing all over the place the entire night.  at the stroke of midnight, it was my friend vy's bday, and we all sang happy birthday to her.  it was so much fun!
author: Helen T.

description: Here's the thing. You don't walk into a Wal-Mart expecting a personal shopper and chandeliers, do you? This is a seedy karaoke joint.  It's very good at providing those things which seedy karaoke joints are expected to provide. The drinks are strong, the 'performers' range from bad to mediocre, and the DJ will step in and sing regardless of whether there's a queue of patrons waiting to take the mic.  I've had some superbly entertaining evenings here, which I attribute almost entirely to the band of idiotic boozers I wander the city with.
author: Amanda B.

description: This place is great.  On top of watching the DJ and owner of the place sing, which they are really great at, the drinks are good and the song selection is massive.  The prices aren't that bad considering that your in the city.  On the weekdays this place can jam, and on the weekends the place is packed and the wait to sing is long, but that is to be expected.  Overall, good place to watch and participate in the festivities.
author: Marciano P.

description: Wow have I had some drunken nights here. When you walk in, it reminds me of one of those janky casino restaurants where there are a bunch of old men that stay there all day and play keno. It is best to go with a big group of friends, but I feel like everyone is on the same level of intoxication that you can meet many even if in a smaller group. The only problem I see with the place is that the wait list for karaoke is so long on the weekends that I have never been able to sign up my unwilling-to-karaoke friends in hopes of embarrassing them. Luckily, by the end of the night, most everyone lets you join the stage and sing along. There was this one women that rocked the house with some Mariah Carey and some others that knew what they were doing. But, overall, the drinks are flowing at Encore and everyone is having a good time.
author: Caitlin D.

description: If this were based on the simple fact that every trip to Encore turns into an absolutely ridiculous evening filled with whiskey & debauchery, I'd give it five stars, hands down. I did have one bad experience once -- one of the bartenders (apparently the owner) lambasted me for not having a drink in my hand. At first I thought the guy was fucking with me, but then he told me to order a drink or leave (I'd already had two drinks & I was actually sick with a cold, so I had no patience for it). I laughed & walked away. That minor incident aside, every trip to Encore has been an amazing one. Go there, & make sure you bring absolutely everyone you know, as mob-style karaoke is the best kind, & this place is big enough to handle whatever you can throw at it.
author: Pete J.

description:
news flash!!!

not all asians like karaoke. i, for one, would rather parade down naked with other eccentric characters on polk street than get in front of a mike. anyway, i was here for a birthday party. well, it was more of a birthday pub crawl than anything else. as expected, there was a whole lot of immaturity, silliness and no talent. nevertheless, encore is spacious and the staff was attentive. so if you enjoy karaoke, encore is a decent casual place to sing your heart out.
author: frisco j.

description: This is one of the best karaoke places in the city. The bartenders are really nice, and the song selection is great. I don't think it's too much to ask that you buy a drink, so I have to disagree with that complaint. They're a business and they are very upfront about that rule, so I have to respect that. Like all good karaoke places, a wait is involved, but enjoy the show, they're are a lot of characters.
author: Justin K.

description: I am currently nursing my Halloween hangover thanks to this place. Those rum and diets I had last night were serious. I had to get an extra glass of coke to make the drink bearable. I had an awesome time. Awesome, awesome. The place is dingy but the bartenders, bouncers and patrons were all nice and good sports. The KJ kept calling my ticket to sing so I was all smiles. I'll be back.. Thanks for a memorable Halloween.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
encore is great if you are a whore or a gay man.  the drinks are weak and expensive.  the bartender is adorable and nice, though.  and i'm sure on an off night it might actually be fun.  but saturday night?  you better be gay or a whore.  and even then, you are taking your chances.

update-
other nights are way more fun.  also i am a karaoke whore, apparently, so i now fit into the "whore" category.  but not an actual whore.  a more metaphorical whore.  which is better.  i think.
author: Samantha W.

description: I came here once a month ago, but not with fellow Yelpers....I wish I had, cuz it would have been even MORE fun to go with them!  Everyone was friendly, karaoke was fun (& good selections, too), and even the bartenders were fast, efficient, and welcoming (they introduced themselves to me, asked what my name is, and everything!).  I'm goin back again!  Who's with me!  I can sing the $#!T out of some Rock songs!
author: Gio G.

description: Fun to go in a big group.  If you get here early enough you will see some mediocre "regulars" performing over and over and over again.  The song list is extensive and the DJ is kind of crazy because sometimes he will just sing a song himself despite the 900 people waiting to sing a song themselves.  My personal favorite was the singers who did some add libbing and adding in some m-fing this and m-fin that.  It was pretty funny, especially to some GNR songs.  A good time and it gets pretty crowded.
author: Katie P.

description: I love this place!  The staff is great and some even are great singers!  The vibe is just that good old, makes you wanna drink, dance, and sing vibe.  Good selection of songs.  I know a lot of people prefer the Mint, but I favor this place more.  Don't know why but I just do damnit!  So get your buts there to drink and sing (Words of advice - if you do it in that order, you'll probably have more fun)!
author: Priscilla N.

description: Douchebags hang out here, girls' vaginas are eating their pants, and these people have some horrid choices in songs to karaoke.  With that aside, I love this place.  It's dark, the drinks are cheap, I can stand outside the door and smoke and can get the crowd going with 'Living on a Prayer'.  Take my advice; don't go here on Sundays before 5 p.m.  Some dude plays a harmonica for open mic afternoon, they won't let you sing, and I think harmonicas are the work of the devil.
author: Christina S.

description: Encore is fun and unpretentious.  What it lacks in ambience it makes up for in stiff drinks and great bartenders.  I agree with previous posters, however, that the DJ leaves something to be desired.  Not a total asshole, but he does enjoy being in a position of power.
author: Christina D.

description: eh.  I hate going to a karaoke place where people only pay attention to their own friends singing.  it's rude.  I came to sing, and you WANT to hear this.  no beer on tap, which is disappointing.  I sang the shit out of "hero" by enrique iglesias, and Beth danced the shit out of it.
author: Caleb D.

description: My friends and I just finished a long busy season and we wanted to go to a place where we could get drunk and sing... badly, but have fun doing it. Not the place for that! The place overcrowded, took forever to get a song in, that night I went was like an American Idol wannabe night. EVERYONE THAT NIGHT COULD SING! That totally took the fun out of it. My friends and I left after a few shots and realized that we would sober up before any of our songs came on. Then we went to Japan Town.
author: C M.

description: My friends and went there one Monday night.  There must have been about 8 of us.  We arrived 2 hours before closing.  There wasn't many people there, maybe about 2 to 3 tables were full.  So we knew that maybe we would have a chance to sing.  2 of us turned in our songs and the KJ says there may not be enough time for us to sing.  So we wait anyways.  Some of our friends had ordered beer and cocktails while the other half played on the one pool table they had (it had no triangle btw).  30mins before closing the KJ announced that if we didn't order any drinks we can't sing.  One of my friends, said to me "it doesn't say that in any of thier advertising.  Not on the way in, not on the website,..and i'm allergic to alcohol anyways. So why would I buy a drink. Next time we're going to Mint"  So that meant for sure I wasn't gonna sing and drink.  Besides I was the designated driver!! WTF so we all left upset and we didn't really enjoy the cockiness of the workers..booo!! I would have left no stars...
author: Rowena E.

description: I love this place! Brent should work everyday. The other guys a Nazi!!! Seriously, he's a little fucking bitch and he'll only put up your song is you give him a big tip. He's thinks he's cute and ppl will put up with that shit. If you want to have a good time go on Wednesdays.
author: Devon M.

description: meh. I have trained in the great Karaoke lounges of the ages. I have had beautiful ex-Playboy bunnies as my K-J and you know, this place (for karaoke) didn't hold its own tonight. Now I will say that I love those bartenders. They whipped up beautiful Long Island Ice Teas that really rivaled anything I have had (but for the price ($11) it wasn't beyond what I expected). Yet, when you put in a song and wait for over two hours and see the same damn people get up time after time before you are called up, you know something is up. This is a place that you should probably tip the KJ BEFORE you go up. Give 'em $20 and maybe you get to sing more than once. I sang once, I tipped a few bucks and despite that I didn't get to sing again. Yet two tone-deaf nincampoops sang three times (independently) between the time I sang once (in a group) and when the bar closed and my damn song didn't get called. Screw this. This is a place that favors favorites and if your aren't one of "them", plan on singing once despite the amount of tip given to the KJ on a Saturday night.
author: Craig H.

description: o!m!g! i must admit to being a karaoke novice, both as a performer and as an audience member. This place is the IDEAL of what i pictured a karaoke bar to be in my head. Stuffy? no way. Overly serious and competitive? not a chance. A bunch of people getting their rock on and having some fun doing it? Check. Sweet, sweet herbal smells wafting in from out back? Check! Pool table? Check! I totally butchered Brandy by Looking Glass, but hey--it WAS my first time. I'm working up a routine now with backup dancers and we're gonna go back and kill it in the good way!!!
author: rachael s.

description: I don't do karaoke. The only time was in L.A. at the Blue Goose with close friends and ONLY because the karaoke had Bob Welch's 'Ebony Eyes' on it. Seriously, look this song up, it's all kinds of 70s awfulness. Anyway, Encore has a great bar, very attentive bartenders, a bathroom that stunk like someone had peed all over it and a seriously high douchebag quotient. Like seriously. I saw more striped shirts, sunglasses at night and got the alpha-male-shoulder-grab-excuse-me more than I cared to on Saturday night. I think the only time I will give a repeat karaoke performance will be in Los Angeles at the Goose... Sorry Encore.
author: Michael E.

description: Possibly the best Karaoke in San Francisco.  They've got a proper stage, good sound, lighting, and two working mikes.   A laid back place where a great group of characters show up, at all talent levels, from terrible to terrific.   A wonderfully mixed crowd of crooning gay men, talk-singing hipsters, soulful soccer moms, and internationals struggling slightly to read the English subtitles at full tempo.  Thankfully, no one had "lost that lovin' feelin'"  the night I was there.  The highlight was when the bartender (Sim?) performed Aerosmith's Cryin' with a harmonizing backup singer.
author: Jason C.

description:
with a crowd that doesn't scare you and a song list that stretches back to the 1850's, you're bound to have a good time

though hard to get a table, it's best to come with a huge group and bust out with some Journey

the lights up on stage are kind of odd, but you'd probably (and should) be too drunk to remember
author: Charles C.

description:
I highly recommend you come to this joint on a Tuesday or Wednesday night to avoid the jock/meathead/ex or current frat boys and their WOO-WOO girlfriends from the Marina that seem to frequent here on the weekends - well that's what I tend to hear from the people who work behind the counters.  Be nice to the KJ - the karaoke jockey, Sid - he's an old friend of mine! He will also back you up on Duran Duran's Hungry Like the Wolf or Richie Sambora's iconic line "WANTED" on Wanted Dead or Alive unprompted! The bartenders Vu and Luis kick ass - tip them generously! 
The place is a dive but lucky for them I love DIVES especially during the middle of the week when I get to drink with regulars and other drunks and not hipsters or folks from affluent areas that come here on the weekends to "SLUM IT"
The place itself gets 2 starts but because I like the people holding it down at this establishment gets 4 stars!

"did I sing?" you ask - you bet your sweet ass I did!
busted out the Duran Duran and Squeeze - was on that 80's reminscing tip!
author: Alexis D.

description: I practically have a cot set up in the back room of Encore, that's how often I'm there. So needless to say, I'm quite the fan! Encore forever.
author: Ashley O.

description: drinks stiff, why? the more drinks we drink, the better you sound or the more drinks you drink the better you think you sound! Bring cash.............last time i went i needed one more dollar to get a beer and I wanted to cry- make sure you and your friends have enough $$$ here to get you through an evening! fun place for sure!
author: Ricquel N.

description: A hidden paradise for karaoke lovers in the heart of the polk. Don't let the sketchy location keep you away -- this is one of the friendliest crowds I've seen in a karaoke bar, welcoming new people, and egging them on when they finally belt out that first chorus. The musical selection is impressive, including hefty sections for pop/rock (with a LOT of 80s), country and showtunes. There are a fair amount of karaoke professionals on the stage, but they do get excited about new blood, and some of the regulars are as bad as you would be. Drinks are cheap, the singing wait not too long, and people watching is priceless. A total blast!!!
author: Roman R.

description: Maybe I had already downed too much alcohol by the time I came here. Maybe I was having a bad night. Maybe I just really don't like karaoke. Either way, this place creeped me out. I felt like I was in a strip club...and not a classy one (if such a thing exists)...a really down and dirty, trashy strip club. I am a little bitter that my karaoke virginity was taken by a dingy, sleazy, lounge-cum-strip club.
author: Kelli C.

description: I'm going to change things up a bit, and review the patrons of this establishment that we met here on saturday night.  I was part of a drunken bachelorette party that stopped here for a few drinks, and while we didn't get to sing, the patrons of this place indulged our group, and helped us out with our scavenger hunt.  Thanks Rebecca, and friends!  If you've wondered where all the nice people in the city hang out, you might give this place a try.
author: Lauren M.

description: This is a difficult review to write. On the one hand, Encore is great place to bring your friends to sing Karaoke. On the other hand, it's difficult when the bartender, Yu, drunk from shots bought from patrons, spills drinks all over you, then decides to throw you out after voicing your complaint. The problem is compounded after the bouncers concur that Yu has been drinking and has impaired judgement. After coming to this understanding, we agreed to leave Encore, disappointed, and probably won't return.
author: Sam B.

description: OK I realize you have to be a Communist to not have fun on a karaoke night with friends, but that doesn't change the fact that I had a blast here the other night. Huge songbook and although the stage technically isn't one, it worked. It's kinda in a strange part of town, but I'll definitely come back to bust out some Marvin Gaye, or whatever gets your booty shaking.
author: Drew S.

description: Encore, how do I love you?  Like any love affair my love for you waned, but after fooling around with others I found that you really do treat me right.  Ok, so you get me crazy, sloppy drunk sometimes, but I never regret it later.  You also let me sing, sometimes as many as four or five songs, and even on the busiest nights I still get to sing at least once, unlike those other karaoke joints who tease me with drinks, but never deliver the goods.  You are also so very patient with the crazy shit I may decide to sing on a drunken whim.   This is why I love you, you never fail to deliver an evening I won't forget, no matter how wasted I may get.
author: Kelsey K.

description: The first time I went to Encore, I tripped and fell over sideways with a nice big crash right in front of the stage (the bartender even came running over to see if I was okay)... and right after getting up and making sure I wasn't bleeding or exposing body parts, I was called up to sing my very first karaoke song.  After that, how can any other karaoke experience be even close to embarrassing?  There are some places I'd never return to after embarrassing myself so thoroughly, but I have no problem returning here.  Encore is great for groups, the bartenders are cool, the drinks are strong and well priced, their song selection is TOTALLY RAD, and sometimes there's an older fellow who does harmonica solos during his songs!  Karaoke?  Yes, please.
author: diana s.

description: The crowd at Encore are really cool and very supportive. I can't hold a tune for the life of me. Coming here and drowning my insecuriies with a few beers makes me feel so much better. All of a sudden I sing, I dance and even manage to be backup singer/dancers for other people (even if they don't want it). The owners are so nice and the club regulars are always willing to show newbies like myself how it's really done.
author: Alia D.

description: I always have a great time here.  We have always gone with a big group so I'm not sure how fun it would be with just a few people though.  The owner (I think?) had an interesting rendition of a 70's classic.  He reminded me the old guy in the bar that Adam Sandler talks to in the Wedding Singer.
author: Rosie F.

description:
what the hell happened to this place? 

not too long ago, there were only a handful of older gay gentlemen slouched over the bar and occasionally singing a ballad or country ditty on an early weekend evening with the owner working the bar. i could saunter in a with a couple of good friends and have a stiff jack and coke, and go up to belt out a few cher tunes.

encore was packed with a mix of marina types and russian hillers with a sprinkling of tendernobbies this past saturday night. shoulder to shoulder, high volume, cantankerous breaths and barely intelligable songs being played over the soundsystem made me wistful for the good ol' days, but i was happy that the bar owner is actually starting to rake in business. i waited over 45 minutes for my song to come on. 

i will be back...but more likely on a weeknight to avoid the crazies.
author: May T.

description: I was here for the second time on Saturday night.  I had a great time, but I have to take off a couple of stars.  I take off one star for the KJ who was not the friendliest of people.  I also have to take off one star for the bar--somehow when we got there the soda machine was broken so you couldn't get any 7up or Coke.  Which isn't a problem generally, but some of my friends don't drink, or want a mixer for their drink.   They also said they were out of cranberry juice.  The whole thing was very confusing.  However, in terms of karaoke, it was a good time.  The space is good because it is fun and not ridiculously crowded.  However if you want to get on stage more often, make sure you tip.  Apparently that's the only way to go.  I am not sure that I love that either.  But I still had a blast and will most likely go back to fulfill all my American Idol dreams. :)
author: Lu E.

description: Performed all of my fav greatest hits here and felt like such a star. :)Probably missery on everyone's ears and looked like such a looser, but everyone was so cool about it.  I luuuurve to sing Lucky Star.  Shine your heavenly body tonight, no?
author: Anastasia Beaver Housand J.

description: I always have an amazing time at Encore.  Sin is a Saint, Chris is a doll and I'm usually best friends with everyone in the joint by the end of the night.  Love it!
author: Sheila B.

description:
it's further from my house than the mint, they have fewer songs, and the drinks are more expensive. the "smoking deck" out front vents everyone's smoke right into the bar. those are the cons.

but the pros outweigh those piddly cons. my boy Vu is working the KJ booth most night's i'm there (he's totally bringing sexxy back), it's usually slower on non-fri/sat nights so i get to sing sooner and more often. the crowd is more fun-time avg-joe's like me singing, versus the way-too-good off-broadway queens you see hogging the mic at the mint. 

everything just feels more homey, relaxed, casual, comfortable and approachable at encore. 

good times, good times.
author: Hunter H.

description: This place was horrible!!! Crappy drinks, crappy music... and an especially crappy bartender. I think his name was WU.... he had a serious issuewithme and my fiend and told us to go back to wherever we came from. Whata JERK!
author: Jeanette C.

description: I heart Encore!!!  I have been here twice in the last month.  Granted I don't sing but I love watching all of the other brave souls get up there and rock out.  I do apologize for my friends and me for last weekend in particular, when we decided to get extra drunk and became involuntary backup dancers for all of the vocalists.  Sorry we stole your thunder.  I would also like to thank the bartender who cut my friend off, it needed to be done.
author: Jessica R.

description:
A couple of observations about karaoke in front of complete strangers, aka American-style:  

- There's an edge that's not there when you're sitting in a box with friends, which is what I always did in Tokyo. I love this new dynamic.

- Alcohol becomes *much* more important, both ways. If you're singing, for liquid courage; if you're a listener, to help you focus on the non-musical parts of each performance :)

Actually, whether you're a karaoke novice or semi-pro, you'll have a good time at Encore. It's a very, very chill place, with a lot of that due to the great folks who work there. The regulars are easy to talk to, and you'll find very little attitude, just people enjoying themselves, including all-out dancing on the stage round closing time.

Later in the week, it gets packed, with wait times over an hour - it's much more reasonable on school nights.
author: Josh L.

description:
Trashy crowd. So loud. The place smelled really bad. Filthy bathroom with no toilet paper. 
 
Only plus: they had a big and updated catalog of songs except it was wet and sticky of  beer.
author: Leon L.

description: Finding this place I breathed a sigh of relief because I was wondering (silly me) whether SF would have as good karaoke joints as I've discovered in my years in Seattle. I didn't have to fear - because Encore is awesome. Just happened to duck my head in here with a couple friends that were visiting who are fellow karaoke freaks - and had a great time. Unfortunately their was a rather large unwashed person that had a more than passing resemblance to fat bastard - who singlehandedly made the entire place (which is pretty big) reek of BO. But otherwise really has everything that makes for a great karaoke bar - pretty good variety of songs, good pa system, lots of tables for your buddies to huddle around and hang out, and cheap drinks.
author: Sung P.

description:
this place ROCKED!!! 

i came here for my 22nd birthday celebration with a big group of friends and it was AWESOME. i called the day before to make reservations and when we arrived, the staff knew my name (with out introductions...maybe because i called and said it was my birthday) they had the best spot in the venue NEXT to the pool table reserved for me...i mean US..ha!  the night started off with a free drink from the bartender who also knew my name and some good times ahead.

my birthday landed on a friday night and it was pretty dead. it didnt really pick up much either as the night drew on. 

i really enjoyed my 22nd birthday here and i thank Encore for making it EVEN better! 

i highly recommend coming here for a fun/cheap night out! just remember, CASH ONLY!!!
author: Tedi O.

description: I love encore.  it's hard not to when the staff is fantastic, and they put up with my karaoke addiction.  i think i went 5 times in one week once.  i think it is my second home.  i've met some pretty cool people there too.  they have thousands of songs, and from what i hear they make good drinks too.  I personally don't drink, and that's ok.  they are cool with the sober kids too.
author: Monica L.

description: Well I have been in this place several times and it is fun.  Kareoke should be fun.  The bartenders are great!!  Basil rocks and Tony is cool.  The owner who I forget his name is also very sweet and kind, I also like the fact that it is queer friendly.  It is reminiscent of a Reno casino lounge and has a pool table and Ms. Pac Man video game table.  Music is very vast and crowd is diverse.
author: party p.

description:
It all began with a work holiday party in the early winter of 2005...

This is by far my favorite karaoke place in the city, strike that, my favorite karaoke place ANYWHERE.  The place definitely takes a little time to warm up to, but once you've found the happiness that can be Encore, you will be set for life.  

Over the years, I have arranged for several work gatherings which were held at Encore - it's the perfect place to watch your co-workers imbibe enough liquid courage so that they can get up and act the fool (perhaps even rapping every last word to 'Baby Got Back' - true story).  Once you get to know (and respect) the staff, they will treat you like royalty.  You start to notice that EVERYONE there, staff included, is there to have a rockin' good time.  

I'm not sure that any of those OTHER karaoke bars would allow the following: 

-crazy drunken friend knock's down the front monitor because his air guitar got OOC (out of control); owners proceed to announce 'it's ok, we need a new one ANYWAYS!'

-you and your closest EIGHT friends to line up across the stage to live out your dream as a cast member of 'RENT' - no judgement included

-friend hosts bday party at Encore - at the end of the night it is rumored that the entire party was dancing crazy-style up on the stage, speakers, chairs, you name it, as party-members shut the place down with 'ROCK LOBSTER' 

It's the most eclectic crowd, in the weirdest looking bar in the city (sort of feels like a lounge on a cruise ship or something...) - and it's MAGIC.
author: David M.

description: Some of these reviews are depressing.  I will say i'm not a "Regular" but i have been a couple times ever since i found this place back in march.  It was my birthday and we wanted to do some Kareoke.  It was sucha fun night from what i remember.  I got tons of free drinks and so did a few of my guy friends if you catch my drift.  The bartenders are really nice and interesting to talk to.  Everyone is very supportive about the singing so you will never hear a Boo.  And in all honesty whenever i go there i always here som really great singers, it's like getting a great show for free.  Its one of my favorite Kareoke places in the city.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Encore is great. I really love the dance floor. Sometimes it can get a little crowded and it takes forever to get your song in, but the same could be said for any good karaoke bar. And I actually did get a song in on a Saturday night. Come on a week day and you'll get to sing a lot. There are usually chill, fun people there too. And plenty of space in the bar as a whole. Cash only.
author: Jane K.

description:
read ed j's review on 9/12/2006.
http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=mUmZUl-abxpd_wk7pbdcNg&q=encore

basically the same thing happened to us.

we were a smaller group, but had around 10 people, all buying drinks.

one of our friends, who was with us, bought a non alcoholic drink, and then she was done. we were all still drinking and spending.

they tried to throw her out and we got in a heated argument with the asshole bartender (or whoever).

we all left

never go here... ever!

cant they do the basic math? 9 people spending money! one not, simply because she is a recovering alcoholic! cant a recovering alcoholic have friends? cant a recovering alcoholic occupy space in a bar? its not like she was a freeloader, asking for loads of attention. its not like she was taking up valuable space! there was plenty of room for more patrons!

assholes.
author: kyle y.

description:
it was a very special girlfriends birthday last saturday night-- (hi Rita!!!) and as a surprise we decided to take her out for some drunken karaoke after the first phase of our birthday bash which started at The View Lounge..... when we announced we were taking her to Encore she was SO excited! 

the bar itself is very low key, a bit on the divey side, good sized lay out and the crowd is diverse. laid back and not filled with diva-like american idol wannabes.(like the Mint. no thanks) i liked that no one was hogging the microphone and the DJ kept the song requests flowing. see, our birthday girl used to be the lead singer in a band (i can't say who) down in LA and we were dying to get her up on stage to witness her talent. after some Patron shots IT...WAS...ON. a few of us went up with her as back up singers.... and ok-- and i was NOT going to go up and sing. i really wasn't. not only am i a terrible singer but even worse, i totally lost my voice this week and sounded like a raspy chain smoker. ugh, but OH NO..... as soon as i had some liquid courage running through my veins i ran up to put in my favorite Pianoman request. i really love that song. of course i made about 5 people come up with me. it didn't sound too bad because they drowned out my off-key howling. the birthday girl though-- move over stevie nicks, rita radics has the mic! haha

anyway--- i can't stress enough what a fun party we had here. it got packed towards the end of the night but i can't wait to come back on a tuesday and really embarass myself. yeah, so i have no shame. absolutely none. dare i say this is THE best karaoke bar in SF? i think it is......
author: Michelle I.

description: i went on a sunday evening to avoid crowd. bar was busy but still plenty of room to find table and sing few songs. drinks were expensive and not made too well.  KJ seemed to let certian people put in more requests then others. dont plan to return and my boyfriend agreed.
author: Solstice B.

description: this place is SO seedy....as soon as i had my first stiff drink and stood under the disco ball, the transformation was complete...i walked in there an innocent karaoke bar virgin...i walked out a dirty microphone whore.  things will never be the same.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Encore compared to Mint is gold for me especially since you can bring Food in! (not drinks of course) and on Sundays  there is an Aloha vibe. The owner, dj, and bartenders are very friendly. When you go up and sing, you dont feel like there are wanna-be pro eyes judging you or just waiting for you to get off the stage so they can go up and sing. People here really root for you, for some reason. hehe.Its like a party.  I have met so many nice, random people here and I guess it just has that atmosphere. The Mint, this has never happened. I dont mean to hate on the Mint. I go there sometimes with my gay friends, but for some reason, it is harder for me to take straight friends there because most of them feel unwelcome. The dj is not that nice, or maybe he is but he's kinda queeny which some can take as itch-bay like.Sooooo.. i guess if you want to just have fun with friends who are not pro singers then Encore. But if youre a serious singer that want to be with more serious singers, then go to Mint.
author: Shayenne G.

description: DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS PLACE!! The "KJ", Brent, wasn't such a pathetic jerk. Don't expect to sing unless you slip him a $20 bill. I was there with six friends, four of whom had requested to sing. Two of them still did not get called up after waiting for TWO HOURS. Mind you, we arrived at 8:30 pm on Friday, not super late. Finally a friend slipped him a tip and our guy friend got called up to sing.  A second guy friend went up to sing with him and good ole Brent had the nerve to instruct the security guard to physically take our second friend off stage. Why? Supposedly because friend #2 had his own song in the queue right after friend #1. Such BS because the same 5 barflies had been singing over and over again for the last hour, each with the same 5 friends on stage with them. I'm not normally one to spend this much time on a review but the injustice of it all was infuriating. Never in my life have I seen someone be forced to get off stage at a karaoke bar for no valid reason and just because of the KJ's jackass power trip. Too bad because it could be a cool place otherwise.
author: Colleen O.

description: This tenderknob karaoke bar used to be called, "Tango Tango" but has recently been renamed, "Encore Karaoke". A friend of mine felt they should've renamed it "Encore Encore" and I'm afraid I have to agree. I love this place for many reasons but am forced to give it a 3 because of the hoardes of hipsters who've since taken over, forcing the decent bar folk to find another watering hole to frequent. I hate to have an "I remember when" moment but...I remember when the wait time to have your chance on stage was so short that the two people who worked there would take the down time as an opportunity to sing a tune or two of their own. You could never really tell whose turn was next because the former m.c. always sounded like he was calling out the same two names. He was either always really drunk or had a really thick accent. I never felt akward being on stage because the only people there to make fun of me were the people I came with and they were always right on stage next to me - a chorus of Bon Jovi or Extreme or Crash Test Dummies. Many a good time to be had here still, I'm sure, but its glory days have come and gone in my book.
author: Lainya M.

description: I have been going here on a semi constant basis for almost 2 years now and let me tell you...This place is awesome!  TIM and BASIL are the bartenders, and they are good ones!  They play a variety of songs here, i LOVE the people that think they can sing, and suck!  lol! Then there's the ones that are actually pretty good!  Either way place is good if you like kareoke.  Has a stage and good sound.  Multiple screens so you can sing along.  Great place!
author: Jesus E.

description: I'm asian, so you know I loves me some Karaoke! I grew up with a laserdisc karaoke machine in my home so all my skills were refined while growing up.  My voice is like an angel-- just kidding.  There is something about karaoke that I just love, and I know I'm not the only one! It's fun to make an ass out of yourself, especially after you've had a few drinks. It's great to watch your friends or strangers make asses out of themselves as well. But the best part is that you get to make an ass out of yourself and you still get cheered on!  The crowd at encore is always super supportive of each other and everyone there just wants to have a good time. The drinks are pretty cheap too.  Some nights it gets way too crowded and then it's not as fun because your group might not get to sing.  So if you're interested in singing, then I suggest you go early.  Also, weeknights are great for this place. I've also had friends who celebrated their birthdays here and the nice thing is you can bring in your own food and have a party.
author: Jade L.

description: my friend christina and I got this place POPPIN with our rendition of "so lonely " by the police. the drinks suck and the crowd is a trip,but whatever drink before and sing baby sing
author: Lauren V.

description: DO NOT patronize this place. At least one of the bouncers is a violent jerk. He has repeatedly roughed people up. Most recently, he punched a friend in the face, gave him a bloody nose and chipped his teeth, because he allegedly lit a cigarette in the stairwell. He has also been known to grab women and drag them down the stairs. The owner shows no remorse and keeps this Rambo-wannabe employed. It's sad that I can no longer visit one of my neighborhood bars.
author: L F.

description: Best karaoke I've found in SF so far. Chris, the owner, is a nice guy and always belts out a country song or two for the audience. The place used to get a decent assortment of drag queens who would put on awesome shows, but I haven't seen them lately. BUT...I was in there last Saturday night and about a dozen people came in off the street in costume (it was the weekend before Halloween) and did a rehearsed Madonna song-and-dance number. I love Encore! I usually get pretty wasted there because it's so fun. Silver Clouds is for tools, Encore is where it's at.
author: Myles Y.

description: the place is pretty amazing, i mean dive karaoke at it's best but for the most part the performers aren't too bad.  great selection of endless music titles, cheap drinks, a nice stage front and center, spacious seating, a pool table and on thanksgiving an entire buffet, i mean really.....heaven on earth, hell yes!
author: Steven K.

description: I came here on a Friday night for a co-worker's birthday and was really looking forward to a fun night of drinks and silly karaoke performances. The song book is huge, and I was impressed by the range of songs people chose. I was also relieved to see that this is not a bar that takes itself too seriously, and very few people singing appeared to do this on a regular basis. However, I felt like the KJ really put a damper on the mood, as he seemed to totally hate his job. He was surly, irritable, didn't seem to be interested in giving out information or helping out the singers, and if the equipment malfunctioned in some way, he just ignored it. I feel like the KJ really makes or breaks a karaoke bar, so my review rating is largely based on the angry dude with the computer. Maybe he was having a bad night, but I feel like there are happier places in the city to go if you are craving karaoke. I also took off a star because the crowd started to get a bit douchey towards the end of the night.
author: Mary Beth D.

description: I used to love this place, but my experience last night makes me want to never come back.  The bartenders and bouncers are cool and nice and just want people to have a good time.  However Jason the DJ was a dude on a power trip who would not play songs without huge tips.  Since it was a friends birthday I paid $30 to have a song played relatively fast since we had already been waiting 2+ hours.  A good friend who came with us was backup dancing for people, along with a group of about 20 who were dancing onstage.  When his solo song came up Jason wouldn't let him sing since he had and I quote "Already had been drawing attention to himself background dancing."  After he said that he called up a girl who had already sang three songs.  Lame.  I will not be back when he is there or maybe ever.
author: Lara S.

description: the drinks were strong.  the lonely drunk girl standing on her chair waved her lighter during u2.  the vj didn't seem to give a shit about anything.  we didn't get kicked out for drinking sparks inside.  the dancefloor is always empty and shouting "MAKE A FOOL OF YOURSELF ON ME".  excellent.
author: calamity d.

description: love it here. strong cheap drinks, great owners, love they layout, love the clean bathrooms, love everything about it. come here if you want to get ripped, sing songs you'll never remember and then get taken home by the police. don't come here if you want to win hella money for your rendition of "I will always love you."
author: Kira M.

description: Place is kind of small. Half the room isn't even facing the stage. Has a cramped feel to it. Good song selection and quality song versions. The KJ doesn't add anything to the experience. He doesn't show any personality or interest in what he is doing, even though he does a good job with sound and organization.  It's not great and it's not terrible. If I was closer I would probably come here more often because there is karaoke here every day.
author: Destiny T.

description: I've been here twice and was somewhat disappointed the first time and much more disappointed the second time.  The wait times are atrocious and the song order seems haphazard.  We put in 4 song names in about a 20 minute period, and about two hours later they pulled our third one.  The other ones never came up though the weird bartender went up and sang twice, which seems inappropriate for the crowded evening.  Also pretty pricey for drinks and cash only.  And once u get inside it's not a hole in the wall where you think to yourself, "oh what a quaint little place, I see why it's cash only..." at this place u just feel even more screwed.  I would recommend looking for another Karaoke joint if you actually feel like singing.
author: John R.

description: The staff is a complete mess. They are incredibly unprofessional and abuse their power. A group of us were there for a friends birthday just trying to have good time. The staff (including an apparent part owner) made this impossible and even took it to another level with, assaulting a couple of the guys in the group; even pinning a guy down on the ground and THEN stomping on his chest with his foot.  Bottom line is that there are much better karaoke bars in san francisco with staff who are friendly and accommodating. feel free to see for yourself, but i wouldn't waste your time,
author: Danny H.

description: I have never been escorted off of the stage by a bouncer for the sin of helping a friend sing "Tiny Dancer" before.  The KJ, "Brent", said that because I had a song coming up I could not be onstage.  This was at the same time as a bunch of people who had sung at least 4 times already were crowding my friend and singing along.  They were not escorted off. Why?  Because they had tipped "Brent" generously.  He said: "I take care of people who take care of me."  I used to love this place, but it is corrupt and totally violates the spirit of Karaoke.  Do not go here.  This place sucks.
author: Ken F.

description: Best karaoke bar in town, bar none. (and for the record, I think I have been to them all!) The song selection is expansive, the drinks are strong, the crowd is out to have a good time and the KJ is better than most. I have had some of my best boozy nights here, I think.
author: carolyn m.

description: I've been there a couple times.  Love the bar tenders, love the small pool table.  Last night though, Jason was the Karaoke DJ, and I was incredibly disappointed when we he called me up to sing my song but promptly kicked me off the karaoke floor saying that I had been up there too much.  I had been back round dancing and supporting friends and others but I had not sung a song.  I am a tall guy so I am easy to notice, so in a lot of ways I felt discriminated against because I had been backround dancing.  If I was a female, I don't think I would have been kicked off the karaoke floor.  My friends (all of whom come and tip well on a regular basis) were PISSED OFF.  One by one, my friends came up and tried to level with Jason, but he was being a very rigid DJ and would not let me sing.  I had been up there dancing too much for him to let me sing.  Strange.  Lame.  Disappointing.  We will not be coming back on any night that Jason is in charge.
author: j. t.

description: this place rules. i did gq disco nights rock freak and tore the house down. i had the ladies in the place gettin wild and the old dudes in the place gettin down. my girl did madonna lucky star and killed that shit. ended up talking to some random lady outside who was drunk and blabbed about some shit for what felt like 20 minutes. she weaseld her way into my car and said she would stop blabbing but kept blabbing. i gave her a ride home and she talked about how yelp burnz her ass because someone gave her a bad review. the conversation ended with her saying "i never want to see anyone on yelp ever again in my life" i was like "i'm on yelp." and she felt dumb.
author: Wats C.
